Reviews.Title: “Turkish Influence? Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobOxted
Reviews.Content: What a gem of an hotel the Ai Mori d'Oriente proved to be. We used the Alilaguna ferry [Alilaguna supply the best, most detailed map of Venice] from Marco Polo to travel to the Madonna Dell'Orto Vaporetto stop and walked for approx 5 minutes to the Hotel - thanks to the clear directions received. Having registered and been advised about the various tours we could book via Reception, we were surprised to be taken back outside the Hotel and round the corner to a door which led into corridor and stairs to our room located at the far end of the second floor. Entering our delightful room we found ourselves in a 'lobby' off which was a small corridor with built-in wardrobes housing the safe. Beyond the wardrobe was the door into the well appointed bathroom. Large sink with plenty of space for our own toiletries, mirror, square shaped toilet [not to everyone's taste/comfort], shower over bath with glass shower screen [water leaked onto floor through the join]. Returning along the corridor we opened the door to the bedroom and stepped onto the 'landing' with three steps leading down into the room. Directly ahead was a round table with two very comfortable chairs. The huge bed was comprised of two singles locked together - extremely comfortable though maybe too firm for some. Bedside tables with lamps were more than adequate. Opposite the bed was a dressing table which housed the very quiet bar fridge. There was a rubbish bin underneath and then in the second cupboard we found storage space with hairdryer. We were able to use this space to house our own travel kettle, tea/coffee facilities [none supplied by Hotel]. Alongside the dressing table was the usual luggage rack. The design of the windows of the Hotel are in the old Turkish style and the bed head was shaped to reflect this. The room was decorated in a very colourful yet muted pattern on the walls, bedspread and curtain materials. We did not have a view from our window; where would you in Venice? We looked onto the brick wall of the passageway which was well used so a bit noisy however went quiet around 10.00/11.00 pm so not a problem. Later in the year, the windows can't be opened due to mosquitos [we had one or two] however the room was air-conditioned. For breakfast, we needed to walk back into the main Hotel to enter the large breakfast room. The staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive - during our stay we noted the efforts the staff went to to ensure guests' dietary needs were meet. The breakfast is more than adequate: cheeses, meats, cereals, yoghurts, hard boiled eggs, fruit salad, prunes, dried apricots, fresh fruit, various breads/biscuits, cheese cake, orange/grapefruit/apple juice, water, choices of teas and coffees, butter and jams and various croissant/pan au chocolate. We loved the little rubbish bins on each table. Perhaps due to the time of year, we were able to choose our table. There are double doors leading from the breakfast room onto a delightful paved area with chairs/tables/umbrellas. Opposite the Reception is a cosy bar which we didn't have time to use unfortunately. San Marco Square/Doges Palace is a good 20/25 minute walk from the Hotel. The San Marcuolo Vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal is approx 10 minute walk and very useful if returning late at night from the Dorsodura district for example. We bought 3 day pass for use on the Vaporetto which was fantastic value for the 4 days we were in Venice. Fondamente Nova water Vaporetto stop is the next one round from Madonna Dell'Orto: perfect for travel to Murano, Burano, Torcello. Lots of good bars/restaurants throughout Venice; some excellent ones are very close to the Hotel. Perfectly placed [quiet and away from the hectic tourist area], perfectly priced, welcoming and friendly. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “easter at ai mori d'oriente”
Reviews.Author: barbara b
Reviews.Content: fantastic easter break, the huge easter egg and decorations were a lovely touch. hotel staff all very friendly and very helpful,nothing was too much for them. the tuesday ceremony off the BREAKING of the egg was good fun and we were all given a huge piece of lovely black choc!! and a nice glass of wine.Nearby very good reasonably priced friendly ristorante's IL MIGLIORE ,OSTARIA DA RIOBA,OSTERIA L' ORTO DEI MORI, and best of all!!! OSTERIA AI 40 LADRONI perfect wk end in every way..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: paulineebee
Reviews.Content: We have visited Venice several times before, and consider this hotel to offer really good value, compared to some other hotels, possibly because it is a fair way away from the tourist trails (which was a bonus for us). We upgraded to a larger room, and it was very spacious, with typical Venetian fabrics and decor. The bathroom was good, with plenty of hot water. You had to be careful in the shower, as there was only a half screen, no curtain, so water tended to spray everywhere. The bed was a large double, made up of 2 singles, and the mattress was fairly firm, which might not suit everyone. Our window looked out on to a brick wall on one side, and the back gardens of surrounding buildings on the other side, but we didn't need a view - you just have to go outside for canals, palaces etc. The breakfast was good, by Venice standards, with fresh fruit, yoghurt, different types of bread and croissants, cold meat, cheese, boiled eggs, pastries etc. We were made to feel very welcome by the staff, who were all very friendly and helpful. They recommended a restaurant, just along the next canal, which was very good, and full of locals. As it was Easter, the hotel reception was decorated with fluffy chicks and an enormous chocolate egg, larges pieces of which appeared in our room when it was dismantled after the holiday weekend. Delicious! The Alilaguna orange ferry from the airport was very quick, about 20 minutes, and drops you off at the first stop, which is only a 5 minute walk to the hotel. This ferry runs every half hour, but you have to allow at least 5 minutes to walk to the jetty from the airport. The nearest water bus stop on the Grand Canal is less than 10 minutes walk, at the Marcuola stop, and quite easy to find, just beyond the Strada Nova, which has many shops and restaurants. I would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: arzusan
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel with nice rooms, and kind persons. Breakfast was ordinary. You don't need to go there by water taxi. We made that mistake. From the train station it costs 60â‚¬ by water taxi. You can go there by water buses. It costs 10â‚¬ per person and it takes to the hotel 5 minutes on foot from the water bus stop. It is easy to rech to airport with water buses. It costs 15â‚¬ per person. It's better to walk to Piazza San Marco. You can see signs everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect for our trip to Venice. It is furnished beautifully, the staff are incredibly helpful and due to its relatively small size, it wasn't too busy or crowded (except for one moment at breakfast when we were caught in the last minute rush and had to wait a while for a table!). The location is not in the middle of the tourist attractions, it's a fair walk away, but that's exactly why we chose it. It's quiet and you feel as if you're really in Venice, not just a tourist location, and it was loads of fun wandering through streets that weren't packed with other westerners. It's also probably serviced by the closest vaporetto stop to the airport! Our room was really pretty, although quite small - so small that I did feel as if we'd paid a little more than we should have! Venice is a rather cramped city though, so I suppose diminished room sizes are to be expected! All in all, we loved this hotel and it made our stay in Venice magical.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Patty H
Reviews.Content: From reading the reviews again after I came home I can see that things vary, but I have to say this was a great bathroom. This was our last hotel in Italy and had the largest tub. In fact, my DH who is 6'5" and has wide shoulders pretty much fit in it. There was even a laundry line you could string across the tub if needed. Strangely there was no shower curtain or door so while the hall wall stopped some of the water getting out the bath mat on the far side got soaked. The decor wasn't really my type. Some of said oriental, but that word doesn't quite fit for me. The bed was 2 beds put together, but that is typical of Italian beds - I'm not sure we had just one bed in all of our 2 weeks stay. Some just came apart more than others. Several mentioned the views outside the room and lack thereof. We had a slight view, but it was fairly close to walls. Just remember that few places in Venice will get you much of a view. Breakfast was good. Not our favorite of the trip, but pretty close to it. Didn't really appreciate being told where to sit. Did really like that for our very early morning departure to the airport on our last day they packed breakfast for us - more than we could eat). I would ask ahead of time as I don't know if they do that ahead of time. You have to pay for wifi. They do have one computer that you can use for 1/2 hour free. After that there is a charge. If you use their computer make sure you log out or it keeps using your internet minutes. While the staff seemed helpful I felt more like I was a potential sale. As soon as we arrived we were told of some tours - one of which we could get for free, except for the cost of transportation home - if you know about it. When I tried to make reservations of my own for a tour I had hoped for they suggested another. There is a vaporetto stop about 5 minutes away. St Marks is probably about 25 minutes away. It's hard to tell because we kept getting lost! But that was kind of our plan for Venice. The nice thing for us was several of the restaurants in the area took VISA. We were at the end of the stay and really didn't want to go to the ATM for more Euros and get too many or few for our needs. This helped us to keep our cash costs down.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: 02sbuckley
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was lovely; perfect for a short stay! We stayed in the cheapest room and it was in an attic essentially. The room was very hot (in March!) as the cheap rooms don't get air conditioning and their positioning in the hotel means that they get pretty hot during the day/night. The breakfast was really nice, always freshly stocked and exactly what you expect for a continental breakfast, the coffee machine made nice coffees and had a good selection. The whole hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. The hotel was about a 25 minute walk from the Piazzale di Roma (where the bus drops you off/the train station) and a 45 minute walk to St Mark's Square. It was very close to a good selection of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: pallen
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a lovely stay at the Ai Mori d'Oriente hotel in Cannaregio, Venice. We thought it was a lovely hotel situated in a quieter more peaceful part of Venice but it did not take long to walk to anywhere we wanted to visit. The staff were lovely and very friendly and the breakfast was very good. It certainly set us up for the day! We wuld recommend this hotel and will come again. Eileen and Mark Pallen

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Martha H
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel as average. The room was large, quiet, had a refrigerator and large remodeled bathroom, but the room was very dimly lit and the windows looked onto a brick wall. The beds were hard as a rock and rather uncomfortable. The location was ideal for us -- in a neighborhood but within walking distance to all the sights. Breakfast was good and plentiful. The rate was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find in a fantastic city.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerIan74
Reviews.Content: This quiet canal side hotel was exactly what we had hoped to find in Venice, a quality hotel that was far enough from the tourists crowds to feel like you were staying in a residential neighbourhood but close enough to the sights that you could be in the heart of the city in a few minutes. The hotel is less than 15 mins walk to either the Scalzi or Rialto bridges and at most 20 mins from St Marks square - plus the walk along and over the canals and through the narrow streets is what makes Venice unique. The staff were all friendly, spoke excellent english and dealt with requests quickly and professionally. The room was well decorated, spacious and clean with a large bathroom and even a canal view. The continental breakfast included was varied and plentiful with the option of a cooked breakfast for an additional charge. Overall this hotel is a great choice for anyone who likes to stay in a good quality hotel, in a quiet local neighbourhood but still have the sights of the city within easy walking distance. I would return to Venice and this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff, lovely room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dorsetfisher
Reviews.Content: The staff were welcoming and very helpful. The room, while smaller than many (but this is Venice, there's not much room to expand!) was classic, elegant and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was typically continental; fresh fruit salad, fresh rolls and croissants, cereal, meats, cheese, juice and hot drinks, all very good. The location in the Cannaregio district is very convenient for the water taxis and is only 15 minutes from San Marco. The local restaurants and shops are cheaper than in San Marco/Rialto, are used by locals and are great quality.

Reviews.Title: “I still love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eurovicki
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel in 2004, when it first opened. My boyfriend and I went back to Venice this year, for Carnival, and didn't want to stay in the Piazza San Marco area where we figured it would be crowded and noisy. Once again, Ai Mori was lovely - quiet, warm, incredibly helpful and friendly staff, lovely breakfast included, and surrounded by wonderful restaurants. We stayed for 11 days and loved every one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Fraud, not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Anaretta van v
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a neighborhood of Venice, which is sold as a hotel of category four, but not true, could be three .No we liked some things that were dirty and broken, staff attention at all times is hypocritical, only to sell products ... tv is old, and pago.no internet has a good restaurant just a small dining room where you have to wait, and the breakfast buffet, very bad. Then do not recommend this hotel for such a high price, and without being central.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: adrianamh
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 2 nights at the Hotel ai Mori d'Oriente in Feb 2012 during Carnivale. The hotel is located about a 25 min walk from St. Mark's square, which actually turned out to be great as we got some distance between us and the Carnivale crowds. The rooms were nicely appointed and the staff helpful. The breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent but not four star standard.”
Reviews.Author: Alqan
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s a pity that the scoring goes from "Average" to "Very Good" as this hotel fits between the two. On the positive side; the location is excellent and nowhere in Venice is more than a 20 to 30 minutes walk away. The staff were very helpful and polite and the lobby, bar and restaurant areas were decorated to a high standard. The bedrooms are in two annexes which means that you have to go through the back and outside to reach them. Although the rooms were clean and well decorated, they were extremely small which was disappointing. The hotel is expensive which presumably is a direct result of its location. Overall; "good" best represents our experience. As "Average" feels a little churlish, we have opted for "Very good", if only for the location aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Â¡Â¡Not a top hotel,very expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: Alicewilians
Reviews.Content: It is a hotel, which once would be nice, but now needs a renovation, very expensive for what they offer. The carpet was old and dirty, the breakfast room was uncomfortable, small, had to wait for breakfast, and the receptionists were not friendly., Do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WilRobNic
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in November, 2011 and must say that we enjoyed it tremendously. Room was spacious, clean and we loved the decor. The hotel is situated away from the main piazza's, but close enough to walk to and close to a variety of restaurant. Service was great, breakfast was continental, but fresh every day. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, smaller hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jkeena
Reviews.Content: The staff were so friendly and helpful here! The rooms were pretty small but comfortable. There is a water taxi stop about five minutes away to get you around the city. The 40 restaurant is just up from the hotel and had great pasta.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarloBrussels
Reviews.Content: Having read all the good reviews on TA I was a bit disappointed about this hotel, although my rating may be influenced by the high expectations! The staff was OK, not particularly friendly but they did their job allright. The room was a spacious corner room with no view whatsoever (the two windows faced another taller building with only 2 meters in between!), whereas the bathroom window faced a roof and courtyard of some apartments across. The bathroom was spacious and clean, although we had some minor issues with the shower. The room design was just average as all the rest, nothing really wow. Breakfast was just OK, with poor selection of food, no fresh fruit juice, and coffee almost undrinkable, which is unacceptable in an Italian hotel. Location was quite nice, in the Sestiere Cannaregio, not far from the rail station nor from the San Marco square. All in all not a remarkable stay and luckily the room rate was not too high, I would probably look for another hotel if I would go back to Venice even if I would have to pay a lilttle bit more!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms and good service; a very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie300
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were very nice, the breakfast was terrific and the service was great. Prefect location in a very pretty part of the city, away from the crowds. A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Barbara S
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. It has a nice website with excellent directions to the hotel from the nearby vaporetto stop (a five-minute walk) and although the location at first seemed a ways from St. Marks and Rialto, it was well situated on a quiet side canal halfway between the train station/Piazzale Roma and the tourist center, and I enjoyed walking to and fro. There were many bridges to cross in the surrounding area, so I was glad to have a large backpack duffel I did not have to lug up stairs. The hotel itself was surprisingly luxurious, with a well-appointed, nicely designed room with Moorish touches and a large bathroom with big tub and heated towel rack and good quality bath amenities. There is an elevator and small computer room; access minutes may be purchased or might be included in room package. There is an appealing bar off the lobby (drinks were more expensive than elsewhere) and an excellent included breakfast buffet in the morning, served by professional staff on tablecloths with flatware and china. Buffet includes several varieties of croissants, pastries, juices, cheese, yogurts, cold ham and salami, and a coffee machine that makes a variety of hot beverages. The front desk staff is polite and professional and available 24 hours a day. They can answer basic tourism questions but do not go the extra mile as far as providing any information you do not specifically ask. While the staff will promote the tremendously expensive private water taxi service between the hotel and airport (100 euros!), the Alilaguna waterbus service makes a stop at 4:19 AM at a nearby vaparetto stop 10 minutes walk away (although not the closest San Marcuola stop) and is easy to find using a map (make a few practice walks over in the day and night to make sure you know the route -- everything looks different at 4 AM!) The cost is 13 E (if reserved online) or 16 in cash on the boat -- no credit cards. Print out the voucher and take it to an Alilagua booth the day before to exchange it for a ticket, since the voucher is NOT your ticket, or pay cash. The staff reluctantly provides any information regarding Alilaguna, but will check a schedule if you ask. Overall, I was extremely pleased with the design, atmosphere, value and services of this hotel and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have chosen better.”
Reviews.Author: Laari_Araujo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights and it was very nice. As soon as we get there, we thought that this hotel could be a little more closer to the city centre; but we soon saw that its location was actually perfect for people that want to see the whole city and not only its touristics sites. To get to the city centre you are going to have a good walk. I appreciated it because only by walking you can see the streets of Venice. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is delicious and the bedrooms are spacious with the exception of the bathroom which is quite small. The internet might give a little bit of trouble because it is not available in your own room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location far from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: NY-LA-SF
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the location. We stayed there in June and it was such a pleasure to go from the shoulder to shoulder crowds of St. Mark's Square (everywhere, really) to the mostly locals neighborhood of Carnereggio. Take a walk at the right time of day and you'll see nonnas taking grandkids home from school and other scenes of daily Venetian life that will make you wish your entire life was a do-over. We consulted the Slow Foods book for places to eat and found a couple great local places that were very friendly to tourists. I guess not being totally over-run by mobs of rude tourists makes people retain some of their patience. (Treating the restaurant staff with a lot of respect didn't hurt either.) I lived in NYC for a long time and I'd call this staying in the West Village or Park Slope instead of Times Square. Our view was right off a postcard. The bathtub (which had only a hand shower) was in a strange corner of the bathroom that hand an overhang right above it. Even small and fit, we found it awkward to get in and out without smacking our heads. But you're fine when you're in the tub and I'm pretty sure the original 16th century builders of the palazzo didn't forsee a bathroom in every room. Nice continental breakfast every morning and a very friendly staff. If I'm lucky enough to return to Venice, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “review”
Reviews.Author: colino762
Reviews.Content: stayed there for a few nights, the front desk staffwere a little cold but efficient, the porter was friendly and hard working. the restaraunt staff were very friendly and welcoming. the roomitself was quiet but a little on the darkside, ( as per the theme) clean,but in need of a little maintenance here and there... breakfast was a little disapointing,having had breakfast at another hotel nearby, tea and coffe from a self vend machine, not as wide a choice of breakfast items i would say more like a good 3 star hotel,not quite deserving the 4 stars

Reviews.Title: “Windows or skylights?”
Reviews.Author: Shepleyman
Reviews.Content: Ai Mori d'Oriente is a good hotel, with good staff and good breakfasts. When you book a room be wary that some have a velux loft style window and no other windows. This makes the room a bit cell like. The problem is that they don't give enough ventilation and when it rains you have to close them unless you like being rained on in bed. In our room the air conditioning only heated and was noisy through lack of maintenance. The location is good, with Guglie and Ca' D'Oro only a few minutes away. From the airport it is the first stop (Madonna del Orto) on the Alilaguna Linea Arancia from the airport and a very short walk from the stop. This stop is also a great and easy way to get into the city via the Canarregio canal. Did the room spoil our holiday? To be honest it did a bit.We stayed two nights and it rained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel In Good Location For Travelling the Waterways And Alleyways Of Venice”
Reviews.Author: DundeeB
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as an overnight stay before going on a cruise the following day. From the time we walked into hotel we were made to feel welcome. Throughout our short stay from the wee cleaning lady, to the waiting staff to the reception everyone was pleasant, friendly, polite and helpfull. Location was a little out the way of the busier areas but easy to get around once you had your bearings. Room was clean but tucked away in the back of the hotel. Not a mayjor problem though. Breakfast in the morning was continental but nicely laid out with plenty to choose from. Would be happy to go back in the future. As a wee pointer it cost 110 euro to travel by water taxi from the airport to the hotel for four of us and 90 euro the next morning to go from the hotel to the cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied customers from uk”
Reviews.Author: mpatk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after our third stay in this hotel and again we loved every aspect of being there. Delightful bedroom/bathroom, although situated next door from the main hotel for the first time but this did not cause any inconvenience, in fact, it was extremely peaceful and quiet. The chaps on reception are total experts, efficient, entertaining and talented, being multilinguial and quite capable of dealing with the odd requests and quirky behaviour of an extremely varied clientele - myself amongst them! The hotel is situated in a very quiet area, an easy and interesting 20/25 minute walk to St Mark's square and just a few minutes from the buzz of local restaurants and bars. Continental breakfast is ideal, supervised by charming staff. The bar is extremely relaxing and we called in for a drink, or two (!) most nights on return from our evening meal at restaurants reliably recommended by the reception staff. Can't wait to go back - all lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lkhscott
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Venice and found the Hotel very easily, it's located near the Madonna del Orto Vaparetto stop. Although we were too early to check in reception made sure we had somewhere to leave our bags until our room was ready. The reception staff were very helpful and gave us all the info we needed to start off our holiday in Venice. When we got to our room, it was lovely, very spaceous, clean and a lovely bathroom with fab bath and shower! Much better than ours at home! The Hotel is located about a 10/15 minute walk from the main San Marco square. We were very pleased with the location as it gave us the options to stay and eat/drink near the Hotel (which is much cheaper than the main tourist areas) or wander further afield. The Hotel is located on a canal which makes it very nice for sitting out in the evening with a Bellini or two! The breakfast at the Hotel was good, the usual for a continental breakfast although we did miss a couple of mornings due to bad hangovers! All in all this is a fantastic Hotel when staying in Venice, very good value for money. The main thing that made the trip wonderful was the Italian people and the staff at the Hotel who were always so helpful and very happy to have you there. A big thank you to Raffaele, who works in the evenings at the Hotel, a pleasure meeting him, he will do anything to make your stay more enjoyable which makes such a difference. Will definately be visiting Venice again and would make definately stay at this Hotel again or recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Morris B
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Venice and we were very pleased to have a hotel in a quiet backwater of Cannaregio. The staff were friendly, helpful and efficient and the rooms were ideal for our four nights' stay. The breakfasts were also very good and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Nels
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it is away from the chaos found in the tourist areas of Venice. Also, the taxi can stop right at the front stoop. That said I was very happy with the service at check in and during the whole stay. Our room was spacious with a nice bathroom and windows overlooking a square and the canal in the back of the hotel. Quiet wonderful neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Exotic fifteenth century palazzo.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret H
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights with my daughter. Having a theatrical background, I found this hotel to be such an experience. Built in the fifteenth century, its sitting areas, hallways and court yard, not to mention the rooms themselves, are like stepping into another era all together. If modern is your thing, then maybe this hotel is not for you. But if beautiful dramatic, exotic and different are, and you have any kind of imagination, then you will love it. It is quiet, well run and within walking distance of most attractions. Breakfast was good. The staff are helpful and friendly, although I would not go to Guido's recommended eatery again (better to walk over the bridge and turn left). My one tip would be to plan on staying in Venice longer than three days. I met several people in our travels through Italy who also said this also. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: imra
Reviews.Content: This hotel set in the Cannereggio, away from the madness of San Marco, is a comfortable, well run hotel. we had a 'superior room on the first floor which did not have a view but was extremely quiet and peaceful. The furnishings were good quality and the room spacious as was the bathroom. The most pleasing aspect were all the staff. They were helpful, cheerful and polite, the waiter at breakfast was patient, kind and efficient. Although not the best hotel i have stayed in Venice, it was very near. The 'let down' was breakfast, queuing for tea, coffee from a machine really not good. Breakfast dry, boring unappealing, croissants most mornings overdone. It spoilt the hotel, it cannot cost that much to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Honeymoon Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flanntronix
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice as the first stop on our honeymoon and were blown away with the unique and beautiful city. The hotel is located the quiet Cannaregio district and provides a great base for exploring the canals and bridges. We were able to walk from the hotel to St Mark's Square in approximately 25 minutes and there are a number of local restaurants and bars in the local area. The room was very comfortable and clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend the hotel for anyone visiting Venice and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Understated, friendly, tranquil location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: camponuevo
Reviews.Content: Tranquil location in Cannaregio, behind the "Ghetto". Spacious room & bath, friendly staff, good bfast in the outdoor "cortile". Pet friendly. 10% discount at San Marco Pking Garage should you drive to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with hotel or Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Bill T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three days and did not like it at all. There are no facilities provided and no restaurant. Wifi is charged for as is everything else. The staff seemed only interested in selling you things until you said you were not interested, then they lost interest. We arrived (late) at 9 am to be told our room was not ready. I appreciate that check in is usually much later but they did know we were arriving early. Indeed we should have arrived at 7.15 am! We were left waiting in reception until 9. We were not offered a drink, breakfast or anything else. Not a god start. It did not improve and we were glad to leave. We would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Beachdog08
Reviews.Content: Easy transfer from the airport via water taxi. Quick n& efficient check-in. Very helpful with information about the city.Breakfast was generous in a lovely breakfast room. Room very clean and the bathroom was spotless. Would enjoy returning to this hotel for a longer stay. 20 min walk to San Marco Place..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Harley_Squirrelnuts
Reviews.Content: You can't imagine what it feels like to walk into a well air conditioned beautiful hotel after choosing it via Tripadvisor. The reviews didn't do this place justice. The hotel was clean, bright and run by competent, helpful, cheerful staff. The staff was always willing to help answer any questions that we had. It was obvious that they took pride in their work. The lobby and in fact the whole hotel was bright and clean. The breakfast was great, especially if you are there before 8:00 there is room in the courtyard to eat. They actually wash the sidewalk in front every morning. The TV remote didn't work and was held together by tape. Didn't matter as we were not there for the TV! When the shower hose developed a leak, they replaced it within minutes. We came back to the hotel from 1:00 to 3:00 every afternoon when all the shops close and the day was the hottest. I found it a little odd that was the time when they showed up to make the room. I have no doubt that if asked, they would change that time in a heartbeat. I don't think the fridge in the bar worked that well either. All minor things. For the price and in the heart of authentic Venice, this was a fantastic experience. We flew in from Rome at night and so I booked a private water taxi that dropped us off at the door. It was 90 euros but worth all of it for the sake of not having to find your way through the calles at night which everyone knows are easy to get lost in. Dragging your suitcase all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet hotel 5 minutes walk from the grand canal !”
Reviews.Author: Jorge R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet canal 10 minutes walk from the Santa Lucia train station. The rooms are decorated in an oriental style. Breakfast was good and staff was very helpful. Is a bit far from Venecia but you have the vaporeto (the bus boat) five minute walk at S,Marcuola .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, decent location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: afarrell91
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not the easiest to find, but it has a pretty good location near a less busy canal with a five-or-so minute walk from the nearest water taxi stop. We were impressed with the size and decor of the room--so beautiful with a nice view of the canal. The staff at the front was helpful, and we didn't encounter a single issue during our one night stay. My only complain is that the hotel advertises free wifi, but it is only free for the first 30 minutes. This small improvement would have made this hotel just about perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelbugsvandt
Reviews.Content: We would certainly recommend this hotel. It's a short walk to the major attractions of Venice i.e. Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square, but it's in such a quiet picturesque area, a perfect retreat after a hectic day sightseeing. The room (ours was at the back of the hotel) was well furnished, clean and very quiet. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. It's only a 10 min walk from the Madona del Orte stop from the airport (orange line). We can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Immy-ski
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in a triple room which was very sizeable, with a luxurious bathroom, comfortable beds and beautiful furnishings. We booked quite early (about 4 months before) via hotels.com and managed to find a very good deal as it was in the 'spring sale'- and paid about Â£400 for 4 nights and 3 people. The location is brilliant, out of the crowds but only a 10 min walk away from the 'main part' of Venice- and situated in a picturesque, quiet canal. Breakfast was excellent, a wide range of foods (including a selection of cakes!) The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the maid even prepared out beds every evening. In addition, there was a nice lounge and outdoor seating. My only cause for complaint is that if you wish to sit outside you have to order from the bar, which is VERY overpriced- but that depends on what type of budget you are on I suppose. LOVED VENICE, breath-taking city and definitely will be returning soon, and when I do return I hope to stay in this hotel again! Recommended to couples, families, friends- anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet locale”
Reviews.Author: InKleined2Blue
Reviews.Content: The Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel is located in the Canareggio district of Venice. This is a quiet place, but convenient to just about everything. We enjoyed being away from the crowds. The rooms are spacious by European standards and include amenities that Americans will appreciate (hair dryer, shampoo, TV, Internet). An included breakfast includes breads, fruit, yogurts, meats, and cereals. The coffee machine is nothing short of remarkable. Internet is free for 30 minutes, but is costly after that (about 15 euro per day). A computer for guests to use is in the lobby area in a small private space. We found the desk staff and service personnel to be effecient, patient, and willing to do just about anything to make our visit pleasant. A word to the wise: The walls of the hotel are paper thin. Conversations and other (ah hum) night noises were easily heard through the walls.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: LKBrown
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a Railbookers tour of Italy, and as such it was chosen for us by the travel company. This means I can't really comment on value for money as it was all included in the cost of the holiday so I'm not aware of the individual rate for each hotel. We stayed for two nights. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk from the train station in a fairly quiet area but still close to restaurants and bars. It is walking distance from Ponte Rialto, and we got a water taxi up to St Mark's Square from there. It is possible to walk, but seeing the Grand Canal from the water is worth doing, and although it's about 13 euro for two people it's a lot cheaper than taking a gondola. The hotel room was fairly large and decorated in a typical Venetian style, fairly old fashioned but clean with everything we needed for our stay. The only downside was the bathroom, which absolutely stank, as if there was a problem with the drains. The smell stayed around for the whole time we were there, not sure if it's a problem with all of the rooms and we didn't bother making a point of it, but some people might find it a bit much. The breakfast was good, typical continental with a good range. The staff were friendly enough, and there was a small bar next to the lobby although we didn't use it. They also have a computer which you can use to access the internet for a small charge. When you check in, the staff offer you a selection of tours which can be booked through the hotel. We decided to do our own thing but this might be a good option as you get a guide and they pick up and drop off at the hotel. Venice is a beautiful city and I would have liked to have spent a couple more days there. Although there are plenty of specific attractions, it's such an unusual place that just walking through the tiny streets and following the maze of canals is an experience in itself. We were there at Easter, so it was really crowded, but you could still get away from the hordes by going a street or two back from the main touristy bits. There is so much choice in terms of places to eat and drink, and while a lot of them might be tourist traps, we didn't struggle at all to find excellent meals. In summary, this is a good quality hotel for tourists, easy to find (a bonus in the confusing layout of Venice!) and close enough to attractions, transport links and entertainment. I would recommend it for a short break in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable & comfortable stay in quiet canalside hotel”
Reviews.Author: southlondonerSE27
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on hotel & flight from Expedia and therefore I was not surprised when we saw our room which was in the adjacent building to the main entrance. We were in 503 which was reached along a long sloping corridor. Once inside the room was large with very high ceilings with one window well up the wall., which gave little natural light as it faced the fire escape. This made the room very dark.Bedside lights were not really adequate for reading. We had a double & a single bed, the single actually being a day bed. Quite comfortable. Linen was clean & the room was warm with underfloor heating which could be easily adjusted. The room when we arrived smelt a little damp- but this was Venice. The bathroom was lovely- good shower over full bath and marble trim. Towels rather thin but clean. Very small CRT TV with limited channels. In room safe, fridge, minibar. No coffee/tea maker. Room cleaned daily- no complaints. Breakfast adequate- but the same each day- selection of bread (no toast) cheese, ham, cereals, yoghurts, crispbreads, boiled eggs, fruit juices x 3. Tea/coffee/hot chocolate via machine. No hot food- unless you paid extra. Staff friendly & helpful & not overpowering. Excellent location, in quiet residential area full of character. 20/30 mins walk to St. Marks, 5-10 mins walk from nearest vaporetto stop- Del Orto. Lots of good places to eat nearby, although we were not impressed by the two nearest restaurants on the same street- which seemed overpriced for what they offered. The parallel streets seemed to offer more success- we used the Rough Guide for recommendations. Local off licence sold wonderful draft prosecco at 2.50 Euros a litre! Small hotel bar- I think provided hot & cold snacks- but we did not sample so unable to comment on quality or price. Area recommendations: Explore Cannaregio- check out the local restaurants, walk around the Ghetto. Visit the fish & fruit markets in Rialto. We really enjoyed just strolling round the city to get a feel of the place and it was very atmospheric in February. Getting around: Walk- its a great way to get a feel for Venice & the water buses are ridiculously expensive. Get the bus back to the airport (Marco Polo) which is 3 euros per person (single) as opposed to 13 euros per person via the waterbus. Dining: The Hotel is really well served by fantastic restaurants & eateries just a few minutes away. We also enjoyed sampling the 'Bacari' snacks available throughout Venice- which were a meal in themselves. (The Times Newspaper Sep/Oct 2010 did an article on Bacari in Venice and recommended a number of bars/restaurants and we worked our way through these- all very good!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lindac12
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in quiet area. Good breakfast and several restaurants in area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 'out of the way' hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandala006
Reviews.Content: The hotel was about a 3 minute walk from the bustling parts of Venice, but that was a plus, as it helped us to discover the city through walking. A very attentive staff, great rooms, and breakfast. The only 4 received was due to our seeing a few ants in the room, which I am not convinced was the fault of the hotel as much as the nature of the city. Would HIGHLY recommend to any friends.

Reviews.Title: “Venice lived up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: MLSibson
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 2 night/3 day trip to Venice, the city, the weather, the people and the atmophere were all wonderful and exceeded my expectations! Tip 1 - Use the Water Buses and make sure your ticket covers all days, its all about timings! Tip 2 - Buy the map from the ticket office it's only 2 Euros but worth every euro! Tip 3 - Venice isn't as big as you first suspect, it takes 35 minutes to walk from top to bottom, if you are lost ask everyone that we met/asked were more than accommodating. Tip 4 - Take detours, don't stick religiously to the map, you never know what jewels you will find

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: SannaK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at Easter. Liked the location - easy to reach from the vaporetto - I can recommend the waterbus connection from the airport. Can walk almost anywhere if you like walking. Liked the breakfast. Good service at the reception. Room clean, bathroom nice. Disliked: very thin walls - could hear everything your neighbours did. Our room 513 was propably one of the worst: window only on the ceiling, not easily adjustible.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel near from the center”
Reviews.Author: othello_ch
Reviews.Content: We found this via tripadvisor and we were happy with. The hotel is located in very quiet neibourhood and far from the tourists noise.If you stay at Venice, book this hotel. I will gladly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet area of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: bhancey
Reviews.Content: Put on your walking shoes. Nice quiet neighborhood of Venice. Good: Nice breakfast Clean and Safe. Beautiful Bathroom Bad: I think we might have had the worse room in the place. It was like an attic converted into a room. Hot, musky, no ventilation, Only window was in the rafters and not able to adjust it. To get more air or keep out the mosquitoes. No AC or ability to control ventilation. Limited Internet (30 min per stay). Room was not attended to until later in the afternoon each day. Mosquitoes. I got bitten at night and was killing them about the room. Unable to fully close the window in the rafters. If you can get this for a good price then I would rec that you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on a quiet canal.”
Reviews.Author: LMB13_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December for a leisure trip. The trip was purchased as a package so I'm not sure of the price of the hotel. The hotel was very nice, clean, quiet, great service, nice bar area. We were in Room 304 on the first floor. No complaints whatsoever with the room. Very nicely updated / upgraded bathroom. Comfortable bedding. Friendly maid service. The hotel is just a few minute walk from a Vaporetto stop. Although the hotel is a little of the beaten path, it is so easy to get around in Venice. It's just a short walk to anywhere. Plus it was great to stay in more of a "locals" neighborhood. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent experience”
Reviews.Author: graham77_lees
Reviews.Content: Refreshing old Turkish decor of this hotel gave a unique change from mundane hotels of modern times. The staff were friendly, informative, extremely professional and polite from the moment we stepped inside. Breakfast was better than many continental hotels we have stayed in. Room was a medium sized double and comfortable. Bathroom was fantastic. Would definitely recommend this hotel to couples. Transport links to the city were good being within a five minute walk of two vaporetto stops, the nearest of which, Madonna del Orto also linked directly to the airport on the orange Alilaguna route.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: MoonrakerSurrey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few minutes walk from the vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal and (in the opposite direction) the vaporetto stop on the Lagoon so it's really well located for the railway station and the airport. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfast is great. There's a lovely small bar with a friendly barman and very good prices (given that you're nearly in the city centre). All the staff we met were friendly and helpful. Only downsides were the usual hopeless hairdryer (but that's par for the course in most hotels) and rather hard pillows (but I'm very fussy about my pillows!). If I'm lucky enough to get back to Venice I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome”
Reviews.Author: paulstottuk
Reviews.Content: From the moment that pass through the front doors to the moment you leave, the service from the the staff at this hotel could not have been better. (They can plan you route however i would just try and get lost ... more fun) Book Taxi's, Gondolas, Recommend some of the best off the tourist path restaurants. Not to mention some a amazing cocktails. The rooms can only be described as palatial, they are at a very high standard and extremely clean. i would challenge anyone to fault it.

Reviews.Title: “A big country town with a charm like on other”
Reviews.Author: Cadmandan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a few blocks from one of the main shopping areas not far from the train station. Just far enough away so to be quit, but convient to everything. The staff was very helpful. The lobby is clean and the breakfast is very good. Our room was small, but clean and comfortable. We were in room 501 and it could get a little loud at night when the other guest would come in and slam their doors. No wifi, but they had a pc that you could use for 5 euro for half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location & friendly service”
Reviews.Author: AlltidReiseklar
Reviews.Content: The location is picturesque and peaceful, yet within a few minutes's walk to shops and restaurants. (Osteria L'Orto dei Mori is very close and has fabulous food.) The nearest vaporetto stop is less than 10 minutes away but walking into town is no problem (about 25 mins to San Marco). The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were very warm but as the temperature could be adjusted, that was no problem. If I'm lucky enough to come back to Venice, I'll definitely be staying at Mori d'Oriente.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, out of the way location, and spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASHMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the second leg of our trip. Having just spent 3 nights in a tiny room in Rome, we were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room here. The decor could be a bit much but the room was large with a full tub. The hotel had a nice bar, various common areas and a wide selection of foods available with the included breakfast. Things I didn't like- they want you to pay for WIFI. I believe it was 5 EURO for half an hour. This is a total rip off and should have been free. -The hotel bar was WAY overpriced. Two drinks with a tip were over 20 EURO. -The little tours they try to sell you. We went to Murano via Vaporetto for much cheaper than their tour and also booked our own gondola ride for a better price. Tourists should do their homework and not be fooled by hotels trying to make a buck. -we were charged for 2 local calls. At some point we started to feel a little nickeled and dimed. We had not expected this at $160 a night. The hotel staff was curteous and friendly. We were always greeted whenever we entered or left the hotel. Our room was very clean and we liked the out of the way location away from all of the tourists and craziness. It was accessible by various vaporretto stops and only about a half hour walk to St. Mark's Square when we walked. I would definately stay here again if we were to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our stay in Venice very special!”
Reviews.Author: oldtraveler234
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our trip to Italy, and our three days in Venice at the Hotel Al Mori d'Oriente was wonderful. We did the standard three days in Rome, Florence, and Venice vacation, and the hotel was head and shoulders above the other two sights. The hotel was beautiful and comfortable, but factor that really set it apart was the excellent staff. They did everything to assist us in all our contacts and tours, and their recommendations for restaurants were perfect. I have never written a review on a hotel before, but this experience was very special. We would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Moldy Room!”
Reviews.Author: braunwynn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ai Mori D'Oriente for 3 nights along with a group of friends. The room I was assigned (Room 305) was in a separate bldg. from the lobby and it was awful. Although the size of the room was good, the room reeked of mildew and looked sort of like a gaudy, red, closed in space. The windows on one wall were fake and the others, if the blinds were open, showed a very close wall. Given this, the windows were left closed by heavy drapes which, I think, added to the mildew problem. Others friends were located in the same building and their rooms did not, necessarily, have as bad a problem. When I asked to change to a different room, I was told that the hotel was full for that evening. As a result, I endured the room but vowed that I would never return to this hotel. I also found the front desk people to be snippy. They seemed annoyed that I did not like the room, indicating that since the size of the room was adequate that this made the room ok. Please also note that the location of this hotel is at least 25 minutes from St. Marks Square. It's really close to the area called the "ghetto". While this area feels less touristy than the St. Marks area, it's good to know its true location as I was told it was within 10 minutes walking distance and this proved to be untrue. The 1 positive aspect of the hotel was its breakfast and the breakfast staff. Both were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, quiet, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Cadmapper
Reviews.Content: I had looked at the photos of this hotel on its website and can honestly say that they need a new photographer! The photos do not do it justice! Loved the decor, both in the lobby and bar and in our room. We found the hotel to be very much like Venice itself - you could get lost looking for your room - but that's part of the charm. I have read some reviews suggesting that the staff is somewhat aloof, but I never found this to be the case. They were helpful and friendly to us (especially one very hard-working dining room attendant). The location is in a quiet part of Canaregio that is not teeming with tourists. The vaporetto station is close by, but you could walk to St. Mark's in 30 minutes. We enjoyed our stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, a real unexpected gem”
Reviews.Author: doglover5856
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a discout travel package and therefore didn't expect anything more than adequate. I was very pleasantly surprised. This is a great hotel, with very nice character. It can be tough to find, but then, so are most things in Venice! It is quiet, well-appointed and the bed was very comfortable. My room had a skylight above the bed and in the bathroom. The bathroom has a full bathtub - which was a great break from a tiny shower at my Rome motel, as well as heated towel racks. The breakfast was very nice, and included some protein - boiled eggs, cheese, meat - as well as nice rolls, cereal, etc. The hotel bar is ridiculously pricy and serves only sandwiches. The men working the front desk were nice and very helpful. It is not near St. Mark's square, which to me was a good thing. You can walk or take a boat to where all the crowds are, yet come home to a quiet, pretty neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Harmes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is slightly out of the centre along a quite attractive canal. Six of us stayed at this hotel for three nights. However my wife and I were the only couple to complain about the rooms before we unpacked. The other two couples who stayed in these rooms suffered difficulty in regulating the temperature which was invariably too hot even though it was quite cold in the city. We had a slightly better room but it had an old box television and wi-fi was not available in the rooms. At this hotel probably only about 4 rooms have a decent view. The rest look over other buildings or nowhere. Breakfast was quite basic and probably a notch below what I would have hoped. The cappucinos for example were quite small and tasteless being produced by an automatic machine in the breakfast room. I don't remember any warm buffet. The staff were corteous and generally helpful. However they did recommend the restaurant " Ai 40 Ladroni" quite a lot (Meaning "at the 40 Thieves") and frankly I thought the restaurant lived up to its name charging us 40 Euros per head for a meal with no main course, the house wine and they didn't even produce a "Ricevuta Fiscale" which is required by Italian law. We also had to wait for half an hour at the door while a table was freed even though we were told there was a spare table immediately available.

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing return after 4 years - definitely not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: 186356Verychoosy
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable stay November 2006 so, feeling we needed a short break, made a return booking. Big mistake!! We were placed in the 'annexe' off an alley which felt more like a warehouse. Had to trudge up 2 flights of stairs to an ok room but very dim, even with the lights on. Once the sun had gone down, it became chilly and it appeared the air-con control - which normally provides heat as well - was not working. Trip to reception, who did not seem surprised and said the switch controlled the entire hotel but they would look at obtaining heat from the bathroom! The plan was to heat the room with the towel warmer - still it gave them another day without putting on heat. Next day, same again cold on waking, after shower and yes, a man would be coming to sort this. Later that day, asked for a different room and had a strop saying they had not even offered an electric heater, which was then duly offered - something they had not mentioned before! We returned to the room Wed pm and not only was it hot, an oil filled rad was on full blast making the room like a sauna! Opened windows but guess who was bitten a dozen times that night! Breakfast was a cold dull affair and not even a toaster available No coffee making facilities provided - asked about hiring some and they pointed us to the bar This place looks like it's trying to provide 4 star accommodation on a shoestring but it's failing miserably. We shall not re-visit again

Reviews.Title: “Good if expensive sleep in the nice part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: MEXHAM
Reviews.Content: Located in Cannareggio - the quieter part of Venice. About 15 min walk or 5 min to next Vaporetto stop. Quiet setting directly on a canal. Hotel rooms have been refurbished recently, honoring the Venetian - Byzantine style of the city's golden age. Rooms are spacious for Italian purposes and are in good shape - bed, furniture, bathroom. WiFi ridiculously expensive. Breakfast buffet was ok for continental Europeans. Staff was indifferent, don't expect miracles. Summary: Ai Mori d'Oriente is good but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “good value, a bit of a walk from attractions”
Reviews.Author: BooksHampshire_UK
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here in early July. Location-wise, it's about 5-7 mins walk from the vaporetto stop and about 25 mins to the Rialto (I'm including time spent battling throngs) and 30-40 mins to St Mark's. Distance is fine but it's a very hot walk in summer so keep that in mind. We were not in the main hotel but in a sort of annex. However, the room was very comfortable, quiet and clean. Buffet breakfast was adequate, and good service at reception. The bar staff were a little surly but hey, this is Italy !! Overall, very good and beyond my expectations for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: crusoeonmars
Reviews.Content: In February we found this hotel, clean, comfortable and pleasant. Situated in a quiet residential area of Canareggio near to the Jewish ghetto. We really like the hotel, and encountered no problems although we didn't drink in the bar which seemed very expensive and ate out. - there are some good local bars and osterias which we enjoyed. Breakfast at the hotel was continental and perfectly acceptable, with lots of choice and fresh ingredients and the caffe latte and chocolate were delicious. We enjoyed the short walk to all the main sites of Venice, and encountered an atmospheric foggy morning, aqua alta and sunshine while we were there. It was our first trip to Venice and we were bowled over by it so, along with not experiencing anty problems with the hotel, this may influence our review.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sparky023
Reviews.Content: After a very good hotel in Rome, and a not very good hotel in Florence, I loved the Ai Mori d'Oriente in Venice. Rooms are a great size and very clean, as is the bathroom. The staff is very professional. Breakfast is a good selection. The hotel is in a great area. Nice and quiet, yet a walk or quick Vaparetto ride away from anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great residential location”
Reviews.Author: aubhi
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of September. D'Oriente is a great hotel set in a lovely location away from the noise and bustle of the tourist areas, but still close enough to walk to them. The overall hotel is excellent, all the staff are very friendly and we had really good lengthy casual conversations with many of them. Cleanliness is too a good standard overall I did have a dust allergy reaction in the bedroom but then I am quite sensitive to dust and anti-allergy tablets sorted that right out. The front desk staff are excellent at recommending places to eat and compared to other places we have stayed they wont send you to a crap place because they get commision. They will recommend genuine local restaurants and even told us which touristy area to avoid eating in so we don't get ripped off. The location is excellent. Its on the north side of Venice so the first stop from the airport (orange line to dell orto) which only took 30 minutes and then an easy 5 minute work to the hotel from the dock. From the hotel to the main tourist locations is about 20 minutes walk and we walked 90% of the time taking different routes which gave us the opportunity to view many beautiful residential parts of venice. A couple of times we did take the number 1 boat bus along the grand canal and the dock is easily reached within 10 mins walk of the hotel. The great thing about being out of the tourist areas is that the restaurants near the hotel were also not very touristy with excellent food including The 40 thieves. Breakfast was continental and a decent enough spread. Like other reviewers have mentioned, our room view looked over a small alleyway and residential apartments but we loved it. In the mornings you open the windows and lean out like the residents, hearing the local noises and you feel like a part of them rather than a tourist in a hotel over looking a rush of people. Venice itself is amazing but make sure you also venture into the residential areas for real venice and much better food. Very friendly people who are happy to chat with you and make sure you do as venetians are great company. One restaurant you must try out while in Venice is Algiubagio, its one of the best places we have ever eaten. They do food which has a twist on local dishes and from the quality to the staff is 100% perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ambergambler1
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff friendly, especially front of house. Reward these chaps with a bonjourno and nice smile and try to speak their language, even if it is only a few words. They will appreciate it. The guy I went with was neither friendly to them, nor willing to speak the language, which is totally ignorant behaviour. The hotel is clean and welcoming. Breakfast is buffet style and on peeking through to the kitchen - very clean - always a good sign in my book! I would definitely come back to this hotel. It was in a quiet part of town and far enough away to be off the main drag. However, it is not a long walk through the lovely Venetian streets to get to St. Mark's Square or the main touristy areas. Next time, I will go with a different guy!

Reviews.Title: “Can find a better place”
Reviews.Author: GR-India
Reviews.Content: Location not convenient and on first day moved us to another hotel which they said was 5 minutes away but I had to carry our luggage (with one person from hotal accompanying) and cross many bridges for a 20 minute walk with bags to reach there. This was after our long walk with bags to reach their hotel in the first place. Also the rooms they alloted us (when we went back on second day) were in a side building in a narrow lane near the main building. Rooms were ok.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location for enjoying Venice without the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Taistealoir
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel on a quiet canal in Canareggio. A short walk to the vaporetto stations of St Alvise and Orto. Excellent local restaurants which specialise in local Venetian dishes, especially fish. Quite luxurious rooms and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed views - partner loved it, I had reservations”
Reviews.Author: Linzini
Reviews.Content: Great location (easy to reach by vaporetto from station), clean and comfortable with nice decor and a vaguely oriental theme. I think I was expecting the hotel to be older in character - it is very modern inside and there were no traces of what I thought a "real" 1400's Venetian building would be like. Friendly staff, reception were very helpful with walking routes, best vaporetto routes and ticket prices. They have a few rooms which face a concrete wall (less than a foot between window and wall), and we had one of those - I suggest asking NOT to have one when you book! Mind you, we didn't go to Venice to stay in our rooms (as my partner told me on a number of occasions when I moaned about the dark room!) and there is a pleasant inside bar with views over the canal and tables outside by the canal (brought inside at 11.30pm to avoid disturbing other guests which is a nice touch) I guess being an older building explains why the sound insulation between rooms is poor - as a light sleeper I was disturbed a lot more than I would like, although certainly not in the middle of the night or really late. Bar was the most expensive of the trip (rail trip around Italy and Switzerland) - lunch was extortionate. (we found a supermarket very close by later that day). Breakfast was the least extensive of all the hotels but fine. Partner would happily stay again, I think I would prefer to try somewhere else, but would go back again if I could have a room without a wall!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel -- misses on a few details”
Reviews.Author: bigintangibles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ai Mori D'Oriente in June 2010 for four nights and our stay was nice, but not amazing. The hotel covered most of the basics -- the room was clean, the staff were very friendly and breakfast was simple, but nice (with the added bonus of the option to have it in the courtyard). However, a few things were slightly annoying that could easily have been corrected -- there was no Internet service whatsoever, and when our mobile phones ran out of charge, the hotel did not have any electricity adapters for UK plugs. The rooms were also a little worn. That said, the area was very quiet and we got an excellent sleep. The hotel is a little secluded from tourist-y Venice, but close to two vaporetto stops and a short walk from the city's main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Ai Mori d'Oriente Beware of Mold if you are allergic”
Reviews.Author: traveler12000
Reviews.Content: I am making one travel tip, although this hotel was ok at best, if you are allergic to mold it would be wise not to stay at this hotel. I am not sure if the ground floor was flooded but the smell of mold and the fact that after one night my eye swelled up and I had to go to a pharmacy to get some claritin I would recommend actually not staying here or anywhere in Venice, Venice is a smelly place and you really only need to stay one night and I would recommend a hotel on the plaza san marco because this one isn't near anything. The staff are nice and if you get a good rate I would ask to stay on the top floor but really Venice is a one night stay at most. We speant 3 days and it was overkill. We got bored. Maurano was nice. Also be very careful getting on boats, never step onto a boat without a ticket, the attendants will fleece you even if they said you can buy a ticket on board we got fleeced by the water taxi attendants and they said if we didn't pay they would take us to the police. How's it sound to you being told you can buy a ticket on board and then instead of selling you a ticket they force you to pay 50 euros each for a 13 dollar trip or they were going to call the police who most likely are in on the fleecing of tourists. Venice in my opinion although beautiful. The people are not friendly, the waiters treat you poorly and I really wish I would have known that before I got there, I would have made a better decision

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but uncomfortable bed and slightly tacky.”
Reviews.Author: solipsia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quiet part of town, yet only a few mins walk from the grand canal and main shopping street. The decor is slightly tacky (they have a bubbling smoke machine in the lobby) but the service was very friendly. The bed was bumpy and unfomfortable. Their "double" bed was actually two singles pushed together so you could feel the gap. The window faced a wall. The other drawback was that the hotel didn't have internet in the rooms, and the wifi in the bar is a steep â‚¬5 for 15 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast, friendly helpful staff :-)”
Reviews.Author: tonti3112
Reviews.Content: My fiance had arranged for us to fly out to venice and stay at this hotel the day after he proposed - it was a perfect, chilled-out way to spend a few days together. As others have said its a short distance off the main tourist route, but is an easy walk into the main shops and restaurants...so long as you don't get as hopelessly lost as we did! Definitely invest in a map! The rooms were nicely decorated in a north african style - our room looked out onto a brick wall, but that didn't matter .Breakfast was a big selection of meats, cheeses, bread, pastries, fruit...etc.. and hot drinks (amazing hot chocolate!) The staff were great at giving us tips of where to go and getting good prices for gondalas etc.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: obsd
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed in Mori d'Oriente. After having stayed in the hotel two years ago, we decided that was the only place for us to stay when in Venice. This time we spent five nights in March in the hotel. It was an even better experience than the previous time. The guys at the reception are always smiling and helpful: we got a big room with the view of the canal (ah Venice). We slept with windows open, it was quiet enough. Impeccable bathroom (although like in all the Italian hotels, good luck keeping the water out of the shower!), comfortable bed, pleasant interior in meticulous morish style, great heating. Good breakfast, great little bar for an afterdinner drink, no Wi-Fi in the hotel, but a nearby "Irish Pub" offers free Wi-Fi to patrons (we discovered this on the last day of our stay, naturaly). The neighbourhood, of course, is the best! Away from the big tourist crowds, yet full of great places to eat and hang out. Every time we got back to Canareggio after the day's march through Venice, we felt immediately relaxed and at home. Wouldn't stay in any other neighbourhood! All in all, we highly reccomend this hotel, and can't wait to get back to Venice and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, Great trip, the dream proposal”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Han
Reviews.Content: My (new!) Fiancee and I stayed here in March 2010 for five nights. The hotel was a piece of cake to find, 2m max from Orto waterbus stop. When we arrived it was snowing so no taxis or waterbuses fro the airport so we took the land bus at 3E each which was right into the centre and only took 10m from here to Orto. The hotel was fantastic, very helpful when booking (Easyjet pulled out of East Mids so flights were changed) and an extra night added. OK so it's not the cheapest of hotels but it really is fantastic value given the brilliant breakfast; great staff and quality of the rooms. On the second day all the snow had melted so Hannah and I took a walk to St Marcs, and at the top of the belltower I got down on one knee and the answer was 'yes'! We really had a great time, thanks in no small part to the hotel. The staff are great at advising on places to eat and the great places to stay so I suggest you make the most of them. Book now - this really is a total gem of a newly renovated hotel, off the tourist trail by a matter of meters but this really makes all the difference if you are looking for somewhere romantic and beautiful. Go for it - its an amazing city and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo ai Mori”
Reviews.Author: secondhopper
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel on the basis of TA reviews and, yes, it is a great hotel - clean, friendly and well positioned. Throw in a good breakfast (as they did) and I have to think Ai Mori is hard to beat. We bussed in to Piazzale Roma from Marco Polo and got the water bus to Orto on Line 42 (Madonna dell'Orto) which, with five minutes walking time from the quay, meant about 45 mins travelling time from the airport. I emailed the hotel a few days before and asked for a room overlooking the canal (not Grand!) and they gladly obliged but, be warned, it was noisy early morning but........so what. Venice is a fabulous city but study your map before venturing out; the place is a maze!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer321
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights on our way to the snow in the Dolomites. This is a lovely hotel, very friendly and efficient staff. We had a large bedroom overlooking the canal which can be a bit noisy first thing in the morning but added to the whole Venice experience. The area the hotel is situated in is thankfully free of tourists, lots of locals walking their dogs, and plenty of bars and restaurants. It is very easy to walk to St. Marks Square, and we took a different route each time. The breakfasts were excellent too. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for something a bit different and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Local Feel”
Reviews.Author: HighMaintenance01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend trip to Venice while in Europe. It was our first trip to Venice and this hotel was the perfect place to stay. Not a luxury hotel, but it had a genuine local feel and was in a perfect location. Close to the Vaparetto and an easy walk to everything. Clean, comfortable and an excellent breakfast. We would definitely stay here again. It was nice to stay away from all the craziness of the Rialto and the Grand Canal and have a neighborhood feel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel. Fab Location. Fab Staff! 10/10”
Reviews.Author: Vikki123
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend (aged 25) have just got back from Venice, this hotel made our stay just perfect! It has a fab location, about 15-20min walk to St Marks square and abput a 5 min walk to the nearest water bus. The hotel was perfect from start to finish, helpfull staff, lovely breakfast and lovely rooms. Our room was quite small and didnt have a view, but this didnt effect it at all!! The bathrooms were spotless & room service was fab!! Venice is amazing, so quiet, and pretty, local are lovely too! Avoid watertaxi's at all cost $$$$$$$ Â£Â£Â£Â£Â£Â£Â£Â£Â£Â£ Waterbuses are frequent and reliable, just check your going in the right direction as we took the correct line goint the wrong way! Ooooops!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BATH12
Reviews.Content: Real quality feel to this pleasant 4 star hotel located in the mainly residential area of Cannereggio. Professional staff and comfortable, newly refurbished rooms. Mine had no view but that was OK with me. Short walk to vaporetto stop on Grand Canal. Can be a real bargain if you search the net. Tip: Buy your vaporetto pass online and get a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Would be hard to find a better place to stay in venice!”
Reviews.Author: Nic_Calen
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights in August, we thought this hotel was lovely!, Very nicely decorated rooms,nice and clean, staff are really helpful and the breakfast was also nice. If you are looking to go on a gondola and are not looking to fork out for it (which we werent) book it through the hotel! it is very reasonably priced compared to the normal asking price. We also booked the glass tour through the hotel in murano, very good value for money, however you have to make your own way back (we got the water bus, and somehow mananged to avoid paying despite us asking the driver). We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but not value for money”
Reviews.Author: Shanmuga_S_M
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful but were like a closed cell. Windows in the first room that we got opened right on to the wall of next building. We felt like we are in a closed enclosure. For the next day, we got a slightly better room with windows opening to the back side off the hotel. But for the price I paid, I could have been better off staying in slightly outside the Venice island at a much better facility.

Reviews.Title: “A local view of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Fallaoimh
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Venice and after getting a great flight deal into Treviso airport we took the coach to P. Roma, and quickly found the vaporetto to take us to Madonna D'orta stop. Once there the hotel map pointed us in the right direction and we had checked into our room within 15 minutes. We got a great deal for the Hotel on GTA Hotels website so we had one of the smaller rooms with no view form room only across the alley. It did not matter as we were in Venice to see the sights not staying in the Hotel room all day and it was very clean, comfortable with complimentary toiletries which were great as we were travelling light with no check in baggage. Breakfast was served in a nice room with extremely pleasant staff, and set us up for the day on our feet. As we walked all day every day for the 3 days. The hotel is located in a more residential area, with plenty of resturants within 5 to 10 mins walk.
