Also, it will take you 25 to 30 mins to walk to St Marks square, but you get to see more of Venice by doing this and hey its good for you!!! I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends and if you dont want to walk their is always the vaporetto and water taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Every Way. Superb service. Very Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: ANPNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ai Mori d'Oriente for three nights from November 16-18. Fantastic place. The front desk reception was friendly and courteous. They provided us with excellent eating suggestions and good general advice that enhanced our Venice experience. The rooms were clean and attractive. The bathroom was spotless. I cannot say enough about this place. Great value. I would highly recommend staying here. I liked the location. Although it was about 25-30 minute walk to the main tourist sites, the vaperetto can get you there pretty quickly. I enjoyed the quite, mostly residential neighborhood where the hotel is located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Level of Service and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Metman66
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Marco Polo airport around 10pm and made our way to the Venice Connected desk to pick up our tickets for the Linea Arancio (Orange Line) Alilaguna water bus to Madonna dell'Orto, having paid online the week before to get a reduced rate. They said to pick the tickets up at the water bus departure point, which we did after a 10 minute walk. Water bus sped us across in about 25 minutes and after a 5 minute walk we arrived at the hotel. Check-in staff very efficient and friendly and a bell-boy showed us to our Superior room (306). Bed was very big, probably queen size and spacious bathroom had toiletries including soap bars, bottles of bath/shower gel and shampoo. No view of canal unfortunately and room was very warm as heating was on, but we turned down the thermostat. We then had a quick drink in the cosy and well stocked hotel bar. Breakfast was surprisingly good with cereals, tea/coffee, juices, selection of cheeses/meats, croissants/rolls, yoghurts and fresh fruits and the staff again were brilliant. Obviously well trained and very motivated. We stayed for 2 nights and on the first day bought a 9 Euros 'Chorus' pass which gives access to 16 historic churches. Our favourite was number 11, a stones throw from the hotel with its Tintoretto masterpieces. We'd also purchased, from the Venice Connected website, a 48-hour Vaparetto pass, which we picked up from outside the train station on the first morning. Well worth having. Jump on the number one to be taken gracefully down the Grand Canal, and remember to validate using the 'Imob' reader before each trip. Ticket inspectors were prevalent at the waterfront by St Marks square. On the last day the hotel looked after our luggage for no additional fee which was great and allowed us the whole day to explore Venice further.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel but Room 621 is too far to climb!”
Reviews.Author: funemo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very pleasant and easy to get to from the Orto vaparetto/allalaguna airport water bus from Marco Polo airport. Breakfast was a simple continental cold buffet. Room 621 was quite spacious but for my wife and I,both aging,the 37 stairs up to the room were a climb too much - there's no elevator! Our room looked into a building just about 3 feet away from our window,so we kept the shutters closed. However,the hotel's position is quite good for exploring Venice and it doesn't take long to get to the Rialto,St.Mark's Square and all the other sights Venice has to offer.. The city's restaurants are expensive and we found the quality of our meals awful and far too expensive. Caveat emptor!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, in a beautiful canal location. A real taste of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: blooms13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in one of the quieter areas of Venice, but is only a fifteen minute walk through very pretty streets from either the main train station, or the bus station. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and the complementary continental breakfast was very generous. We were in Italy to attend a book fair in Bologna, which meant on our first day we would have missed breakfast, I advised reception of this and they provided us with a lovely 'takeaway' breakfast of fresh pastries, fresh fruit juices and yoghurts, all at no extra cost. The hotel staff all speak excellent english and were really helpful, we were unfortunately mugged on a late night commuter train and had our bag with Laptop stolen, this was eventually recovered and returned to the hotel, who packaged it and arranged for a courier. There is a supermarket 2 mins from the hotel....great for those on a budget as the hotel is pricey, especially with the Euro being so high. Only one negative and that was the first room we were allocated, we had booked through Expedia so had paid a very reduced rate, but room with numbers starting in the 500's are subterranean, although a well furnished room it was not very nice, so we spoke to reception who moved all our luggage while we were in Bologna. We loved this hotel and will definitely stay again. We totally recommend taking some comfortable shoes as walking is the best way to see Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: IrishWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ai Mori for 2 nights in a superior room. The hotel is very close to the Madonna d'Orto, Airport Waterbus Orange line stop (EUR13, no discount for children). It is only a 5 minute walk from it, to the hotel. If your travelling with a large group, a water taxi (approx EUR90) may be better value and will bring you right to the hotel entrance. Our room was very spacious, very clean and well decorated. The room is large enough to house 2 adults a child, very comfortably. Our rate included breakfast and though there was not a very large selection (you can pay for extras) it will suit most tastes. The staff were very polite, helpful and speak good English. The hotel, like many others have said before, is off the beaten track. However, I think this is a plus. You'll get to see parts of Venice you may never have visited and the restaurants/cafes near by are cheaper than ones nearer the tourist attractions. The nearest water bus (Vaporetto) stop on the Grand Canal is S. Murcuola but it does not have a ticket office. If you require tickets, you will have to walk to Ca. d' Orto, an additional 10 minutes away. However you can buy the 12-48 hour tickets online, so consider this. A 12-48 hour travel card is very good value, if you intend to jump on and off to view the various sites. You can not fault this hotel, I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: kathbar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed everything about the little hotel. Along a peaceful, quiet canal, It was a welcome escape from the crush of St. Marks and Rialto. With a short walk (under ten minutes) you can reach those sites, a choice of Vaparetto stops and some great wine bars. The hotel staff was helpful and kindly upgraded us to a canal view room without our asking. We've been to Venice before and will certainly return to Ai Mori d'Orient on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: gaja_9
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room for our 20th wedding anniversary for 3 nights and we were encouraged by the good reviews. The staff were excellent but after arriving on a late flight we were given room no. 500 in the basement which I would not recommend as it was very small with only skylight windows for light. We asked to move but as there wasn't anything else available for the first night we had to stay where we were and were moved the next day to a much better room. We liked the location as you were able to see the less touristy parts of Venice and it was excellent to walk and find your way to St Mark's, Rialto etc. We kept getting lost and never seemed to go the same way twice but we enjoyed this as we saw lots of different things. Buffet Continental breakfast was good with plenty of choice and what we expected. Avoided the hotel bar due to the high cost but there are plenty of bars and trattorias on the next canal. After crossing two canals you get to a shopping area and the vaporetto stop is very near.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed despite reviews”
Reviews.Author: B_from_Quebec
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the ground floor. There were visible signs of water damage all along the wall. Our room had a view on the breakfast room. It was very claustrophopic, and there was a distinct smell of mold developping in the room from the water damage. We had turned on the air conditioner which helped clear out the dampness in the room. However, while we were out, the chambermaid turned it off and sprayed some horrible smelling room deodorizer. When we came in at the end of the day, we almost suffocated with the stench of the spray. Also, the beds are not for married couples. 2 single beds together but made separately. Not very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Charming slice of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Spines
Reviews.Content: We were going to be going on a Holland American cruise leaving out of Venice and wanted to spend one night ahead prior to embarkation in Venice. Evidently hotels in Venice do not like to do one night reservations and I went through multiple hotels until our travel agent found us this one. Agreeing with the previous post, 'although not inexpensive', we found it definitely worth it. The staff was very helpful, the directions from the Vaporetto stop from the airport were very precise, and the rooms were beautiful. At first I was worried that it was too far from the touristy areas, but that actually made it a benefit. We got to see more of 'real' Venice, and walking anywhere in Venice is an adventure. The rooms were very luxurious and when looking at the picture of the front of the hotel, ours was right over the canal. We didn't have any trouble with canal noise at night the way I read other hotels had issues with. Breakfast was included and was very tasty. We would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Moorish and moreish ...”
Reviews.Author: Mipanko
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in June/July 09 based on a deal from Lastminute for Â£303pp although we upgraded to a superior room for an extra Â£40 each. The room itself was fair enough (not big) although I didnâ€™t feel it to be â€œsuperiorâ€� but then we couldnâ€™t compare it to any others. The room looked out onto a small overgrown jungle-like area, but we kept the windows and curtains closed because of the air conditioning which was really needed in the heat. The bathroom was lovely and clean and I think newly installed. We found the staff to be pleasant and helpful. We also were recommended the restaurant of 40 Ladrone by them but on arrival were not impressed by it so did not actually have a meal there. Basically restaurants not on the main road will probably offer better value. A nice pizzeria is Al Faro in Ghetto Vecchio. I had a mushroom pizza with all different types of mushrooms â€“ yum! Breakfast is more than adequate and the staff are efficient at making the small area run smoothly through the sittings. Various fruit juices, cereals, cheese and hams, croissants, yoghurts will set you up for the day and I can highly recommend the delicious fresh fruit salad. Guests have been divided about the location of the hotel, but we preferred to be away from the hustle and bustle and yet it is still only about 10 minutes away from the main thoroughfares of Lista di Spagna and Strada Nova. It still is, however, a good 30 minutesâ€™ (slow) walk to St Markâ€™s Square and the vaporetto will take 45 minutes. On the other hand, the hotel is well located for a trip to the island of Murano (a must for glassware shopping â€“ although you will be â€˜glassy-eyedâ€™ by the end of it all), with the nearest vaporetto stop being Orto, five minutesâ€™ walk from the hotel (once youâ€™ve negotiated the meandering roads and know where you are heading). Check the hotel website for directions. Generally, had a lovely time in Venice â€“ pizza, pasta and ice cream every day â€“ came back with fewer euros and more 'pounds' ;-) ...

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolMap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights it was a really nice hotel, room we had was quite large very nice decor, Hotel staff very friendly, breakfast not bad, 10 min walk away from lots of shops,bars,restaurants ideal location for city break would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay in a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: RWGEngland
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights, having booked it through easyjet hotels website. Location perfect, get the orange waterbus from Marco Polo airport and get off at the Madonna d'Orto (1st stop). Costs 13 Euros each. Walk to hotel is 5 mins, good map and instructions on the hotel website. The hotel was fantastic, staff very pleasant and helpful. Very stylish hotel, room was a good size, very clean and great showers with plenty of hot water. Breakfasts plentiful (breads, cheeses, ham, croissants, cereal, juices) but you could buy a cooked breakfast if desired. Lovely 15th century building on a quiet canal away from the hustle of St. Marks Square. Feels like you are in the 'real' Venice. Less than 5 min walk to the main shopping/restaurant area of Canneregio and 20 mins walk to St. Marks Square (fantastic but pricey). Had the nicest pizza ever at Campo St. Margarita in Dorsoduro district - Restaurant al Sportivi, bit of a walk to it but its just lovely wandering the streets. Buy a decent map!! The one thing that we wish we had have done is to ask the price of 2 small beers (half pint size) at a corner snack bar off the beaten track......18 EUROS! we did seek out the price list after getting stung for that but it didn't spoil such a fantastic holiday. Yes, Venice was quite expensive because of the exchange rate but as long as you are prepared not to get bargains galore that's fine. Having said that most shops have sales on because of fall in custom. Staying just that bit further away from San Marco means you get more for your money in our opinion. If you want to see the real Venice, walk everywhere, there is always a fantastic view around the next corner. An amazing holiday in a gem of a hotel, perfect for relaxing, celebrating the big 4-0 and seeing the real Italy but not too far from the hustle and bustle! Highly recommend it. Will definitely return to Venice and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Venezia!”
Reviews.Author: valadin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and I'm so glad! This was a wonderful hotel. The staff was helpful and intuitive. The breakfast was the best we had on our trip. We found a nice osteria about a block from the hotel (upon recommendation of the concierge). The vaporetto stops are near. The hotel took us to Murano for a tour of a glass-blowing facility for 5 euro each! We found some great souvenirs there! I've always loved Venice and this hotel made it even better!

Reviews.Title: “Bellissima Venezia!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nids
Reviews.Content: Wow what a truly amazing time we had in Venice. My partner treated me to a wonderful few days in Venice for my birthday and we had a truly romatic leisurely time in Venice. Firstly Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel was situated in a beautiful part of the city. Away from the tourist areas and with the real local people of Venice. We found a small bar/restaurant close to the hotel (the next street in front of the hotel) called Timon!! Perfect place for a great glass of wine and cicchetti (a kind of tapas) sat outside watching the world go by, early evening or on the way back to the hotel. The best way to experience Venice is of course either by the bus boat and to walk around as much as you like and "get lost" in all that Venice has to offer... walking over lots of narrow streets, tiny bridges and town squares. We had lots of fun in the casinos, bars, restaurants. A totally wonderful experience was to be had at the restaurant at Hotel Cipriani "Cips Club" where you call the skipper from the port and he comes over to collect you - lovely guy who we nicknamed "Captain Birdseye" haha!!! I cant really explain in words the experience that Rome has to offer but it really is like stepping back in time... One of the best experiences of my life... thank you - never to be forgotten

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a quiet part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: SeptemberBaby
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on a triple room from Airfare.com (later found a better one on 1800hotels.com). We got the room (#1) with a view of the extra breakfast room. I think this is the breakfast room they use for the tourist groups since it was barred when we got to the main breakfast room later that morning. Initially, a porter brought us to our room to show us. We didn't bother opening the curtains to see out the window, so we informed him the room was fine and he went to bring our luggage and keys. In the end, we only came back to the hotel to sleep so didn't mind the nonexistent view. The continental breakfast was the best we had in Italy. They had meats, breads, pastries, fruits, yogurt, cereals and juices along with coffee, tea, and hot chocolate upon request. The hotel is located not too far from the vaporetto stops. Close to the hotel right after crossing a bridge, going towards the San Marcuola stop, is a grocery store where you can get a 1.5 lt of bottled water for around 0.50 euros. The kebab place further along the way is run by a very friendly man with food at cheap prices for Venice. The reception staff was friendly and spoke English well. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place for a romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: gosnowcrazy
Reviews.Content: Being whisked away to Venice on a surprise trip for 2 days is every girls dream and arriving at this hotel through desserted walkways, walking into reception and up to the stylish bedroom made this dream even better. Flowers, champagne and strawberries on arrival already in the room were magnificent and delightful. I would say this is one of the best hotels I have ever seen, away from the madding crowd, quiet, very romantic, gorgeous furnishings and excellent service. A tiny balcony (the only negative) gave a photogenic view of the canals. The 10 minute walk into the touristy areas was fine and the hotel offered a pleasant respite after a day doing the touristy thing. Of course being proposed to on the steps of the Basilica in St Mark's Square made the trip even more memorable. A gondola ride back was just as memorable since some of the bridges were quite low, or rather the water was quite high. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel if you are looking for all of the above in your experience in Venice, can't guarentee a proposal though!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Heaven”
Reviews.Author: tarastreet
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Venice and wow! No better place to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. From the moment we arrived to the day we left, it was like being in a fairytale. The hotel was great. We didn't take any of their trips on offer. No pressure from the staff at all. Anyway, you don't need to because it is so easy to get round by the vaporetto and of course, on foot. Two places to eat near to the hotel are Bentigodi just off the Rio T Farsetti and one you may easily walk by and dismiss as your bog standard take-away BUT...read on. We were in a hurry to watch the United v Porto match one night (I know, but we have been married for 25 years!) and after a hard days sightseeing needed food quickly. I had walked passed this place nearly everyday and the owner was either inside or on the doorstep chatting and smiling to the local people and also had given us a friendly wave, so I thought let's grab a bite from there. A great decision. This man and his wife have been in Venice for only a month. His wife has a degree in catering and he has degrees in accountacy. They do lots of different food, pizza etc., but we decided on a kebab and a large bottle of beer. We both agreed it was the best kebab we had ever had. Beautifully made and presented. We were having such a nice time chatting to Mr Rahman and his wife that we missed the first 15 minutes of the game. Ten euros for two large kebabs and a large bottle of beer in Venice - fantastic. If you get a chance, please do go.

Reviews.Title: “A cracking little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rockside17
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for three nights in April. Some reviews say that this hotel is too far away 'from the action'. I don't agree. This is a lovely hotel in a quiet part of Venice. If you have stayed in Venice before you will know that the crowds can be claustrophobic. This is a haven of peace away from the maddening crowd. I thoroughly recommend it. The hotel is easy to reach from Piazza Roma. The 'how to find us' directions on the hotel website are accurate - a five minute walk from the San Marcuola vaporetto stop or a 10 minute stroll. Of course, if you know your way round Venice the walk from Piazza Roma or the the train station (three minutes over the bridge) will take no more than twenty minutes. This is a good little hotel with little to fault it. We booked rooms through lastminute,com and got some really good rates. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Nothing seemed too much trouble for them, Breakfast was excellent and lots of choice. The rooms were not large (not sure if they have large rooms in Venice) but they are beautifully furnished and have fridge and tv. The bathrooms were definitely 4 star with plenty of hot water. We had two rooms - one standard and one superior. My friends had the superior room (110) overlooked the small, peaceful canal outside, It was lovely. The other room (room 2) was furnished to the same high standard but was slightly smaller. It's only drawback (and not much of one at that) is that immediately outside the window was the breakfast room - with tables only about 5 feet from the window. It was a bit of a shock on the first morning when, semi naked, I threw back the curtains to see two happy tourists enjoying their breakfast. However, with so much to see in Venice I didn't spend much time in the room so it didn't matter to me. I am sure that if I had asked to change the room the hotel would have been happy to do it. But if this is important to you either go for a superior room or let the hotel you want a room with an outside view. I didn't try the hotel bar but and didn't check the prices because I know from experience that hotel bar prices in Venice are always ridiculous! Instead when we wandered home past midnight we'd stop at the little bar just to the left of the last but one footbridge you cross before reaching the hotel. It stays open late, has tables outside and the prices are half those you would pay near San Marco. Perfect for a nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotraveloften
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just spent 6 nights at Ai Mori D'Oriente in Venice. The hotel room and bathroom were clean. Our room was large for European standards. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. It is less than a 10 minute walk to two different vaparetto stops. There are good local restaurants about 4 to 5 minutes away. We also walked from our hotel to the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's Square areas of the city. (If you want to walk less, then take the vaparetto). The area around the hotel was a very quiet, non-tourist area. I would gladly return to this hotel for any stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Lorien77
Reviews.Content: We had hoped this hotel would be a great find, being away from the hustle and bustle, but it actually seemed too out of the way for us and it was hard to locate. On the public transport boats, it took at least 30 minutes to get there from the city center and the boat rocked so much (and was so crowded) that we hardly wanted to go out again after the first day. Our room was very hard to get to (we got lost every time we tried to find it) and it was in the basement! There was mold growing in the bathroom covering half of one wall. I find it hard to believe that nothing would be done to fix that glaring problem. The staff was not friendly to us and when we checked out they never even inquired whether or not we had enjoyed our stay. We were so glad to get out of there, we didn't take the time to complain, but we should have.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, top place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Peaf79
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for the first time and after a look on trip advisor plumped for this hotel. As it was a surprise present the pressure was on for it to deliver - upon arrival it almost didn't......... We arrived late at night to a friendly greeting, and shown to our room which was very spacious, well decorated and clean. However it was quite warm so decided to open the curtains only to find our windows opened directly in to the restaurant/breakfast room! Not ideal. I think perhaps it was an easy access room. However a quick word with reception and they sorted us out another room for the next day. Very helpful and didn't seem to mind us changing rooms at all. Really well positioned. Easy access to the Waterbus and away from most of the crowds. You can easliy get to anywhere in Venice via the waterbus so we didn't think it's position was a problem, more of a bonus! Venice is an expensive city to say the least but I would echo what others have said about avoiding the hotel bar! There are some nice restaurants to eat at around there so worth considering when planning your evenings. We also got engaged on the little bridge nearby so it will always have a special place in my memory! I would return to this hotel without question, just have to let the credit card breathe for a little while first!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: MKKB217
Reviews.Content: We just adored this hotel. Traveling w/ a 7 year-old, its location in a nice, quiet part of town was perfect during busy Carnevale. Vaporetto stop a quick walk away, which puts Venice at your fingertips. A number of stores right near, which allows for the snacking necessities of a 7 year old. Staff at front desk was the best! Very helpful and always made our daughter feel special. Breakfast is excellent. We would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended: Hotel with character conveniently located away from tourist traps.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Couple_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in late Jan 2009. Location This is a lovely hotel in a quieter part of town with a community feel to it. The hotel is in the Cannaregio area away from the tourist trap but within easy walk to the Rialto Bridge (10-15mins walk alone Venice's main shopping street) and to San Marco (20-25mins walk alone Venice's main shopping street). There is a lot to see on the walk to these areas so it doesn't feel that long at all! The hotel is surrounded by local Venetians going about their daily business â€“ you will feel that you are a million miles from the tourist traps. The hotel is 5mins away from the main shopping street, where you can find many wonderful cafes, restaurants, mask shops and cake shops. It is also very close to a local supermarket and the local shopping street. Room The room was a good size and clean. Bathroom was also clean and was of a good size. Our room had a small window. Hotel If you stay in rooms 510- 513 (I think) as we did, you will encounter a peculiarity of the hotel layout. To get to these rooms, you must first walk up a flight of stairs (or take the lift to level 1), then go down a flight of stairs then once again walk up a flight of stairs (the last 2 flights have no elevator options). This was not a problem for us but if you are short of mobility this may be a nuisance. However this was the exception to the rule as most of the rooms are located easily from the same level as the lift. The staff at the hotel where very helpful and always willing to be of service. Breakfast Breakfast was the usual buffet continental fare. Good selection of bread with chesses and ham/salamis, croissants, fruit, cereal, yoghurt, juices, Tea, coffee and Hot chocolate. The hot chocolate is a must try â€“ its rich using dark chocolate! A hot breakfast option is also available. How to get to the hotel Although it is possible to safely walk (via Venice's main shopping street) to the hotel within 10-15mins of the Bus station (Piazzale Roma) or Train Station (Santa Lucia), it may be an idea to take the Vaporetto (water bus) if you have not been to Venice before. Even if you have, like everywhere else in Venice it is a challenge to get to a specific address the 1st time. This is part of the Venice experience! While it is sometimes stressful trying to find your hotel when you are travelling, in Venice you will get lost/disorientated, so just go with it and you will have a better Venice experience. If you arrive in Venice from the Bus station (Piazzale Roma) or Train Station (Santa Lucia), there are 2 options to get to the hotel via ACTV water buses (vaporetto). 1) Take Line 42 or Line 52 to Orto stop from either Piazzale Roma vaportetto stop or Ferrovia vaportetto stop (right in front of the train station), 250 metres from the hotel. Once at the Orto vaporetto stop, keep going straight on calle Larga Piave until you reach Fondamenta della Madonna del Orto. After which, you will keep going to the right, along the Fondamenta della Madonna del Orto, cross the bridge to continue on calle Loredan. At the end of the calle, turn left and you will find the hotel. 2) Alternatively, you can take the vaportetto along the Grand Canal to San Marcuola stop by taking Line 1 or Line 2 from Piazzale Roma or the Train Station. Once at the San Marcuola stop, it is a 15min walk to the hotel. Head to the right of the church and turn left behind the church. Turn right, and keep going straight (passing an intersection with the main shopping street â€“ at this intersection you should see a small sign to the hotel), until a wooden bridge. Go over the bridge, turn right, then turn left at the first lane (with a blue sign), at the end of the lane walk over the bridge and turn to find the hotel. If you are arriving from Marco Polo Airport, you can take the ACTV vaporetto Line A direct to Orto stop. Follow the directions above from the Orto Stop. Overall this was a great hotel in a great local area with easy access to restaurants, cafes, shops as well as the tourist sights around the Rialto Bridge and San Marco. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, But Far From The Action”
Reviews.Author: brooklahn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ai Mori d'Oriente during our honeymoon this past August. While the stay was a positive one overall, there are some things that I would caution people against. First, the positives: The hotel's decor is unique and beautiful, and the staff keeps it immaculately clean. Lots of marble, and persian spires. The staff are very nice and friendly, and we recieved very nice service. We were in Venice for just two days, at the end of a two week honeymoon, and were looking forward to packing as much sight seeing in as possible. Unfortunately, the hotel was located in the Jewish Ghetto, which is a long walk from just about anything that you'd be interested in seeing. This significantly cut into the time we were able to spend at the big landmarks. The walking didn't end when we got to our hotel, either. Our room was located up a very narrow staircase only accessible through a long winding walk through the hotel and the next door building. While the bellhop managed our bags on check in and check out, I can imagine that the room would be a problem for older guests or people travelling with young children. Finally, the hotel's bar was incredibly overpriced (15 Euro for a glass of wine!), and served some pre-packaged, disgusting desserts. While the hotel is a nice one, we wouldn't go back on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CanberraAustralia
Reviews.Content: Venice was our first stop in visiting Italy for the first time and from the moment we arrived at this hotel we fell in love with it instantly! The rooms were a good size, as were the bathrooms, and it was very clean. We had a lovely view of the canal at the front of the hotel and it was also quiet. All of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, making our stay in Venice very easy to get around and the oppourtunity to see things we may not have discovered on our own. The breakfast room was clean and inviting and after spending long days out exploring, we would return to our hotel room to find our beds turned down and the heating turned on, making us feel that we had been thought of and felt very taken care of! I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again next time I am in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great place away from the tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: GingerTravellingScot
Reviews.Content: A bit out of date but we stayed at this hotel in October 2007 in a fantastic double room on the upper floors at the rear of the hotel. As everyone else has already said this hotel is a good 5-10 minute walk away from the heart of Venice but we felt this added something to the experience walking along the canals in the dark after a good meal! The best way to see Venice is to simply walk around - if you spend all the time looking at a map you will get very lost! We never felt unsafe walking around Venice even in the dark. The hotel room was very large with a great double bed, desk and a wardrobe with two windows overlooking the canal to the rear fitted with traditional shutters. The bathroom was reasonably modern, very clean and spacious. If we went back to Venice we would definately stay at this hotel again as it a friendly, clean and spacious hotel (and we felt it was excellent value for money in Venice).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a really lovely location”
Reviews.Author: TeresaBee
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal on this hotel (Â£53 per night including breakfast) because it was late November - i.e. nowhere near the height of the tourist season - and because we booked very early. We were very pleased with the hotel, which is really beautifully furnished and decorated, and the staff were efficient and helpful (although we did have to ask twice for our shower to be fixed). Breakfast was excellent and the room was smart and comfortable - the only downside being that it was on the ground floor of one of the hotel's annexes and faced directly on to an alleyway at the back of the building, so we had to keep the curtains closed otherwise curious passers-by kept stopping to peer in! Also the main part of the hotel (breakfast room, bar and reception) are connected to this annexe by a covered walkway which can be absolutely freezing at this time of year. The hotel is in the district of Cannaregio which was by far my favourite part of Venice - very pretty and with plenty of nice shops and bars, but at the same time quite quiet and un-touristy. The main tourist attractions are in easy walking distance, and it's also not far to walk from the Fondamente Nove water-bus stop, the train station and the coach/taxi terminus at the Piazzale Roma. One word of warning - go to one of the local bars for a drink rather than the hotel bar, as it's quite expensive. We had a drink there on the first night, as we'd arrived late, and it cost us 13 Euros for a beer and a glass of wine - you should be able to get the same for about half that price elsewhere. There are plenty of good places on the Strada Nova a couple of streets south of the hotel, although you can't seem to be able to get a good quality dinner in Venice unless you're prepared to pay a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTravelB
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful spot to stay in Venice. The hotel is exceptionally clean, with lovely decor, and wonderful staff. While in walking distance of St. Marks Bascillica, and Doges Palace, it is tucked away on a quiet yet safe canal, suitable for even a late evening stroll.

Reviews.Title: “a sweet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trixia
Reviews.Content: the hotel is sweet & adorable. it's in a great location, out of the way of the main centre of venice, which tends to get crowded and noisy. this place is easily reachable via vaporetto (the public transit system), with a 10 minute ride, then five minute walk. there are some restaurants in the area, but you may have to make the 15-20 minute walk into the main area. the hotel rooms were decorated really cute and the small hotel restaurant and bar were always staffed and stocked. as venice is INSANELY expensive, down the small alley over the bridge in front of the hotel, there's a small grocery store that's got everything you need for a snack, including large bottles of water for 0.55 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendymar
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, quiet hotel. Disappointing room which had a brick wall as a view. Tried to change but would have had to pay a supplement. Lovely little bar, excellent service. Good value breakfast. Recommended. Directions to hotel quite confusing!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daisyjinx
Reviews.Content: Having booked on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews, we spent 3 nights at the Hotel ai Mori d'Oriente & were very pleased with our choice. - so thanks. The hotel is well located by a narrow canal. The staff were very friendly & helpful, our room was clean & comfortable, the bathroom small but with modern fittings and a good shower - what more do you need? Breakfast was fine & the service good. We would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and gracious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Micara2
Reviews.Content: We had only one night to spend in the lovely Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel this past Saturday night. Set in Cannaregio district, this hotel had all the amentities, a gracious staff, a wonderful breakfast, and broad clientele. Thanks to Trip Advisor for reviewing this hotel and giving us the idea to book here. I would go back to the hotel and certainly to Venice in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sashaann
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at hotel and had a great relaxing stay. We had a standard double room which had a roof "terrace", however it was located close to the laundry area and was a little noisy from air con unit which offset the bonus of the terrace, but that was fine and did not cause any discomfort. The room was on a corner and detatched so no noise from neighbours. Breakfast was great and while the usual had a great selection and very filling. Best thing about the hotel is location, in a quiet area away from tourist crowds but only a few minutes walk to restaurants and shops and lovely local eateries. Also close to Orto Vaperrato stop which connects easily to all locations and direct route to Murano. I would highly recommend the hotel and the venue - unless you love being in the middle of millions of tourists :0) and every where is really easily accessible. We walked to the piazzala roma for bus service to airport but best to "water bus" it until you get your bearings!!! Tips: drinks are really expensive anywhere but astronomical at hotel bar! get a three day bus ticket at airport which is for ACTV bus/waterbus so you need to get land bus to Venice, this is really easy and you see another part of Venice. Departs from stop number 5 right outside the terminal. We got confused not realising there was more than one waterbus service and the Ailanguna service which runs from the airport has to be paid for seperately (we queued for ages then realised our ticket was for the bus!). Personally we dont feel it is worth the extra euros and the normal bus from the airport was easier and just as quick, runs more frequently. We were only asked to show our 3 day ticket once at Rialto so seems to run on honesty! stray away from the touristy areas, much quieter and nicer and you discover something new everyday. Visit outer islands, Burano worth a quick visit for the bright houses and quirky feel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Turnipster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oriente in September. Had a fabulous time in Venice, and the hotel only added value to our stay. I think we stayed in one of the budget rooms (we booked through Otel.com and got a really good rate), but it was fine. The bathroom was better - modern and clean - I don't think you can ask for more than that. We stayed with our 10 month old daughter and they catered well for her. The Hotel is in a lovely part of Venice - one of the best neighbourhoods in my opinion. The locals were all friendly and there are some great restaurants (in particular Vesuvios (surly waiters, but to be honest we thought that made it more enjoyable!!) and La Fondamenta - excellent fish & steak. We will definitely consider staying at this Hotel the next time we are in Venice. Ciao!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GinaM-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at Hotel Ai Mori'oriente in gorgeous Venice. I had been to this hotel twice before and had loved the location and exotic decor. The hotel still retains a charm and interesting appearance and is a bit off the beaten track where delicious and less expensive restaurants abound in an area just near the Venetian Jewish ghetto, a part of Venice worth exploring. However, we found the staff to be overall somewhat aloof...nothing concrete to point at, just a general lack of friendliness or warmth, especially considering this had been my third time in four years to this hotel. The only interest the hotel concierge showed to us and our family was to try to sell a tour to Murano for the day. As a result, I have decided not to return this hotel when I visit that jewel of a city. Worth mentioining in addition is that although the rooms are clean and very lovely, the beds were extremely uncomfortable. The breakfast room was pleasant and the food more than satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: alsky
Reviews.Content: We went to several places on our European adventure and my husband was responsible for finding/booking the Venice hotel room. I was skeptical b/c he said it was somewhat out of the main tourist area. Well, he did an excellent job and this was the best hotel of our trip! Don't get me wrong--it's not a super luxurious hotel, but it is a clean, pretty, friendly hotel in a wonderful area. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, the room was cozy and beautiful, and the area was quiet and beautiful. After traveling around Europe for two weeks, I was thrilled to NOT be staying in the middle of the tourist area! It was only a 15-20 minute (great) walk into town and as soon as I got there, I wanted to go back "to our neighborhood!" The restaurant they recommended was wonderful--we went twice! If you stay at his hotel, you get a real taste of italy and Venice. And don't worry--it is extremely safe. It is highly recommended! Only problem was that the internet/computer did not work, but who needs the internet?? :) My only recommendation is that they update the directions to the hotel on the website--we got lost trying to find it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markandchris
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel to be told there was a problem with the electrics in the room. They arranged for us to stay in a nearby hotel room for 1 night and collected and delivered our bags to and from the new hotel. For the inconvenience they upgraded our room for the remainder of the the stay and gave us a complimentary basket of fruit. We stayed in 5 hotels during our stay in Italy and this was easily the best. The standard of the rooms were very high, breakfast was of good quality and the staff were extremely helpful. Even with the inconvenience of the first night, I would gladly recommend this hotel. It is near to the vaporetta stop (although it is quicker to walk to the sights), in the residential area of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to the honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline J
Reviews.Content: As this was the first destination on our honeymoon, the pressure was on for this to be a good choice. Having already read the reviews, we were still apprehensive, but there was no need to be. This hotel was a great start to a fantastic holiday and just what we hoped for. The location is lovely. It is on a quiet canal in one of the residential suburbs, but is just 5 minutes walk to a water taxi stop. This means that the distance from the main train station or the drop off point for the mainland buses is not a big deal. We made life difficult for ourselves and dragged our cases from the airport shuttle bus to the hotel, but I recommend familiarising yourself with the water taxi's, buying a decent length ticket (we ended up buying a 36-hour one much later) and then saving yourself the struggle! The hotel was very welcoming and after a hot battle with our cases, was lovely and cool, with excellent air-conditioning. Our room was reached through a labryinth of corridors, but with the aid of a friendly porter who managed all luggage and direction for us. Once in the room, it was very comfortable, with an additional daybed, lots of space, both large wardrobe and bathroom, and all the usual amenities you might expect from a hotel of this standard. There was an internet access point near the lobby and a lovely bar with a friendly barman manning it. The staff were all helpful and knowledgeable, able to direct us whenever needed. Even at breakfast we were greeted with charm and smiles. The complimentary breakfast was good - slightly more extensive than the usual continental breakfasts at other places stayed in by either of us previously, and the fruit flan was a definite bonus for me personally. Overall this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Veneto”
Reviews.Author: cpgins
Reviews.Content: This place was great. Away from all of the hustle/bustle but a 5 minute walk from the shops, farmers market and gelatto! The staff was fabulous. We were there 3 nights. The breakfast was fairly good-continental. Only one warning. They put us in rooms in the 500 section which was underground almost-like being in a basement. No view. Granted we were gone most of the day but an evening view would have been nice. I had booked our trip and requested upper levels 3 months prior. Otherwise the place is clean, beautiful and quiet. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Littleone88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, everything was brilliant! Room: Very spacious and charmingly furnished. It is very clean especially the bathroom which is decorated well. You also get lots of complimentary stuff from soaps to cotton wool! Also you can use the mini fridge to keep your drinks cool. Rest of hotel: Is really nice very unusual lay out but thats venice lol! The breakfast room is lovely especially the patio area. Alot of people said the breakfast was limited but for a continental breakfast it was brillaint and lot of choice. Cooked food is extra but that is the same in virtually any hotel in europe! The staff are lovely and so friendly and helpful! Also, bring a corkscrew buy some wine from the supermarket and you can drink it outside the hotel. Location: Is perfect its in the north of venice so its peaceful and quiet but your only 5-10min walk from all the shops etc. Easy to get to from the marco paulo airport, just catch the Alilaguna line Aracio but it only runs every hour and stops around 6pm. The ticket is 12 euros and I wouldn't bother using the waterbuses in venice as you won't need to much better to walk! Also, don't eat in the main tourist areas they really overcharge you and include a 10-15% service charge. There are 2 lovely restaurants near the hotel one called la fondementa (something like that) can't remember the other but just ask the hotel staff they are more than happy to help. I think thats it, definitly amazing hotel and venice is gorgeous, its so unusual and amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerry53
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recommended by a friend. We brought them home a nice present! Romantic location away from hectic St. Markâ€™s Square in a true Venetian neighborhood with great (and reasonable) restaurants and local shops. Just a few minutes from both Laguna and Vaporetto stops. Hotel impeccably clean, staff consummately professional. Rooms distinctively decorated and surprisingly spacious for Europe. Breakfast was elegant and generous. Great value; will definitely return. Jerry & Mary Long Island, New York USA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tresmaafisk
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Venice. Friendly staff and clean, cozy rooms. If we are ever going back to Venice we will more than likely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: BarbicanB
Reviews.Content: My husband took me on a surprise visit to Venice for our first wedding anniversary. I found out that he had done alot of research into hotels in Venice to find a good hotel in a quiet location with good reviews. It certainly ticked all the boxes. We had a superior room with a lovely terrace which we used one evening (when it wasn't raining!). The room was a good size with a nice bathroom and very clean. The location of the hotel in a residential part of Venice suited us well - we were happy to get away from the hustle and bustle, eat in cheaper places and buy our bottled water from the local supermarket (for about 20p for a large bottle). Breakfast in the morning was very nice and included in the price of the room. We also used the hotel bar a few times and enjoyed an evening watching Italy play Holland in Euro 2008 with the staff. They were all very friendly and professional. It's not cheap though! We bought a bottle of champagne in duty free and put it in our mini bar fridge so that we could celebrate in style without breaking the bank. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. Our room was comfortable, we enjoyed mixing with the locals and being in a quiet spot. If we ever go to Venice again, we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Serene and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Danish H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were there for a honeymoon. Stayed there for a week. Really a beautiful hotel. You should check out the rooms. They are gorgeous and unique, especially the interior and the bathroom. They even use Etro bath supplies. Imagine!! Breakfast was average, but don't expect more in Europe. Front staff were friendly and helpful to guide us. A definite choice if you want authenticity and serene environment.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: nikkikearns30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights a few weeks ago as part of our honeymoon tour of Italy and France. We personally cannot fault it. The hotel is presented wonderfully. Staff were brilliant. Our ground floor room was spacious and luxourious. Bathroom good too. Perfect after a not so good hotel in Paris the nights before. Breakfast was great. Its set back in the peaceful streets, but near enough to wander everywhere. The streets feel really safe and buzzing at night. Ended both nights outside enjoying bellinis and then into the bar. We had a great time and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sinnywinny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and loved the place! Our hotel room was amazing for the price we were paying, we even had a terrace! Although the hotel is situated a good distance from St. Mark's Sq. and the Rialto Bridge (about 15 mins walk, if you can navigate your way successfully through the streets!), there are plenty of nice restaurants around, and we found a lovely Irish pub in San Jeramia. We really enjoyed our stay here. The only bad points were the breakfast and hotel bar. Breakfast includes the bare minimal, with extras like orange juice and a slice of ham at â‚¬3 and â‚¬6 respectively. The hotel bar is also VERY small and there's not much life in it either, but that seems to be the Venitian way as bars were few and far between!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bizzie68
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in the AI MORI D`ORIENTE. A wonderful hotel in a perfect location, just a few minutes walk from restaurants/bars and 15 mins to Rialto Bridge and St. Marks Square. The hotel is an excellent standard with the 4 stars being well deserved. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. The whole hotel was spotless with great decor - lots of marble/granite making it very opulent. The bedroom was a good size compared to others we have stayed in elsewhere. Nice little touches of beds being turned down at night with sweets and a note of the next day's weather forecast on the bedside table. Breakfast was typical continental cold meats/bread and pastries. Capuccinos are served with a chocolate smiley face! It makes a lovely quiet retreat after a hectic day in the hustle and bustle of the main tourist areas. We could not fault the hotel or location and would not hesitate to recommend it. A perfect long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Haven of Tranquillity”
Reviews.Author: HonestJohnUk
Reviews.Content: This is a real find; a high quality, reasonably priced hotel near the main attractions of Venice. It is a 10 min stroll to the shopping area near the Guglie bridge (and the vaporetto stop there), and 5 mins to the old Jewish Ghetto area. The hotel is spotlessly clean, well-equipped and the rooms are in excellent condition, as well as being beautifully decorated with a Moorish theme. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful with tips and advice, and the quality of the breakfast buffet very high. The best part is that the hotel is located in a lovely quiet part of Cannaregio, so after a day of hectic activity in Venice, it's nice to come back here and relax away from the crowds. It's amazing how quickly the crowds vanish a street or 2 away from the main tourist areas. Access by Vaporetto from P. Roma (or other areas) is easy via the Orto stop. From here it's a 5 min walk to the hotel. Overall a great experience; I'll be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: gulliver70
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, fantastic value for money, sparkling clean and with friendly staff. It's in a quiet area of Venice, but still only a short walk to the touristy areas. I would stay here again without hesitation and would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel box of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2gotraveling
Reviews.Content: Just concluded my second stay at the Ai Mori d'Oriente with my daughter and her husband. We had rooms 101 & 102. They both face the canal on which the hotel is located, and are very spacious, with cable T.V., safes, and freshly ironed sheets that feel like heaven at the end of the day. The marble bathrooms have lighted magnifying mirrors, heated towel warmers, fluffy terry cloth robes, hair dryers, bidet, and a selection of toiletries. There was a scale....but I never got the courage to use it! We arrived by water taxi and staff unloaded our baggage. Because one of the rooms wouldn't be ready for about 45 minutes, they offered us a complimentary drink in the bar. After a long night of traveling, we revived ourselves with a morning cappucino. The front desk staff is exceptional, especially Marco Musco, the manager. He arranged dinner reservations for us at Alle Testiere. That day we decided to look for it so that we could find it later that night. We didn't succeed, so upon our return to the hotel later in the day, we told Marco our problem. He wrote out detailed instructions for us. That night we set out, for the restaurant. We had been gone about 10 minutes, when who should appear to make sure we were going in the right direction, but Marco! He took us inside, and introduced us to Luca, the owner, and we had one of the best meals in our lives. Marco went out of his way to accomodate us, and we were so grateful for his kindness. We had to leave for our return flight home at 5:30am. Breakfast is not served until 7:00am, but my daughter asked if it would be at all possible to get a cup of coffee. The night clerk went into the bar, fired up the espresso machine, and made us coffee and gave us some little pastries. Extrordinary service like that will keep me returning to the Ai Mori d'Oriente on future visits to Venice. We felt like family.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Experience”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJetGirl
Reviews.Content: I know that I am terribly late posting this review, which I meant to do upon my return. Honestly, the reason I'm doing it now is that I am getting ready to book another stay at this hotel! It was truly a wonderful stay. The hotel is beautiful. Our room felt and looked like a jewel box with the high, detailed ceiling and feel of Persian luxury. The bathroom was pretty and sparkling clean with nice ammenities. I loved the hotel's location, and when we arrived I really felt like I had "arrived" because the lobby is pretty and very welcoming. I know that some consider it far off the path, but believe me, it's in a good way. Venice gets crowded during the day, but when you step out onto the quiet streets around the hotel, you feel like you're experiencing the real heart of the city, not just the touristy parts. We found some really nice restaurants within very close walking distance from the hotel, including one of the few in Venice that's open late. The place had a cool scene and live music on at least one night we were there. Another plus about the location is that just a normal vaporetto ride to the hotel is a chance to sail down the canals and see the city. One of the best things about Venice is the joy of just wandering through the streets and discovering something surprising and beautiful around nearly every corner. So walking around the area of the hotel (or from there to Rialto area, etc.) gives you such a taste of the city. I was traveling with my friend (two women) and we never felt unsafe (granted we are from Chicago and travel a lot, so we do know how to watch out for ourselves and take precautions), but our stay at the Ai Mori d`Oriente was thoroughly enjoyable and unforgettable. The staff is friendly, professional, and anxious to be of service. We enjoyed a very good breakfast everyday in the lovey breakfast room. There was plenty to choose from and a great variety of hot and cold foods with espresso/coffee to order. You will not be disappointed! I can't wait to go back--it wouldn't feel like Venice if I didn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but a few little glitches”
Reviews.Author: VionaScream
Reviews.Content: Location: far from the centre of the hustle and bustle of Piazza San Marco, near the Jewish Ghetto. Be prepared to walk a lot (normal for Venice anyway, I think. But all of Venice away from the train station is wonderful, so this is a good spot. Service: Fair. The night porter seemed to have an attitude problem with us. His attitude was condescending and snooty, and unhelpful, so after our long walks in the evenings I didn't look forward to facing him on the way back into the hotel. The Room: small, butbeautifully decorated in an near asian theme. Unfortunately there were some works going on while we were there so we were woken up one morning by loud sounds of hammering. Also, there was a light on the electric panel which meant that the room was never 100% dark at night. Breakfast: I liked it - breads, pastries (including "fritelli"), yoghurt, cooked meats, cereals, fruit, boiled eggs, tea, coffee, juices. You can pay extra for a cooked breakfast. The breakfst room was nice - half indoors and half in a marquee - with peaceful background music (but this changed to less peaceful music when breakfast time was coming to a close - perhaps to subconciously make the patrons want to leave!) Other: The place has a bar, but it was closed when we went down to it after arriving late due to a delayed flight. We had a beer from the "American Bar" (mini bar) in our room instead. This place was nice, but I think I will try somewhere different next time I go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and break!”
Reviews.Author: BiagiSussex
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay in Venice where we stayed at the Ai Mori D'Oriente. The hotel truely is fantastic! I've stayed in some small boutique hotels in Paris/London and this has the charm of a boutique hotel whilst being that much bigger (with bar/large breakfast room) to give it a great 'small hotel feel'. From arrival the reception staff were great and the bell boy helped us to our room. I knew exactly what to expect from reading many reviews and seeing other travellers photo's. The deep red furnishings and all marble bathroom really serve to confuse whether you're in Italy or somewhere slightly more eastern and exotic, a real treat for the senses! We had a superior double with breakfast and didn't miss the canal views to be honest. We had a nice view of a courtyard and this was fine. The breakfast was excellent. I had warm bread rolls with hams/cheeses, tomatoe filled warm pastries, croissants with honey and yoghurt every morning! This was included with the room and although you could order omelette's and the like for 3/4 Euro's, we never felt the need to we were so full. Each night we went out we stopped for a few drinks in the bar. Massimo the bar guy was great. Not overly chatty but I don't like much more than a smile, some acknowledgement and good timely service and that's exactly what we got! Had bellini's and some other cocktails and also an AMAZING if not somewhat expensive bottle of chianti one evening. The hotel recommended a VERY exdensive restaurant the first night (La Fondamenta) and I paid ONE HUNDRED AND SEVENTY EURO'S for a three course meal, albeit a very expensive bottle of wine and lots of fish (lobster/squid/sardines etc). We had two much fairer priced meals the next two nights in lovely trattoria's just a five minute walk from the hotel. The walk to St. Marks Square and the basillica took us 45 minutes on our first day, 35 on our secone and 30 on our third! it really is only a 25 minute walk once you're confident of the way and it really is a lovely stroll past Strada Nova, Rialto etc. I could go on about the break in Venice but I'm sure what people want is some good practical knowledge of the hotel and the surrounding area so, in conclusion here are some good tips: 1) Come out of hotel, turn right, take the first bridge on the left and not more than 100yds down on the left is a supermarket tucked away that you'd never guess was there! Good to stock up on drinks/snacks in your room without paying mini bar prices (which weren't themselves bad to be honest) 2) Same right, then same first bridge, but then turn right at the end of the passage and first bridge on the left again! Easier than it sounds! And then you're pretty much in a great small town with restaurants/shops/cash points etc and all just 5 minutes away 3) Harry's bar just off the square for bellini's....where the bellini was invented! Seriously.....a complete must do when in Venice 4) Florian coffee house in the square for the best, most beautiful coffee experience! If not VERY expensive at 18 odd Euro's for two coffee's. this is where the wealthy Austrian's used to drink in the 1900's when Austria owned Venice and you can feel the history......VERY romantic 5)TAKE A GONDOLA. Very expensive but having done many good things in life I can seriously say this is high up on the list 6) Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy-I-1984
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay at Hotel Ai Mori d'Oriente. The hotel is magnificent and the service we received was fantastic. We initially reserved a standard room (90 Euro's per night), but then decided to upgrade to a deluxe room (150 Euro's). The room was spacious, with a king size bed, dresser, large wardrobe and safe. The on suite was very spacious and modern. We asked for a water-facing room. Because of the location of the hotel, there was minimal noise and disruption from outside. The view was not the best (the hotel is located in a quieter part of Venice, which is surrounded by flats and houses), but the room more than made up for it. The room also had a small balcony which was perfect for looking at the surroundings. I paid for rose petals to be spread out in our room, and I certainly got my money's worth. The staff had laid rose petals leading from the elevator to our door, and then to the bed (where they had also laid out some chocolates into heart shapes). They had also decorated the on suite with rose petals and candles...and all for 40 Euro's. Guys...this is definitely worth it. The hotel is located roughly 10 minutes walk from one of many markets (you will find many shops with masks and Venetian merchandise, but we found that the shops closest to the hotel were the cheapest). We looked into a trip on a gondola, but for 80 Euro's for 45 minutes it is just not worth it. The quality of the water is not good, and being that close to it will simply ruin the romance. Also, the amount of water traffic is so great that you will simply be thrown around when any boat comes anywhere near the gondola. The restaurants located around the hotel are not bad, but not great either. We went in search for a nice restaurant that did good fish, but were disappointed. The main thing to remember is that any restaurant or shop that has a guy trying to lure you in is sot worth going into. The food may not be too bad, but the prices will certainly be hard to swallow. We had a 2 course meal for 100 Euro's (not the most expensive, but if you tried the food you will have reacted same as me). Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday and both me and my girlfriend are extremely fussy! I would gladly rate this hotel as a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Service makes up for location”
Reviews.Author: kriptonian7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to the many helpful reviews that i read here on trip advisor, so i hope this does the same for someone else. We were on our honeymoon and spent 10 nights here. Ill start with the good since there was pleanty of it. :Getting there: Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel is located close to the jewish ghetto on the backside of Venice on a considerably quiter canal compared to others in the city. From the airport it it very easy to get to after a 5 minute walk to the dock and taking a 20 min Vaporetto across the lagoon getting off at the Madonna dell'Orto stop. From here it is about a 5 minute walk. :First Impressions: The hotel is charming, and you are welcomed by a friendly multilingual staff. Roberto is very nice and always had a good advice, so was Edmundo. We had no problems checking in, they told us to ask for anything we needed, and we were shown to our room by a concierge that toted all our bags. The hall ways smelled of Espresso and croissants for most of the day. Out side there were people jogging, walking their dogs, and just getting on with their day. :Amenities: Our room was nice, and pretty big compared to some Italian hotels. Small table with char, desk, t.v. , and mini-bar. Lots of space for two people. lots of starage space in the room which allowed us to put our clothes up and hide our bags away. bathroom was pretty Italian standard for a rennovated hotel with the large marble sink, the toilette tucked away in the corner. We had a tub that my wife loved, because it allowed many baths at the end of long days. if you take a shower expect to get everything wet. Small safe in the closet of the room as well. The rooms have some attention to detail that make them nice. the trims inthe bathroom, the towel warmers, the decor. They also have a laundry service that picks up at your door. Breakfast was typical cheese, rolls, croissants, boiled eggs, cereal, cappaccinos, Espressos, are all included. They do serve scrambled eggs and a great plate of bacon, a little pricey but worth it when you start getting that "amercan breakfast" itch. They will bring anything to the room for 6 euros. We took advantage of this one time for an early morning start. Breakfast rooms are nice and the service is good. There is a quaint bar that serves its purpose with a good wine list and is fully stocked. It is a little pricey but that is expected for any hotel bar so no surprise there. :In the area: The canal in which the hotel is located has nothing other than greats views of the small canal. For us the most important find in the area was the grocery. There is also a Pharmacy close by as well. You are about a 5 minutes from "la strada nuovo" which is a main street that can take you to Rialto (15 min), San Marco (20 min), Vaporetto stop San marcuola (7min), & Train station (7 min). There is shopping, many places to eat , and bancomats everywhere. Things are close, but if you want more action, id suggest staying somewhere closer to the grand canal or close to the City's center. This area is not very touristy, and has more of a neighborhood feel to it TIP >>out the front of the hotel go right, first bridge go left, about 20ft down the alley-way on the left is a grocery. Cheap sodas, water, snacks, meat, and basic toilletry items.>> :Critiques: We stayed in room 307. it was the last room at the end of a hallway next to what i would assume is a service door. We like to sleep late, and a ew nights actually went to bed before 9:00pm. Between the hours of id say 8:00am and 10:00pm there is some one coming in and out of that door every 5 minutes. outside our window is somesort of delivery area or just a back door to the hotel and we got alot of noise coming in and out of that as well. We are hard sleepers, but i can see how this could be a problem for some others. So be wary if this room. im sure they would have moved us if we would have asked. Bed was two twins pushed together (standard again for italy) and a little stiff. Pillows were nice, and the cleaning crew was quick and and they did their job well. Hotel is a little far. The restaurant that was suggested by the front desk was nice. It was a little pricey for what we got. i think our meal came out to be 180.00 american (appetiser, soda, water, meat, bottle of wine) the appetiser alone that was suggested by te owner was 36 euros. It had marinated shrimp and sea bass uncooked. Just a heads up, but i did have the best bottle of wine our entire trip there. It was about 3 mintues from the hotel. they like to suggest it alot. :Wrap Up: I did like the hotel, again the service was excellent. They called a taxi for me at no charge for a very very early flight. If we needed something they were quick to give it and surprisingly they did not charge for their extra little services. Location is great for the relaxing wanderers that we are. It allows you to se a part of Venice that most tourists will never see. That quiet every-day life Venice away from the masses where people help little old women up and over bridges and where neighbors gather and have a glass of wine laugh. Id definatley stay here again for a few days. maybe not for another extended stay. I would reccomend this hotel for older travelers that like the peace and quiet. Younger crowd should probably move closer to the action, but then again you will pay more for it. Price was good, even during Carnival.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience, staff, price, and location.”
Reviews.Author: atlbeme
Reviews.Content: After extensively reviewing the vast hotel choices in Venice, we settled on this one based on price and the number of positive reviews. We were extremely pleased! Given the location, condition of the hotel, the staff, and the included breakfast, you can't beat the price. Location: A little off the beaten path on the Sensa Canal. A plus is that It's easy to get to from the Madonna Del Orto (Orto) water bus stop (10 minutes walk). You can be on the Rio Terra "street" in 10 minutes on which there are lots of Restaurants, shops, and several groceries. This street connects with the Strada Nova (more shops and restaurants) and eventually the San Marco/Rialto zone, these are about 30 minutes walk from the hotel. The Marcuola water bus stop is the closest Grand Canal stop to the hotel, 15 minute walk. *Having a map of the city and the water bus routes is essential. Hotel: A four star hotel, In Venice, for about $100 per night! what a great deal. The rooms and hotel were nicely decorated in a Moorish motif, hence the name and history of the building. NIce sized room and great bath (by European standards). Given the price paid, we were concerned we may be in the basement, but were not (1st floor room 104). There were some rooms involving several halls and flights of stairs. Anyone who has mobility issues should know enough to ask ahead of time. Breakfast: The breakfast included in the hotel rate was substantial, simple, and good. (meats, cheeses, breads, cereals, yogurts, juices, sweets). It was the same everyday, those who are not happy with the selection can order a la carte off a menu for a price. The Staff: Prior to arrival, I emailed the hotel to confirm the booking, they promptly responded with a cheerful confirmation. (The hotel was booked on Expedia which had a slightly cheaper rate than the hotel website). Check in was easy and the staff more than helpful in holding our luggage until the room was available later in the day. The front desk staff and dining room staff were always cheerful and informative. Other helpful points: >Getting to Hotel-The hotel website advises taking the Alilaguna Blue line (via Calonna, Murano) to The Fondamenta Nuove (Nuove) stop and transferring to the Vaporetto boat then to the Orto stop. However, if your flight arrives/departs 10am-5pm aprrox., you can take the Alilaguna Orange (Arancia) line directly to/from the Orto stop (via Calonna, Murano) and skip the boat transfer at Nuove . The orange line times of operation are more limited, so check out the Alilaguna Website for your specific flight time needs. Using the orange line saves time and the hassle of moving yourself and luggage from boat to boat. Getting around-If you have lots of luggage or mobility issues, this hotel is one of the easier to get to from a boat stop, but paying for the expensive water taxi should be considered. Keep in mind, not all hotels are on a canal and water taxi accessible. The vaporetto water bus lines are extensive and easy to use, but walking is inevitable in Venice. Venice is a truly unique and enthralling city, this hotel is a wonderful part of that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Romance is in the Air”
Reviews.Author: BOO-CM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was abosolutely a great find and our favorite of the three hotels we stayed at during our trip to Italy. The hotel room was decorated beautifully and very romantic. It was spacious and had a sitting area with a small table and 2 chairs and a lounge chair/bed as well. The room was equiped with a mini bar/snacks which was a pleasant surprise since our arrivals at the hotels always seemed to be late at night. The bathroom was nice as well. The hotel faces one of Venice's many canals and is in a private residential area. We enjoyed walking to and from the hotel each day to the main St Marks area where most of the action is. The walk takes approximatley 15-20 minutes. We arrived in Venice at midnight via the train station. It was raining a little and the night was foggy but cool looking. So we opted for a private boat ride which would not have been necessary if it were not raining. When we left Venice we walked with our luggage to the train station from our hotel which took approximately 20 minutes. We would definately stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it if you are looking for a romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkaPolo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January '08 which is a great time to visit Venice. The hotel is in the Cannaregio district which is also known as the Jewish Ghetto. It is a bit of a hike to places like St. Mark's square, but you will be mingling with the residents of Venice. The staff is very professional and helpful, especially Roberto. He helped me resolve a major problem with my tour vouchers and I want to send him my sincerest appreciation. The rooms were beautiful and the bathrooms were well appointed with heated towel racks and bathtub/shower combinations. Breakfast was in a beautiful room with attentive staff. The food served was excellent and you can even order extras like scrambled eggs. Nearby there are grocery stores which serve pizzas and paninis so that you don't have to eat at restaurants for 3 meals a day. I would recommend this hotel! My only problem was that because this building was built in the 14th Century, the walls are not very soundproof and my children needed to use quiet voices while in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Drsquid
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights over the New Year period (30/12 to the 3/01) was extremely pleased with our choice of hotel. We stayed in the annex bit of the hotel (double room) which is at the back. We didn't mind going up the stairs (like 2 flights) which probably do us good following our breakfast morning round and Italian evening meal! As our room was at the annex and the top, we had slidy roof which is quite unique. I loved the bathroom although for my 6 ft 1 boyfriend, the shower head reaches his neck rather than his head. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous. They made us feel very welcomed and during breakfast they were very helpful. We did come back latish (about 1.30 on NY eve's and 12ish) and got in alright. There's always a staff available at the reception. Breakfast was very enjoyable - yoghurt, fresh fruits, danish pastries, rolls, cereals,cold meats, cheese, pate, crackers, a choice of orange and grapefruit juice. We had the option to sit outside the made up conservatory which is heated. There is also an option for breakfast to be delivered to room for an additional price. The bed was comfortable and there's a turn down service as well. The place is probably a bit of a track away but we manage to walk to St Mark's Square in 20 mins or so. We liked the fact that you can take the water bus from airport and stop at Madonna del Orto which is 3-5 mins walk to the hotel and going back as well. You can also head to Murano Island from here. The "innercity" water bus stop is also 5 mins away. But generally we enjoyed walking into town and back (much needed exercise following our food consumption!) There are plenty of restaurants which are of high quality near the hotel eg Columbina, DiRioba. There's also a supermarket across the hotel over the bridge which you can buy basic sundries like water. Overall we would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: WDandAK
Reviews.Content: Having been to Venice many times, it was a real delight to find this wonderful hotel in one of the quieter parts of the city.
