It is very well appointed, with staff who were all incredibly friendly and helpful. Although there were quite a few other guests, you were made to feel like the only visitors. The off season rate was an added bonus, but worth the stay any time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Brilliant Service”
Reviews.Author: Giorich
Reviews.Content: The room wal large and confortable, beautifully decorated with silky fabrics on the wall (my room was Nr 102 junior suite facing the Fondamente (Canal)) the front desk polite and very helpful everything i have asked for was done in no time and always with a smile the hotel was very clean including the public areas, classical music resounded even in the public toilet near the reception and it was't too loud! it is true it is not right in the centre of venice but the public transport was a few steps away right behind Santa Maria Dell'Orto Church. a taxi to the centre was Â£50.00 a go but they picked us up from the hotel. It is a great hotel and although there is some distance between the hotel and the centre of venice this is made up in service and price! i do not only suggest it to everyone i will also go back myself P.S. one of us in on a wheel chair and we didn't find any problem (Althought the lift is a little small and there is a little step to the bathroom inside the room)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: billywhizz_uk
Reviews.Content: excellent rooms, good food, very good service, easy to walk to attractions, local "bus stop". Tip: Make sure you get an accurate large scale map of the area as it's easy to get lost!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in venice!”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewerLondon
Reviews.Content: what an amazing deal. we booked through fastbooking.com and got a great deal in this 4* hotel for 2* prices. the staff were so nice and we felt so spoiled staying here. v good breakfast, great location. we'll def go back here if we visit venice again

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: j3dnight
Reviews.Content: Ai Mori is a beautiful hotel. The location is excellent, it is quiet but a short waterbus ride to all the attractions. A short walk from the hotel are lot's of places for shopping and eating. I loved the breakfast, the rooms are beautiful and the staff is great ! I have some photos of Ai Mori in the link on my profile page.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NYHilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ai Mori October 1-3 and had a wonderful stay! The staff was more than accomodating, we arrived early in the day and the staff held our bags until our room was ready. The staff was also great at giving information for local places. They were always polite and willing to help. They do have internet access here, so you can send a quick email home. We actually had some trouble getting tickets for a museum in our next city and the staff at the front desk went above and beyond in helping us to get out tickets! The breakfasts here were the best that we had in Italy, anyplace that lets you have Nutella chocolate on hard rolls for breakfast is an A+ in our book!! The hotel is a very short walk from the water taxi, and the train station. The neighborhood is wonderful, we had a lot of fun just getting lost in the windng paths of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - look out for special offers”
Reviews.Author: MacyMoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 21 July for 3 Nights and really liked the hotel. The location is in a very quiet part of Venice away from the tourists and is very picturesque, in some ways this was an advantage as it gets so crowded around St Marks Square and nice to get back to the peace and tranquillity of the area surrounding the hotel, but in other ways it was a bit of an inconvenience especially if you fancy nipping back to the hotel for a siesta in the afternoon (too much wine at lunch time!) and some nice air conditioning to cool off, its not exactly around the corner from everything especially when you are on your feet all day. I always imagined that when I came to Venice that I would be able to fling the windows open in the morning to a beautiful sunny day and look out over the canals, alas it was not to be and we opened our window to a brick wall on the ground floor! I suppose that is the price you have to pay when you go for a cheaper hotel and donâ€™t upgrade to an executive room! Anyway, you can't have everything, it was a very pretty room and quite ornate, but very small and dark. So no chance of relaxing here and watching the world go by! On the plus side it was very clean and the sheets were good, towels a bit thin and small for me! The room number was 303. There was a small room for breakfast. A lot of people have said the breakfast was great, I thought it was OK. I can pretty much remember exactly what they had, 3 types of ham, 2 types of cheese, 3 different croissants, some cereal, boiled egg, yoghurt, juices and tea and coffee. What I did like was the small courtyard that you could sit outside and have breakfast though. Bear in mind that you are not allowed to sit outside BEFORE 9.A.M.! so if you are an early riser you will miss out on this treat which is a shame (as we did twice). The waitress was very nice and the reception staff extremely helpful and friendly, so if you need any advice ask them. Venice is a beautiful city and I think if I went back I would probably stay in a different hotel across the other side of the river (purely to save my poor feet!) as there are some lovely quiet canals not that far from St Marks but I would still definitely recommend this hotel (and may be go back to this hotel if we got another good deal) if you are visiting Venice as we managed to get the hotel from an internet site that had 3 nights for one offer plus flight (driveline.co.uk) and there really was nothing I could complain about at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all.”
Reviews.Author: ringside
Reviews.Content: it was everything we could have asked for. Hotel staff very polite, room very tidy, and good standard. Hotel situated off the beaten track so lovely and peaceful, yet only 5 mins walk into the busier areas. Staff always willing to help and advise us on where to eat. Gianni behind the bar is really lovely, he helped us alot with maps etc and what to see. Nice to eat breakfast outside (back) as main room can get busy.

Reviews.Title: “Why break the bank?”
Reviews.Author: MagisterRome
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mori d'Oriente this September for the second time this year. The property is a recently renovated building, overlooking one of the canals of Venice, not too far off from the railway station. The building is in pristine conditions and everything is spotlessly clean. Unlike most of the other guests, I was travelling on business, so I did not spend much time in the hotel itself. I noted however the following: - My room was smaller than the one I had been given last time, but still more than acceptable for an hotel of this category - Quality of the bedding and the linens was very good - The bathroom was in excellent conditions and supplied with high quality toiletries (Etro) - The breakfast (included in the rate) was served in a spacious room. Quality of the food was excellent and the staff very attentive - The multilingual front desk staff was very helpful and willing to help you out with your travel itineraries and restaurant reservations. What else can I say? Especially after reading on this very website the dreadful reviews that some of the venerable Venetian 5-stars hotels deserved, this property is really a gem. It is a secret that perhaps I should have not been giving away...

Reviews.Title: “A slice of nice in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Specialk-74
Reviews.Content: It was myself and my boyfriends first trip to Venice and we stayed in this hotel on a recommendation from my mother. We booked through a website and got a great discount from the original price. When we arrived it was quite late. We were shown to a beautifully decorated room and slept soundly. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and the buffet breakfast was top notch. Plenty to eat, friendly staff pouring beautiful Italian coffee, to set you up for the day out. The hotel is in a great location. Not to near the main street but close to the vaparetto stop so you can hop on and off the boat. The boyfriend was delighted with the casino near the hotel and there was a reading room in the hotel with a view of the canal for myself complete with little bon bons to enjoy while reading. There is movies on the TV which you may ask to have changed if you wish as one movie channel does all rooms, room service was not a problem. There is a small bar downstairs with a very friendly barman who we shared some laughs with. I would definitley stay here again and would recommend the hotel certainly. Great location, great staff, food was lovely and there are enough little bakery's and crooked little buildings around the place to keep you interested. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Would strongly reccomend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue025
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this boutique style hotel for 3 nights and would strongly reccomend it both for it's location which is in the quieter northern part of Venice but still within 20 mins walk of St. Marks Square and for it's charm and character.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: RB08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The staff were fantastic especially Gino, who is the most helpful person ever! The room was small but it was clean and the bathroom was spacious as such. Ideal location, just off the beaten track but not too far from the hustle and bustle. Just a couple of minutes away from the water bus stop and the Alilaguna actually takes you straight to the airport from that stop for 12 Euros. Food was nice, usual continental breakfast. I really recommend staying at this hotel, it really is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: Andrew'n'Helen
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel - we got a really good deal with RyanAir.com hotels - it is worth the small difference to get a superior room. We had room 111 and the decor and view was fantastic. Hotel is in a quiet area but is near to two vaporetti stops within 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dspreis
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel on a quiet street. A non-touristy location, but a quick walk to some great sites and neighborhoods. We stayed here with our three teenage daughters (in two rooms). Our rooms were large and very nice but one of the bathrooms was small. This was probably due to a last minute change to our reservation that WE made that the hotel graciously accommodated. Breakfast was wonderful, the service outstanding, excellent air-conditioning, and the location was perfect for us. One thing that could be improved is the soundproofing in the hotel, however this did not impact us in a big way. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel with deficient service”
Reviews.Author: abelman
Reviews.Content: We were drawn to this hotel (like everyone else seems to have been) by its quiet location and unique character, having seen the reviews posted here. While there certainly is some character in the hotel's decor and furnishings and the hotel is somewhat removed from the busy tourist areas, the hotel seemed overpriced considering the lack of attention details and the hotel's service, which left much to be desired. We arrived at the hotel in the late evening and there seemed to be only one person working at the hotel. We had several heavy pieces of luggage and were looking forward to some assistance with them, but instead we were given curt instructions as to how to find our room, which was located at the top of a 3 story staircase at the end of a maze of hallways and several doorways. What kind of 4-star hotel sends its guests up 3 flights of stairs with their baggage and offers no assistance. The room was quite small and disappointing as well, although the bathroom seemed to have been done over recently and was satisfactory. We enquired about switching rooms to one that was located in a more accessible part of the hotel, and were told to try back in the morning. In the morning, we were told to try back in the afternoon. In the afternoon, we were told we could have a different room for an additional 100 euros per night. The next night, we returned to the hotel after an evening stroll and the front door was locked. It took a few minutes of knocking and ringing the doorbell until the front desk employee came out of the back room and unlocked the door. Strangely, he didn't bother to open the door for us - he just unlocked it and then scurried back behind the desk. The next evening, we required some assistance in our room, and we were told to try back in the morning because the only person working in the hotel said he couldn't leave the front desk to help us. From the reviews below, it seems that there are hotel rooms in the basement of the hotel with no real windows, and there are various wings that have been added on to the hotel so they can make an extra buck. In all likelihood, the rooms in the main part of the hotel are probably nicers and more spacious, but good luck getting them. I would think they shouldn't be charging the same rates for subterranean rooms or rooms in the attic of the back stairwell, but the front desk employee insisted there's no difference between any of their rooms. The ownership/management of this hotel appear to be masters of capitalism, but have no idea of what it means to service their clientele. They've managed to extend their hotel and add rooms in every possible direction at the expense of the service that hotel guests should be receiving. How many more subterranean rooms or rear wings will they add on before hiring some additional help, so that there might be service available other than a the front desk? How many more floors can they add on without providing their guest with an elevator or a bellhop? This hotel is uniquely appointed and is in a charming location, but don't expect any 4-star service.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!”
Reviews.Author: TracyandJoeRushton
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in June and loved it! It was in a perfect location, not too far to walk to the waterbuses, or St. Marks, and had several very good restaurants nearby. Our room was in an extension to the main hotel, and building work was going on outside the room, but wasn't too intrusive. Reception staff were very professional and helpful. The room was spacious and decorated in opulent colours and fabrics. The bathroom was huge. We spent a perfect afternoon, sat beside the canal, sipping wine and watching the world go by. Bar prices are expensive though, Â£10 for 2 glasses of wine! I was reluctant to recommend this hotel to fellow travellers, as it was a real find, and I wanted to keep it to myself!! We plan to go back again before the end of the year. No Venice wasn't dirty, no the canals don't smell, and yes it's the perfect place for a long weekend. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hlj1972
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic, the service fantastic, the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The breakfast had a great selection of food. The hotel was located in a perfect area, very quite on a evening to sleep, but v. close to St. Marks Sq and the grand canal, only about a 15 min walk. You can get a complimentary water taxi to the glass factory on Munro island. Would stay at the hotel again, and would recommend it to my family and friends, which I have already done. Made the holiday very special. Very good local restaurants along the canal where the hotel is situated.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: janet74
Reviews.Content: My disappointement started from the first day. I booked hotel nearly two months ago and asked two twin bed room with canal view but I ended up with one so so bed with view of neighbor's house. Hotel's location also wasn't very good. It's actually far from everywhere and to get the hotel you have to pass very isolated,narrow and scary dark road. My disappointment continues until my checking out. When I checked out, I found the room service charge which I never asked. One night, I asked to bring hot water to my room, ( I often ask hot water for my own tea when I stay hotel and no hotel charge for that so far) and they charge 6 Euro for that( I gave 5 Euro tip and the guy never mentioned about the charge!). Anyway, I choose this hotel after great review from other people but for me, it wasn't very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and great prices”
Reviews.Author: Tasha_83
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent three nights in July at the Hotel Ai Mori D'Oriente in Venice and absolutely loved it! The service at the front desk is extraordinarily efficient and helpful (volunteered restuarant recommendations, maps, etc) and for 100 euros per night, we got an amazing king size bed suite - with an ante room containing another bed (diwan style), fridge, writing desk, several chairs, etc. At night upon our return from dinner, we found that our bed had been turned down and all the blinds had been drawn. The bathroom was also amazing. Two of the best parts of this hotel are the breakfast and the people. Bfast was included in our price and rather than the usual brioche and cappuccino, there was an elaborate smorgasboard laid out. We met two other couples who were on their honeymoons and really enjoyed the company. The location (in Cannaregio) is great, because its away from the tourists and crowds and especially the tourist trap restaurants. It is near the Ghetto, which is definitely worth seeing, and has good vaporetti (water taxi) links closeby. Would DEFINITELY stay here again, and would definitely recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “excellent cocktails!”
Reviews.Author: SalScotland
Reviews.Content: We arrived home today after a 3 night stay in the Ai Mori d'Oriente and I would thoroughly recommend it! Our room may be classed as small by some reviewers but was perfectly adequate for us and exquisitely decorated, the bathroom was the best we've had in Europe. We overlooked a very narrow alley but then Venice is full of narrow alleys! The barman I must mention as other reviews have given him some stick, he may not smile much but he makes one hell of a good cocktail! the 2 nights we were lucky enough to get a table outside alongside the canal late at night after wandering around the city we sampled several and it made the evening sitting on the quiet street. The hotel is off the beaten track but this is a bonus as the 2 trattoria up the street were excellent as opposed to the tourist traps further in - but you need to like fish! A previous review said it's 20 mins to St Marks - I've no idea how fast they walk but we couldn't do it in less than 30 - but that's fine as it's such a lovely walk, but get a good map as you can easily get lost in the maze of tiny streets, although there are the clear signs on the corner of buildings to the main areas. We took the coach in this time and the water bus back but would definately take the water bus back in next time as it's a far more romantic way to arrive - you can go into fondamente Nove on the blue Ailiguna boat direct from Marco Polo airport and then catch the Actv bus up one stop to Madonna dell'Orto which is a 5/10 minute walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: italyvacation
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located slightly out of the center venice. Mins from shopping. Great service. Well air conditioned rooms. Very nice staff. Clean. 10mins walk to the boat that takes you directly to the airport. Great breakfast. Awesome. Would def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: annagrace
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Ai Mori d'Oriente as it was a four star hotel for a decent price (for Venice!). The lobby is tiny and somewhat strangely decorated....there was some incense burning in a large bowl. The hotel is right on a small canal but very few rooms actually overlook it. We stayed in a section of the hotel that required winding through several passageways which was somewhat confusing. The room was very small but was nicely decorated. It had a tiny, high up slit of a window which overlooked an alley (I think, it was too high to see out of!). Breakfast was average but they make nice cappuccinos. The location was definitely off the beaten path and a little difficult to find, but reasonably close to the water taxi from the airport. We were able to easily walk to the water buses on the Grand Canal and could tour Venice easily from there. The bathroom was marble and nicely appointed but small. I would definitely recommend this hotel but expect tiny rooms for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!”
Reviews.Author: Country_bagger
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I got engaged while staying in Venice at the Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel so it will always be wonderful place for that reason alone! The hotel was beautiful and our room was a deep red with a gorgeous view over the canal from our window, the breakfasts were excellent and the hotel staff, particularly Guido and Mauritzio T were just brilliant, exceedingly friendly and had good suggestions for dinner options near to the hotel and what was generally going on in Venice during that weekend. You felt like you were truly being looked after. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: CMTravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ai Mori Doriente May 9 and 10 and it was fantastic. The hotel was recently redecorated and the rooms are beautiful. The bathroom was by far the nicest one I've ever had in Europe. It was very very convenient to St. Lucia train station. We walked from the station to the hotel in about 10-15 minutes. There are actually signs posted near street signs (painted on the sides of buildings), that point you toward the hotel. The hotel even has a porter that carried our luggage to our room for us and a turndown service at night. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was standard Italian fareâ€”yogurt, cheese and meat, bread, and fruit, but was laid out very nicely and there were servers to get hot drinks and extras. The front desk spoke fluent English and had maps and directions available to anywhere you wanted to go. They had a complimentary water taxi to the island of Murano that included a factory tour of one of the glass factories (you are not obligated to buy from the factory you visit, although everyone did) and an hour or so of free time on the island before they take you back to the hotel. The only negatives were that the configuration of the bathtub/shower head and glass door made it so that we pretty much flooded the bathroom floor during every shower. Also, the bath towels smelled very very strongly of vinegar, which we thought was odd.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel. Clean, nice location, smart.”
Reviews.Author: Keir
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just got back from seven nights at the Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel. Here's the run down: GENERAL The hotel is tucked away on a canal in the quiet district of Cannaregio on the northwest of the island, a refreshingly (and apparently quite unique) residential corner of the main island. From the outside the hotel looks lovely and has some tables by the water which are good for a quiet night cap before bed after a day's walking exploring. Once inside the place is very nicely decorated, if a little dark (not much day-light finds its way in to the hotel by all accounts). The reception is all marble floors and wood panelling. It's spotlessly clean. The staff are equally well presented in extremely smart uniforms and they obligingly help you with your bags. They were all efficient enough but the real star was the night porter; a short grey haired fellow called Rafael who was a really friendly and charming. LOCATION It's a twenty minute walk to St. Mark's and the claustrophobic throngs of tourists. St. Mark's is so crowded staying there would be like sleeping on the London underground for a weekend and unless you want to purchase a knock off D&G bag at 11pm, the surprisingly native district of Cannaregio is ideal and really relaxing - as long as the weather is good. We had two days of heavy rain and the walk back from the Vaporetti stop seemed a lot longer with wet jeans so be warned. The nearest water bus stop is five minutes away, the next on the Grand Canale is a pleasant seven minute stroll down a touristy street. There is a supermarket just across the canal too. The rail way station is about a ten minute walk. In terms of dining it's in an ideal spot because our experience tells us you'll get the best food around here in the small restaurants frequented by the locals. The parallel canal over the bridge has some really lovely bars which are full of amiable locals. If it's late and you want to chill by the water on a quiet night I implore you to check out a tiny wine bar called Timon: [--] the range of wine is extensive and cheap, and the staff are lovely. We also enjoyed live jazz in another bar on this stretch, it's worth a look. ROOM Our room (a superior double on the second floor) was spacious. The decor reflected Venetian architecture. It was decorated in deep reds and yellows which were a bit much for me, but the furniture was of high quality and there were some nice touches like the Venetian style arch way and the marble bathroom. The bathroom was indeed nice and spacious, more importantly for me the shower was consistently hot and with a turn of the shower head also very powerful. The TV had a multitude of channels, the English speaking ones being BBC (which wasn't working but I didn't bother complaining - because I'm English), CNBC and CNN along with one film channel on which they showed a variety of relatively recent DVDs. The two main bedroom windows opened out onto a brick wall which was about three feet away, but hey, welcome to Venice - not a deal breaker anyway. BREAKFAST The breakfast was nice enough. Essentially the hotel is a posh B&B so you get a continental start to the day including (not always fresh) croissants, apple pastries, ham, oranges, juices and tea or coffee. You can get these delivered to your room for â‚¬6 or if you've got a hangover, go down and get the tea/coffee on a tray and bring it back so you can have breakfast in bed without the charge. STAFF The staff were friendly enough. The barman seems to have taken a bit of stick in previous reviews on here, but if it's the same one I met he's a nice eccentric fellow how will give you great service. The staff on the desk were OK. As I said earlier, Rafael the night porter was great. I booked a smoking room which we subsequently didn't get (thankfully in hindsight) so I popped out for late night cigarettes and Rafael was so obliging and charming he really made the stay. If you see him say hello from 'Edmond' and Jessica! :) OTHER THINGS THAT MAYBE USEFUL + Stand on the right and get out the way of the locals as if you were on the tube. + All Venetians have pet dogs. + I found the Lonely Planet guide book superior to the Rough Guide, but beware: if you're looking for a nice place to eat and you pick a restaurant from these books you'll be surrounded by English people that have done exactly the same thing - find a nice place off the beaten track that isn't in the book. + Watch for the swimming rats. + When they put the little stickers on the windows warning you not to open them in the summer season for fear of mosquitoes they were also referring to early May! + Go up the Campanile tower in Piazza San Marco at around 6.15, the massive bells will ring above your head. It's very loud but it serves for a great memory. + I'm not one to evade fairs, but no one ever checks your ticket on the Vaporetti so you may think twice about purchasing the really expensive ticket suggested by the guide books. + Book through Expedia, it's cheaper than the hotel site.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ElleGolightly
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at the Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel. Having chosen to stay away from the main tourist traps this hotel was perfectly placed and a mere 5-10 min walk from the main water bus stop (Fondamente Nove) from the airport. Staff were extremely polite and helpful, recommending and booking restaurants nearby for us on 2 occasions. Particularly memorable was the crab gnocchi we enjoyed by the canal at 40 Ladroni just a few hundered metres from the hotel. Our room (204) was extremely spacious although it lacked any sort of view (not really a problem as we spent the majority of our time out and about enjoying the atmosphere of Venice). If you want to get away from the crowded streets around San Marco this is a great place to stay as the area is not touristy and the hotel is on one of the smaller canals lined with houses. Walking really is the best way to see the city as the water taxis are expensive - we got a 3 day water bus pass at 30 Euros each and just hopped on and off the buses when walking became too much. Get on a No 1 at the railway station early in the morning and get a tour down the Grand Canal and round to Saint Mark's Square at a fraction of the cost of a taxi/gondola. Saint Mark's Square was deserted at 8am on a Saturday morning, perfect for avoiding the hoardes of people and pigeons and enjoying the amazing architecture of the Basillica/Doge's Palace in peace.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: cpts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over Easter for 3 days. Was a little worried hotel was a bit out of the way. It wasn't! Easy to find if you download the hotel directions. 5minutes walk to choice of 2 vaporetto stops. We were given room 601 when we arrived. It was dark, cold and smelled of damp. I rang reception and asked for a change of room and we were offered room 511 which although was up and down stairs then up again turned out to be just perfect. No view but very quiet and immaculate. Great bathroom. Because it was easter we had 2 little chocolate eggs left by the bed - a nice touch. Had a nightcap in the delightful bar each evening with very quirky barman in attendance. All added to the fun. Hotel Ai mori is off the beaten track but well worth finding and a welcome relief to the crowds in busier areas. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen983
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel for the price. The location is great, in Venice it is easy to get anywhere and this location was convienient to 2 different water taxi stops. The staff was nice and friendly and the breakfast was perfect to start your day in Venice. The rooms, weren't palacial but they were cramped either. The hotel is situated in front of a small canal which was nice to order a coffee and sit out front and watch the boats the go by. I loved venice and the hotel, I would definately go back to the Ai Mori d'Oriente.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great breakfast and staff.”
Reviews.Author: FrancescaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversay (Mar. 2007)and decided to go to Venice and Florence. It was our first time to Italy and didn't know what to expect. We checked Trip Advisor before choosing a hotel and found the reviews to be helpful. We chose this hotel, first because it looked different from the rest(liked the decor)second, because of the area where it was located,Cannaregio. It was very quiet and away from all the tourists. We really got the feel of Venetian life; a small taste anyway. Our room was very nice and the bathroom rather big in comparison to some european hotels. We had great cappuccino for breakfast and a variety of rolls, croissants,cheeses and meats. It was very enjoyable and kept us going until dinner(of course we had gelato in between). We would definitely recommend this hotel and we'll stay there again when we return;and return, we will:-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: parisgirlathart
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a beautiful trip to Venice & Rome. This hotel was a great little place to stay at, all the employees their at the hotel were always very helpful, friendly, and assisting. Anytime we wanted to go somewhere they assisted us with directions or taxi's. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is not interested in staying in a expensive and booshy hotel. Rooms are very clean and equipped with mini refrigerators filled with beverages of all sorts, I loved it ! Breakfasts were perfect, since I am not a huge eater, but they always had an assortment of cereals, breads, croissants, cheeses, fruits, and on and on.... Very Happy with the place I would definately stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: austin_ang
Reviews.Content: We somehow were the luckiest people in Venice on our first visit and scored the front room right on the canal in this lovely hotel. It was the most romantic place we've ever stayed. Highly recommended - we'll be back. And the staff was very friendly despite what others have said. Nothing but friendly and helpful is what we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: tfp62
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in late July for our honeymoon. It is a short walk from the water taxi and nice 15 minute walk from the crowds of St Marks Square. There are great restaurants, shops and cafes very close by and the this area gives one a sense of everyday life in Venice. The staff are very friendly and accomodating. Our room was immaculate and the AC worked great in the middle of a brutal summer heat wave. Will definitely stay there on our next trip to Venice. Tom & Janet, Bronx, NY

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: JLW05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in August and due to some computer glitch, my review was never posted. Yesterday, after recommending this hotel to a friend, I brought up Tripadvisor on my computer in order to get prices for the hotel and to check availablitity. I was reading reviews and after reading a negative review felt compelled to try and post again. While the hotel is not centrally located, it is close to a public ferry stop. In fact, my husband and I took public transportation from the airport to the hotel. We never once felt the need to take a water taxi. The hotel is close to the old Jewish Ghetto and a short walk from quite a few restaurants and shops. We bought a tourist pass for the public ferry and were a short ride from all tourist shops. My room was small but nicely furnished and very clean. My husband and I enjoyed the breakfast each morning. I can't quite remember all that was on the menu at this point but I do recall the meat, cheeses and breads. Most importantly, the staff was super nice to me. I left NY JFK airport the day of a terrorist threat in Europe when flights were delayed. I finally arrived in Venice but my luggage didn't. I was very upset and the clerks at the front desk were very sympathetic. They called the airport for me several times and finally, when my luggage arrived more than 36 hours after we landed, the clerks at the front desk informed me of the arrival the moment my husband and I returned to the hotel from sightseeing. Also, one of the clerks at the front desk called a restaurant we wanted to dine at and gladly made reservations for us. When my husband and I left, we gave one of the clerks a modest tip and he thanked us and certainly didn't seem to have expected anything from us. I would highly recommend this hotel and if I ever return to Venice, I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Buckshee
Reviews.Content: Just back from avery pleasant 3 night stay at this hotel ( 11th - 14th february). This was our second visit to the hotel and we would certainly recommend it to anybody thinking of travelling to Venice. Slightly off the beaten track ( about 5 - 8 minutes stroll) but this is more than adequately compensated for by the fact that you get to stroll through old Venetian streets to get to the hotel ( or you can get a water taxi if your feeling lazy) . The area itself is picture postcard and just strolling the "ordinary" streets was certainly a highlight for us. Staff at the hotel were friendly, helpful and professional and the breakfast was plentiful and enjoyable. The restuarant "40 Ladroni" is for fish lovers and only 100metres away and well worth a visit and there are numerous other restaurants within stroilling distance. Any bad pooints ? The only slight annoyance was street noise. We were in room 612 and is was first floor on the gable end of the building and there was a long alley to the side which seemed to have a plentiful supply of early morning pedestrain traffic. Not really the hotels problem and certainly didn't overly detract from another great stay. Hopefully we'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: lindsjane
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at this hotel. The staff were delightful and couldn't do enough for us. The room was lovely and very clean and the hotel itself is beautifully decorated and spotless. We got engaged whilst staying at the Mori D'Oriente and the staff brought us fresh strawberries and cream with our champagne to congratulate us. Whilst the Canareggio is a little off the beaten track it's a lovely place to stay as you get to be away from all the crowds and see how actual Venetians live. And it's very handy for the vaporetto service (water bus) at San Marcuola so don't believe any of the nonsense about having to get water taxis everywhere. All I can say is that I would thoroughly recommend this hotel, enjoy your stay in Venice, it's an absolutely beautiful place!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed with the Staff--They are Arrogant, Rude and Money Hungry”
Reviews.Author: spam4derrick
Reviews.Content: On a positive note, I will say the hotel is just as nice as the photos suggest. However, beyond looks this place is a nightmare. The location is horrible as it is located on the far side of the island so you can only get to and from you room via water taxi, which can run you up to $100 per trip. It is in an area that is mainly deserted, albeit some signs of other humans. The staff is an absolute nightmare. We found them to be arrogant, rude and will nickel and dime you for every penny they can get. Because they are located so far from all the activity many of their visitors end up here by accident or for price as they are one of the cheapest 4-star hotels on the island. Don't be fooled by the nice looks. While their rates seems fair you loose the savings by having to pay for water taxis. Unless you are leaving big tips for everyone service is extremely poor. It was hard to get directions, assistance or anything else unless you are willing to pay. I wish I would have followed my instinct when I first arrived as we needed to make a phone call before checking in and was charged the equivalent of $32 US dollars to call an 800 number. From thereon is was all uphill as we paid for any and everything including extra sets of towels. The worse character of them all was the hotel manager. This guy should have been a snake oil salesman. When asked for ice one day he told us "where do you think you are this is not San Francisco, it cost money to make ice". I'm sorry for writing such a lengthy story but I don't want anyone to go through what we went through. So again, it is a nice looking hotel....but as one of the other visitors wrote "the staff must have been on vacation". Buyer Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mibur
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for three nights after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed! The staff were all very friendly and wecolming. We were given room 314, which although didn't have a view of anything except the apartment wall next door was excellent. We were not bothered about having a view from our window because we didn't plan to stay in the hotel that much anyway. The room itself was very clean and the sheets and towels were changed every day. It was really cosy and warm in the room, just what we needed after a day out visiting places of interest. The weather although dry was quite chilly outside and was a little misty at times. The breakfast which is served between 7 until 10.30 every day was certainly much better than we imagined it would be. There was a good variety of cereals. cold meat, cheese, bread rolls and scrumptious croissants. The fruit salad was also very good. It contained apple, melon, kiwi fruit, oranges, grapes etc and was always "fresh" We were also served copious amounts of Tea and coffee. All in all we would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who is not bothered about its location away from the main "tourist area" The water bus (if you don't want to walk anywhere) is only a few minutes walk away and from there you can reach all of venice in minutes (Changing at Piazzale Roma) Would we go back? Most definitely !!!!! Well worth staying here and certainly lives up to its 4* rating

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coonometer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Expedia and based my decision on the previous traveller reviews. This was our anniversary trip and I was looking for something a little special as my husband and I don't like busy hotels right in the middle of town, so this hotel was perfect! We arrived about 5pm and took a taxi from Marco Polo to Piazza Romana (cost about 30 euros). From the Piazza Romana you can take a water bus to nearest terminal to hotel (3 stops) and I have to recommend it as your first view of the town - very romantic! At hotel check in we received a very warm welcome and were taken to Room 317 which has its own balcony. It really was a good sized room and the bathroom was excellent. We ventured out to try and find something to eat in a restaurant that was local. Turning left outside the hotel and walking for about 4 mins takes you to the Iguana mexican restaurant - I recommend the chilli!! Overall this is a great hotel, very friendly staff and in a great, quiet, traditional section of Venice. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the real Venice”
Reviews.Author: LordTregaron
Reviews.Content: I loved it and will stay there again in a truly Venitian residential area. I'm sure I can do no more than echo the words of the majority of reviewers in that this hotel is perfect if you want to be away from the throng, in with the locals and in a pleasant and welcoming environment. Some have described the staff as surly or needing a holiday. One must not mistake the natural Italian character with ill-temper! They don't have to like you you know!Again, Nella gets an extra-special mention as does Snr Zanotti the Concierge (and his staff). He replied to my emails promptly without fail and in good English. My room was small with a few decor issues BUT we're talking about Venice here. ALL space is at a premium. It was clean, warm, well appointed. The breakfast room is a good size and well laid out. The bar is a reasonable size given Ai Mori D'Oriente is not a large hotel. Here's the thing, due to flight problems I arrived at the hotel at two in the morning and was welcomed as warmly and efficiently as if it were mid-afternoon, and when you consider just how some Venitian hoteliers welcome people, that's good by any standard. I highly recommend this hotel. Tudor Thomas-Davies

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Venice”
Reviews.Author: maudies5
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I have stayed at Ai Mori and now I feel like a member of the family. This has to be the nicest staff in the world. From Nella who serves breakfast to the gentlemen behind the front desk, everyone tries to make the guests feel welcome. I love the neighborhood (20 minute walk from San Marco), the local trattorias and feeling like I am in the "real Venice" when I stay in this lovely 4 star hotel. I also like the bar menu where it is possible to have a sandwich or salad at any time of day. All in all, a great property in Venice. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: geigercounter
Reviews.Content: Quite understandably I spent an age trying to select the city and hotel for our honeymoon. I really wanted to get it right and by and large I think I did. I lost count of the number of reviews I read of this hotel but the consensus seemed to be that it was something quite special. Having now stayed there I can concur with that though with a couple of reservations. The location is perfect - several others comnplained that it was a long way from the main tourist area (aka San Marco) but for is that was a delight. To leave the thronging crowds and minutes later to be walking along the quiet canals of Cannareggio was perfect. The hotel is pretty impressively decorated and well-maintained though our initial welcome could have been rather warmer. I felt rather too keenly that we were yet another couple on honeymoon here - OK they can't make a fuss over everyone but the masks had slipped rather too much even this early on in the season (June). Our room was indeed swathed in silk and with an impressive bathroom but for a deluxe room was incredibly small. I had been expecting, rather naively I suppose, a room whose size was comparabe to the splendour of the decor. I think there are a couple of larger rooms but they are rather more expensive still. Overall though the feeling of being able to throw back the shutters and look out on the day-to-day life of this wonderful city was very special. We found several excellent restaurants - many within a short walk of the hotel - and will hopefully return many times. If you are looking for somewhere special then this is seriously worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PRGNYC
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveler to Venice, I've stayed in a wide variety of places, and this hotel is one of the best I've encountered. I stayed there six nights in November, and found the staff exceptionally helpful and the room modern, spotless and wonderfully decorated to fit the hotel theme. Breakfast was far more than the usual "continental," with a wonderful selection of breads -- the olive rolls were my personal favorite -- and lemon tarts to die for. Situated close to the Venetian Ghetto, it is equi-distant to vaporetti to the outer islands of the Veneto as well as to the Grand Canal. Its location in a residential neighborhood in Venice I found to be a real plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the Ai Mori D'Oriente”
Reviews.Author: denisenyc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Italy where we spent 2 days in Venice at the Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel. We were very happy with this hotel---our room was on the first floor--I think 132, past the breakfast room, down the hall and through automatic doors to another small hallway with 5 or 6 other rooms. I usually don't like being on the first floor, but this didn't bother me. The window had an automatic 'shade' made of some sort of metal so when it was closed, the room was very quiet and dark (which I like). Breakfast was typical (croissants, yogurt, cold cuts, cheese) and very good, with nice waiters/waitresses. Bathroom was very modern and immaculate. As mentioned, this hotel is away from St. Mark's Square, but it is a plus, since you really get to see the non-touristy part of Venice, but you are still close enough to enjoy the main sites. It was nice to eat at local restaurants and stop at the local bars for a gelato or a glass of wine. We also did the Secret Itinerary Tour at the Doge's Palace and really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CelticSpirit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Ai Mori before starting our cruise. I had stayed at this hotel before for a week during Carnival and had a great experience with it (I have previously submitted a review on this site). When our travel agent offered us the choice of pre-cruise hotels (this one 4* or a 3* hotel) we immediately chose this one on previous experience. I must say I was disappointed. We did arrive late but that was due to the timing of the flight and the fact that the buses and vaparettos were on strike. We arrived approx 11.15 pm or so. We were shown to a door (after a journey through I think two buildings) with no number on it even though we were told it was room 500. When we went in the first thing we saw were a pair of boots on the floor beside a coffee table and a plastic bag with some items in it. The coffee table was in front of a sofa. To the left of the sofa there appeared to be a bathroom/shower of some sort (did not investigate). There was also a flight of stairs within this room which led to a door (presumably another room) at the top of the stairs. There was a wooden decorative screen dividing this sofa, table and bathroom from a door on the right - the one we were shown to. This was our bedroom. It was one of the tiniest I had ever seen. I asked where the window was and was shown a skylight over the pillow area of the bed. (about 15/20 ft up) even though the rest of the ceiling was normal height. What would we have done in the event of fire? We could only open our cases by putting them on the bed. We tried to change the room to be told that it was the only one left and the hotel was full and they would move us the following day if we so wished. We did wish and we were moved. I must say I felt most uncomfortable sleeping in this room the first night. We left the skylight open for air but had to close it when it started raining during the night. I kept wondering who owned the boots outside the door, if maybe staff used the room to sleep on the sofa whilst on a break. When we mentioned this we were just given a shrug. Anyhow the boots and plastic bag were still there next morning. After breakfast we went back to the room to pack up to go to the other room. On our way out we noticed the boots were gone and voices were coming from the open bathroom asking us to "come back later, we are taking a shower and are not yet finished." The voices were from an American couple who were showering together and who presumably were the owners of the plastic bag and boots. We could only gather or surmise that they were from the room at the top of the stairs. All I can say is it was the weirdest set up I have seen. We had booked this hotel months previously through our travel agent and I must say I did not like room 500. Everything else about the hotel was up to expectations including their wonderful breakfast. If I stay in this hotel again I will book a superior room. Certainly over â‚¬500 was too expensive for two nights in this room.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hlg123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the recommendation of our travel agent on our first trip to Venice to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. We found the staff most helpful as we arrived early (8:30 AM) after flying all night from the US. We freshened up in the WC off the main lobby and enjoyed a leisurely breakfast. Since our room wouldn't be ready until early afternoon the front desk staff provided us with a map and walking instructions to the Grand Canal which was just a few minutes a way. We purchased a 24 hour ticket for the Vaporetto (12 Euro/person) and spent the morning traveling on the canal taking pictures and exploring neighborhoods a various stops along the way. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path but and in a quiet section of the city near the Jewish Ghetto. We enjoyed sitting at the outdoor cafes near by while enjoying a cocktail and watching the locals go buy. We took advantage of the hotel's offer to send us to Murano (no charge for the water taxi over) and explored Colanna (a nearby island) before returning via Vaporetto. Due to the hotel's location, I recommend taking a water taxi to and from the airport (90 Euro one way) but well worth not having to drag luggage through the walk ways of the city. At 150 Euro/night this was a bargain and we'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Spot”
Reviews.Author: Boston4_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just as "advertised" via TripAdvisor. Great location - a pleasure to get away from the maddening crowds of Venice. Definitely difficult to find the first time when you're dragging your suitcases. It would be helpful to get a detailed map of the area when you book. Breakfast was very nice and the rooms beautifully decorated. One strange thing was that there were mosquitoes in abundance in the hotel. Didn't see them outside. Maybe it's a Venice thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeriley12
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel were 100% correct. The hotel is a great value, the staff is friendly, and the location (away from the crowds) is great. We were in Venice in early July for four days. It was hot but the hotel air conditioning worked great, so no worries there. The area around San Marco really was overrun by tourists (Think the mall around Christmas time), which was aggravating at times, but did not detract from the overall beauty and great time that we had while we were there. I was concerned before we left that it would be too hot to sightsee but was happy to find out that it really isn't that bad (No hotter than NYC in the summer). I would definitely not hesitate to go to Italy in the summer again and that includes Florence and Rome. To put things in perspective we are in our late 20's and in relatively good shape, so other people may have differing opinions.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ai mori d`oriente”
Reviews.Author: crapau
Reviews.Content: Date 12/08/2006 We have just returned from a five day break in venice staying in the hotel ai Mori d`oriente we found using tripAdvisor and booked throught Expidia and we found the hotel to be just as described online, lovely Decor , very clean and staff that were very helpfull and spoke english better an my italian. It was our first time in venice so were not to sure how to get around, armed with a map of venice and a route to the hotel we boarded the bus just outside arrivels ( info and tickets on the right just passed the water taxi desk on your left inside the terminal 4 euros for two ) and headed for piazzale roma " 20 min`s away so far no problems" we boareded a vaporrtto ( 10 euros for two with suit cases you can pay on board ) and headed for madonna dell`orto "15 min`s" the boat crew were helpfull, jumped off at our stop and found our hotel a couple of bridges away about 10 min`s walk "no problem" That was the most difficult part of the trip, walking around the city we found easy you can`t get lost and also safe we never felt uneasy even at night. Gondola ride 1 hour (40 min`s in reality) 150 euros but worth it. we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ai Mori”
Reviews.Author: kflint
Reviews.Content: Venice: Hotel Ai Mori D'Oriente Date: August 9, 2006 Reviewer: Karen F. Atlanta, Ga. Spent 3 days here and loved the serenity after a busy day fighting through crowds. Hotel is set back but only a few minutes walk to restaurants and water taxis. The room was immaculant and well decorated 'Venetian' style. Compared to many accomodations found the price to be excellant and good value. If I return to Venice I will certainly stay here again. Hint - Skip trip to Murano -very pushy and overpriced. We warmed up to the Barman after two days, he is getting a bad rap in these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Gem Away from the Chaos... for a good price too!”
Reviews.Author: MsFabulous
Reviews.Content: Prepare to walk a lot in Venice, but you can get around to all major points via the vaporetto easily enough. This hotel is very clean, nicely decorated, and the service is very very helpful. This is not a 4 or 5 star hotel, but you could pay more than double at other hotels that claim they are, and not get the quality that this one offers. This one is located in a more residential neighborhood, away from the maddening crowds of the Piazza San Marco. For a quick meal, buy good quality foods and a bottle of wine at the supermarket around the corner, (for a fraction of the paninis in the tourist areas). Breakfast that is included is plentiful and tasty. Book online on their own website, it was cheaper than all the other hotel sites and probably less than half their published rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: Kazusa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on a recent trip to Venice. I booked it based on recommendations on Tripadvisor and all the reviews were accurate and we were thrilled with the hotel. The hotel was beautiful, clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful (except the miserable barman) and the price was reasonable considering we were there in peak season. The bathrooms were a lot bigger than I was expecting and the hotel room was very comfortable for the 2 of us. Breakfast was delicious and the service was wonderful. The hotel is quite a way away from the main buzz, which was a nice relief at the start and end of the day. Walking through magnificent Venice made the 20-30 minute walk to and from San Marco go by in a flash. We didn't even realize the walk was that far until we decided to time it the one day. We just soaked up the sun and the views and before we knew it we were in the bustle. My only complaint is to beware if you're bringing heavy suitcases and if you want to get there by public transport. We were away for a while so we each had a large suitcase. It was quite a challenge getting there. We were recommended to catch a bus, then a waterbus and then to walk to the hotel but we didn't know we had to cross at least 6 bridges, which meant walking up and down stairs with heavy luggages in the scorching heat (public transport cost us around 15 Euro's) We then decided we'd catch a private water taxi on the way back to airport because we couldn't handle the trauma and it cost us 90 Euro's which was a lot more than we had wanted to pay. If you're going for the weekend with light luggage, public transport is the way to go. I'd highly recommend this hotel and we were very happy with our stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1 Night”
Reviews.Author: baileyfirestone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ai Mori D'Oriente for 1 night before we took occupancy of a Venice apartment. We selected this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and while the stay was OK for 1 night, we are not sure that we would stay there again. We were in room 601 which is on a lower level in a newer addition of the hotel. While there were 3 windows in the room, they were above eye-level making us feel as if we were in the basement. It also made it quite dark in the room because of the lack of natural light. The room itself was small, but quite nice. It was decorated in a Turkish style (red and gold) with a brocade like wallpaper and beautiful marble flloors. The bathroom was amazing, both in size and amenties. A deep bathtub, shower with toilet and sink along with another sink in the ante-room outside the bathroom. There were very nice toiletries and good water pressure. The room had a safe, mini-bar, small TV and A/C - which we were very grateful for given the temperature and humidity while we were there. One of our personal pet peeves is getting plastic cups instead of glass and this hotel opted for plastic. Although the in-room card identified fresh orange juice, scrambled eggs and omelettes for breakfast (we thought this was unusual for Italy), these items were not offered at the buffet. There was cheese, 3 kinds of sliced meat and rolls, cereal, yogurt, juice and coffee service. We appreciated the hard boiled eggs since they are not always available at hotels that include breakfast. The location of the hotel was toward the back of Canneregio near the Adriatic side. This could be convenient if you use the Aliguna boat from the airport. If you don't, it is somewhat of a hike from the San Marcuola vaporetto stop over 2 bridges - a disadvantage if you have a lot of luggage. There was a strange electrical incense machine pouring vapors in the lobby. Not sure why this was there, but we did not view it as a positive. While this was not a bad hotel experience, we would only consider it in the future if we were not in a basement room.

Reviews.Title: “OK!”
Reviews.Author: crodriguez
Reviews.Content: MY husband and I arrived at this hotel on our last leg of our first anniversary trip. We arrived tired...especially from dragging our luggage from Tuscany and through the rocky streets of Venice. Arriving at the hotel, we were told there was no rooms due to overbooking but they said they had put us up in a hotel 50 metres away. I tried not to be too angry. But I did tell the manager that 1)they better take our luggage for us to the new hotel 2)we need compensation of a nice dinner at a restaraunt..paid by them and 3)upon returning the next night, be placed in a nice room. All was accomplished! The hotel we stayed at was a loft style hotel...clean, nice but not my style. Residenza Carneggie..was a bit more artsy and architectural style. Breakfast was provided. The next day at Hotel Ai' Mori..the staff was always friendly...the dinner they paid for us was delicious...and upon arrival at our original hotel, the staff delivered a bottle of champagne. The rooms we nicely decorated, clean....even though the restrooms were small..what can u expect in Europe. All is the same....in hotels as I have seen. It was nice to stay at a hotel away from the bustle of the lights, people and noise. Make sure u get the 3 day waterferry pass....well worth it. We took it for 2 days and it beats walking. Even though we did plenty of it ....

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was rated very highly on the Trip Advisor , however dispite viewing the typical rooms on the web site we found our room to be extremly small even by British standards with a window looking at a concrete wall. We asked for a change but none were available that were better . We checked about a upgrade which was available for 100 euros extra per night !!! The Hotel otherwise was good, the room was well appointed , the Breakfasts were excellent with very friendly staff. Indeed all the staff were freindly apart from the Barman who had seemed to have had a happiness bypass !! While the Hotel is off the beaten track - thats part of its charm - we suggest that you walk everywhere , it takes no time and its better than paying mega bucks for a water taxi or being cramed on to a water bus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel on the last part of our honeymoon vacation to Italy. If we started with this hotel and with Venice, we would have never left!!!! The staff was excellent, very helpful, courteous and professional. The room we stayed in was gorgeous! We had a lovely view of the canal and the bathroom was spacious and clean. The breakfast in the morning offered many selections from fresh fruits to omelettes upon our request. We were happy with the location because it was close enough to what we wanted to see, but just enough away from the hustle and bustle of the city. We highly enjoyed sitting outside the hotel after a busy day with a cocktail from their bar. We will be traveling back to Italy and will definitely stay at this hotel again. This is a must stay at hotel, don't miss out!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the hotel and had no problems with our room, other than almost needing a map to find our room (and the hotel itself). We tried to book a second night, but they was no room at the inn. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is a little out of the way, but once you do find it (we had to ask only 2 locals for directions) its a great location, away from much of the tourist traffic, but not too far from the train station. The room itself was completely unique, decorated in the some sort of Turkish style (see photos). There was one window, but it was too high to have any sort of view. Couldn't tell you how their food was, but they had some sort of weird cauldron near the reception which put our this overwhelming, lemony smell. Other than that, the room was clean, and was a very "Venetian" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (party of 6, 3 couples) booked this hotel based on the glowing reviews in Trip Advisor. How dissapointed we were with this second rate hotel. On our arrival we were allocated the basement 'family suite' even though I had rung previously to say that we were 3 couples. And when does a family have 5 different surnames!!. The room we were given had no window and no bathroom, just a was hand basin picture 1). Our bathroom was down a flight of stairs and along a corridor. The room was unsafe as it had lighting cord taped with masking tape to the ceiling (see pictures 2 and 3). There was obviously a damp problem too as mould had started to grow at the bottom of the corridor walls. As you can imagine we were not happy and were duely moved to new rooms on the second night. Our problems didnâ€™t end here, one of our group was sitting outside the hotel and was approached by the barman saying that if they werenâ€™t having a drink they could not use the seats. After saying that he was a guest at the hotel, the barman said he could sit there for 5 minutes!!. The breakfast was pathetic, Ai Mori doesnâ€™t have any kitchen facilities so there are no cooked items just pre-packed cold food, the breakfast room was very small with little to no room to move about. Overall this is not a 4 star hotel, it is more like 2 or possibly 3. The staff are rude, the rooms are basic. The only good thing about this hotel is its location far from St Marks Square. Please think twice about staying at the Ai Mori.

Reviews.Title: “Room OK, Service Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our superior room was smaller than expected but charming. It was located on an upper level in an annex building with no elevator. Our bathroom was a decent size and we didn't have any problems with the air conditioning. The location of the hotel offered some refuge from the swarms of tourists we encountered everywhere else (yes, even in early May). The breakfast was good as everyone mentions - better than 2 hotels we stayed at in Rome and Florence earlier in the trip. The staff, however, was not well-trained or not interested in customer service (except for one very friendly and capable woman who served breakfast). There were far too many people behind the front desk but they always kept you waiting - and never a greeting when you walk up. We had to drag information out of them - for instance, where and when breakfast is served - a simple bit of information that is usually volunteered in other places. The porter made us carry one of our suitcases up the stairs and would expect us to step out of his way when passing in the narrow corridors. Needless to say, we didn't tip him. I saw 4-stars outside this hotel but obviously someone was being too generous.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: SouthernPotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel in late May for two nights, well should have been two nights, but when we went to check in our rooms were unable to be used (for unexplained reasons), & we had to be moved to another hotel, 500 metres down the road. Sounds bad, but the staff were all very apologetic & straight away explained that we were to be moved just down the road to a similar standard hotel. The staff made it no where as bad as it sounds & the hotel we were moved to was excellent & well worth a try (Residenza Cannaregio). On finally getting a room for the second night, the room was very nice & a nice sized bathroom as well. Very well presented room & A/C working. Also a complimentary bottle of champagne to say sorry for the inconvenience for the previous night! Very nice. Service from staff was excellent at all times. The Cannaregio area was really interesting & we were very gald to get away from all the crowds of St. Marks, etc. & it was an interesting area just to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: Macananina
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and exotic little gem, located away from Tourist crowds, yet close to everything! Rooms are pretty and clean and the bathrooms are spacious and spotless; try all the complimentary "Etro" shampoos and body wash, they smell delicious! The staff always ready to help with a friendly smile and for the chocolate lovers, the hot chocolate (ciocolatto) and nutella spread in the breakfast room are a must!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Venice on a trip for our one year anniversary. We stayed at Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel. The hotel was ok. It was a good value for what you got, but our room had a window that looked at a concrete wall. The bathrooms are nice and the rooms are decorated very charming, but I could not help feeling Closter phobic in the room with the window looking out at the wall. The rooms are small and the hotel location is not great. Venice is not easy to get around even with a map and the hotel is quite out of the way. Water taxi rides cost us 90 euro from the hotel. The breakfast is good and the staff is very friendly. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, though this is not the place. I was a bit disappointed after reading the great reviews, but my experience was not that of a 5 star hotel like some of the reviews say. If you are looking for a 5 star experience, I suggest spending the money to stay some where else.

Reviews.Title: “A nice gem”
Reviews.Author: jimdago
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in early May, and wished it had been longer. Really a cut above other hotels we've stayed in across Europe in this class, and definitely worth all of its four stars in every respect. Our room on the first floor (109) was very well furnished and comfortable, albeit a little small. The staff was very professional and helpful, although the bald gent at the bar takes his job a bit too seriously. Breakfast was also a cut above the norm. Get directions to the hotel before you go and if you don't mind a 10-minute walk from the train station (including 3 small bridges), you'll save the 70-euro water taxi fare. The neighborhood around the hotel is relaxed and not touristy. It's a short 5-min. walk to either the Grand Canal or the lagoon to catch the vaporetto. Highly recommended and worth another stay without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: 2_x_Travellers
Reviews.Content: This was our first time back in Venice in 20 years, and staying at the Ai Mori Oriente was a wonderful choice. This hotel is in such a fabulous location, you feel like you are amongst the Venetians, rather than the crowds in and around St Marks Square. We ate at local restaurants, and as previously mentioned in other reviews, were not disappointed. We found the staff to be very helpful, and our room was very clean (room 312). We took the water bus from the airport, and either walked or used the nearby water bus services for the 4 days we were in Venice. This hotel may not be in the centre of everything, but we prefer being slightly away from the hustle & bustle, and will definately be returning to this hotel when we return to Venice. HOT TIP - Book the Secret Tour at the Doges Palace - you will not be disapointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful atmosphere, great location...escape from the other tourists!”
Reviews.Author: lrslippers
Reviews.Content: We booked Ai Mori D'oriente based on tripadvisor reviews and got exactly what we asked for, a spacious, quiet room with a nice bath and a view. While we were walking we also looked at other small and well-recommended hotels but found nothing we liked nearly so much as Ai Mori D'oriente. We were in room 102, directly over the entrance but it was not too noisy and we had two beautiful windows overlooking the canal. Armando at the desk was extremely helpful, both by e-mail and in person. We never had to wait for anything. BUT do take the water taxi to and from the airport. It is certainly worth it. The Cannaregio neighborhood is very quiet and populated by real people. The restaurants recommended nearby were excellent and we loved walking in this area. After being around hawkers and spray-painted people looking for a handout around San Marco, we were always glad to get back to our old fashioned and real neighborhood. I would certainly stay here again and recommend that my friends do the same.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in italy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we just returned from three weeks in fabulous italy...i planned our entire trip based on reading reviews on tripadvisor...and we weren't disappointed...our first stop was venice for 6 nights and i am so glad we chose to stay at this hotel...from the moment we arrived by water taxi to their door they were waiting on the street to help us....all the guys at the desk were wonderful and helpful...arranging trips and reservations, etc...they recommended some wonderful restaurants which are a few minutes walk from the hotel...and helped us find places on our maps...breakfast was terrific...the best we had anywhere ...especially the cappuccino.....ummmmm....we had a suite overlooking the canal and it was perfect for our 26th anniversary visit...the location is perfection....just outside of the very heavy touristy areas...we walked everywhere easily ( we like walking so we can eat more gelati) and didn't take a vapperotto at all.....we would stay here again without doubt and i highly recommend this hotel to everyone.....i can't wait to return... jacki gran miami, fl

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights early May - lovely quiet location but easy to get to and away from all the jammed streets around St. Marks. Got the water taxi both ways- very extravagant but great fun! Nice hotel - superior room was good and breakfast fine. Staff very friendly and helpful - definitely would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: main_sider
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in April 2006. The location is excellent, away from the tourist hoardes in an area where there are proper Venetian restaurants and bars. Best tip is to head over the bridge opposite the hotel, down one street, turn right and keep going until you get to Al Bacco restaurant. Looks nothing special but the food, mainly fish, is amazing....and go for the house red at 10 euros for 1l, superb. The hotel has obviously been refurbished fairly recently, our room was spacious and very clean. It is a bit of a labyrinth but room 413 was fine. The only disappointment was that the air conditioning is in fact a heater, it doesn't cool. On the first night it was too hot to sleep and so we opened the window - big mistake. We were beseiged the midges, resulting in about 50 bites between us! Keep the windows closed and suffer the heat!! The breakfast is excellent, the staff all friendly - the breakfast box they provided given our early start on the final day was very disappointing - but if you want to experience Venice away from the masses of people then it comes recommended. Final tip - pay extra rather than fly to Treviso with Ryanair, terrible airport, 2.5 hours of queuing, slow coach trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, the staff of this hotel were friendly and helpful, the rooms were large, comfortable, spotless, and well appointed, and the breakfast was awesome. What makes this hotel very special is it's location. The location is Venice like Venice should be.....away from the masses of tourists and tourist shops....beautiful and serene. We enjoyed the 15 minute walk to San Marco each morning going past small restaurants, butcher shops, fruit markets, pastry shops........This is Venice like we thought Venice would be...an oasis after spending several days in Rome. My fondest memories are just sitting outside of this hotel along the canal with a glass of wine talking with other travelers.. The downside of this hotel......we enjoyed the location so much, that I spend several days in Venice and never rode a Vaporetta or Gondola....

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: KerryLouLou
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay here over the Easter weekend and booked it because of all the good reviews on here. The hotel was immaculately decorated and the staff were always helpful and polite. The breakfast was adequate - typical continental - a variety of breads, croissants, pastries, crackers, cakes, ham, cheese, pate, cereals, fruit salad, juices and hot drinks. The location was lovely - in the Canareggio region to the noth of the island. It really only took 5 mins to the 2 closest vaporetto stops (Madonna del'Orto if you're heading towards Murano and San Marcuolo for heading down the Grand Canal towards St Marks). As we arrived late on our first day we decided to get a water taxi which cost us 60euros from the airport as we shared with another couple. It really was well worth it - a quick and luxsurious way to transfer to your hotel. It does take a little way to get your bearings adn find your way down the alleys. Having said that, we didn't get lost at all. We used the water buses absolutely loads - buy a tourist pass (1,3 or 7 day) - we paid 25 euros for 3 days. I only have one or 2 very small whinges about the hotel. When we arrived at 11pm we were shown to a room by a porter in jeans and trainers (the rest of the time everyone was immaculately dressed), out room was number 621 which was up quite a lot of winding stairs with no lift ( i think it was on the 2nd or third floor!). We also paid for a superior room - whilst our room was beautifully decorated it was overlooked by the apartments about 3 feet accross the alleyway (no canal view), it had no sofa or table as advertised. We did question this but were told unfortunately nothing could be done as they were fully booked. A few lovely touches though like little easter eggs left for us by the bed each night, turn down service and a note about the following days weather. Ate at a couple of plces recommeded on here too - Antico Mola - lovley, home cooked food but very slow service and pretty chep (50 euros for 3 courses for 2). We couldnt get into ANice STellato - fully booked but tried 40 Ladroni which is on the same road as the hotel (out of the door turn right and carry on for about 200 yards). We had a great meal here, good wine, excellent on the house grappa and packed full of italians which is a good sign! Pop into the casino which is just a co9uple of mins from the hotel - its worth wasting a few euros!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BelsizeM
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the glowing reviews in trip advisor and felt I had to write about my experience.
