We arrived late at night (having given advance warning to the hotel) and were given room 401. This has a tiny bathroom, the smallest I've ever seen in any hotel and believe me I've been travelling for at least 20 years. I had to climb over the toilet to get into the shower which was over a 'bath' which was about half the size of a normal bath. The room was also freezing because it was in an outbuilding attached to the hotel. I complained but was told the hotel was full and couldn't change room until the next day. The next morning we were moved to room 502 in the basement of the main building. This time the problem was the smell of drains and dampness which triggered my asthma and ruined my weekend. The bar lacked atmosphere, probably because of the unwelcoming barmen working there. On the positive side, I must say the breakfast was excellent and managed by very friendly staff and the location was perfect. However, don't go there expecting a 4 star hotel and please make sure you don't get the rooms we were given.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic location - lovely and clean”
Reviews.Author: jeanrelle
Reviews.Content: Due to reviews seen here on the TripAdvisor, my partner and I took a chance on this hotel. We were not disapointed. The location is great - off the tourist track and you felt you mixed with the locals. All comments made in other reviews are exactly what we experience. In no time we became locals of a wine bar called La Cantina - on the Strata Nova. Nearby is a great restaurant - Vini Da Gigio. Was packed everynight! We recommend Trattoria 'Ai Cugnai' - address, di Andreatto Leonida - family run place...two old women serve you and they really make you welcome! We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ai Mori d'Oreinte”
Reviews.Author: cecebe
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Venice. We were thrilled to be located in the Cannareggio - in a neighborhood and out of the heavily touristed areas. We walked from the train station to the hotel when we arrived. Our luggage was on wheels and it just took us about 15 or 20 minutes...very easy...and exciting to explore along the way. We walked nearly everywhere (with a good map) for the four days we were there - the walk to locations was as fascinating as the destination. We did take the vaporetto to San Marco - it was just about a 5 minute walk from the hotel to the vaporetto stop. Our room was very large - even by American standards - and pleasantly decorated. The bathroom was beautiful (loved the heated towel bar). Breakfast was nice and convenient. Fairly standard European buffet served in a nice room. One of the best restaurants in Venice (in our opinion) is just down the street - Anice Stellato. It was superb...warm and charming on a March evening. Our main dish was a mounded platter of the most delicately deep fried seafood. The restaurant was packed with locals. We would have loved to stay longer in Venice and at the Ai Mori d'Oriente...and will certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: moot
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, value for money. (I emailed hotel and booked direct with very helpful and efficient staff to get best rate in comparison to other websites). Walked from Pza Roma after late arrival and with a map it is okay to find, and there is a signpost to the hotel on a little alleyway nearby. Definitely enjoyed being just a little away from the tourist hordes and felt very safe at all times as a single female with 2 children. Found fantastic pizza restaurant called Vesuvio (recommended by the hotel and by a 1999 Rough Guide so still in business!)- ask hotel for directions. Lots of tourist places don't take credit card (some entry fees, concert tickets, local bars, waterbus passes etc so take enough cash!) Waterbus passes excellent value and our tickets were checked. Tip-Got bus to Lido for a beach afternoon- just walk across from Lido vaporetto stop down Gran Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta to the beach on the Adriatic. Finally, if you know even a few words of Italian use them- the Italians definitely appreciate the effort and in some places service improved considerably!

Reviews.Title: “Great location away from the hordes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely perfect--alongside a quiet canal, a few minutes walk off the beaten track--so that you're not in the thronging tourist-zone. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant (it does a lovely breakfast tho'), but there are plenty of nice, authentic bars & restaurants around, the Antica Mola on Fondamenta Misericordia being one. Shame our room was a bit dark & didn't have a view, but the staff were very friendly and helpful. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem !”
Reviews.Author: faithfull
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews & we were not disappointed.When we left England it was really cold & on arriving in Italy we found it was warm enough to sit outside for a leisurly lunch after our journey.The bus was just outside the airport & then we walked from Piazza Roma to the hotel stopping for the lunch really just to get our bearings - took about 20 minutes & was fine as we travelled light. The first night we found the Diana restauarnt mentioned by a few people - made the fatal error of ordering off the specials menu without asking the price & ended up with rather more than we had anticipated The people on the next table were looking in astonishment as all these plates arrive after we thought we had finished ! OK meal but not worth what we paid for it still you learn!Plenty of nice places to eat near the hotel - we found the hotel bar really pleasant & thought the prices were no worse than at home. The hotel itself was faultless & the staff were amazingly efficient.Took a water taxi all the way down the Grand Canal to St Marco's which was well worth it for the views on the way.Took some brilliant pictures - the light in Venice is very unusual.The 2 churches near to the hotel are well worth a visit - one was Tintoretto's church & both are crammed with art.A fantastic break & we would reccomend this hotel wholeheartedly !

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: Sarnia G
Reviews.Content: What a superb find! Having visited Venice before, I didn't want to stay in the busier areas (San Marco, Rialto) as it's just too noisy to get a decent night's sleep. This hotel is located in the quiet Cannaregio area, which is mainly residential. We (my mother and I) took a water-taxi from the airport (cost: â‚¬90) as we were arriving late in the evening after a long day's travel. Our room was spotlessly clean and spacious, as was the bathroom. The check-in staff were courteous and helpful, and had already proved their worth by making dinner reservations for us at a couple of restaurants. (If you're visiting at Carnival it's probably worth pre-booking dinner reservations). Public areas also were beautifully presented, and specially decorated for Carnival (masks, etc). The breakfast room seemed quite small, but we never waited for more than a couple of minutes for a table, despite the hotel being fully booked. There was a good choice of rolls, croissants, pastries, fresh fruit salad, cheese, meats, yoghurts. For an additional cost, various hot dishes were on offer. I would definitely stay here on my next visit to Venice. Although a bit of a walk to St Mark's Square, it is such a delight to meander through Venice that distance is not an issue. There are several good restaurants in the area, including one on Fond. de la Misericordia where we had a delicious meal - Osteria da Rioba. Don't be put off by the some-what simple decor. The food is wonderful, and not outrageously expensive!

Reviews.Title: “great stay at Ai Mori”
Reviews.Author: supercoupe
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I spent three nights here in October. We loved this hotel,the location was slightly off the beaten track but only 5 mins to main thoroughfare,setting is quiet and romantic.Paid a little extra for a superior room which was large ,beautifully decorated and very clean. The breakfasts were excellent with plenty of choice and the reception staff helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with 2 friends stayed at this hotel for 4 nights last week. We all agreed that it did not have the feel of the usual tourist hotel, but was more reminiscent of an exclusive, private club.This feeling was enhanced by all the staff with whom we came into contact.The receptionists were smart, professional, and exceptionally pleasant.Nothing was too much trouble to ensure their guests' satisfaction. It was a pleasure to be greeted in the breakfast room each morning by smiling, cheerful, waiting staff ready to take your beverage order.The breakfasts themselves were excellent, with plenty of of choice.The rolls and pastries were delicious.In addition were the normal cereals, yoghurts, cheeses and hams that are part of a continental breakfast. A speciality was the delicious fresh fruit salad. Our bedroom and bathroom, and also those of our friends were furnished to an excellent standard. The interior design reflected the hotels previous history as a Turkish palace. The housekeeping was also of a high standard.Bedlinen and towels were immaculate and changed everyday. The hotel is situated alongside a quiet canal in Cannaregio. It is a peaceful residential district, with an interesting street market.Just far enough away from the main tourist areas,but within an easy stroll of the Grand Canal and all its attractions.There are plenty of good reasonably priced restaurants within a couple of minutes walk of the hotel. We are regular visitors to Italy and have stayed in many good hotels,this one has something special.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations when there was an issue”
Reviews.Author: KimmyA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a trip to Italy for our first anniversary. We stayed at the Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel while in Venice on March 4th and 5th. When we first got to the hotel, our room wasn't available because there was an issue with the power. They transferred us to another hotel which was initially disappointing (it was a nice enough hotel, but not as nice as Ai Mori d'Oriente). The next morning they brought us back to the Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel and gave us the best suite in the hotel! It was a wonderful room and they also provided us with wine and a fruit basket. We hadn't complained at all about being transfered to the other hotel, so when they surprised us with the suite and wine, we felt they had far exceeded our customer service expectations in dealing with the issue. The staff was the friendliest that we encountered in Italy, especially Marco the manager. They had an excellent breakfast. It was a little out of the way of the main area, but that ended up being okay as we got some extra exercise in walking to and from. Only negative is they recommended a restaurant called Osteria 40 Ladroni. Other people on Tripadvisor seemed to enjoy it, but if you go, definitely don't order the shrimp and polenta. We had the worst meal of our trip there- maybe it was just an off night for them.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, charming, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night for around $110. Didn't really know what to expect but were happy with what we found. Our room was pretty tiny, fitting a double bed, small desk, and a closet, but most people don't go to Venice to lounge in their room. What was most important was that it was very clean. The bathroom was narrow, and the shower was really small (since only half of the shower is covered by a glass "door," you have to put in a little effort to not get water all over the bathroom floor); however, it was modern and very clean. The breakfast was pleasant - there's a decent selection (cereal, croissants, fruit salad, yogurt, pound cake, etc.) We flew in, took the bus (I think it's #5? Just ask someone at the airport which bus to take to get to Piazzale Roma) from Mestre to the bus station (Piazzale Roma) - this took around 30 minutes. The bus ride costs 2 euro per person. We paid the bus driver, who gave us tickets, which we didn't validate on the bus at the time since we didn't know (if you don't stamp it, you can technically use it again) - however, it was strange because we noticed that every single person just got on the bus without paying or validating their ticket - we assumed that 1) they were taking their chances since it's not really regulated OR 2) they had bus passes. From Piazzale Roma, it's supposedly a 12 minute walk to the hotel - however, we didn't have a good map on us, and got totally lost - it turns out we ended up making a circle (yes, we walked east to the Rialto Bridge then back up again). We ended up buying a detailed map which didn't seem to help all that much, and all in all, it took about 2 hours to get to the hotel. HOWEVER, it really isn't that difficult to get there! It's literally a 10 minute walk or so. I suggest that you first ask directions to go to the Santa Lucia train station - from there it's a piece of cake. You pretty much walk down the main road (if you were facing the train station), go down the main road that right on the right of the train station and parallel to the canal...then it's best to ask for directions from there. We laughed at how short of a distance it really was. The hotel's location is great - it's a nice and quiet residential neighborhood. There's a supermarket called Billa nearby, if you want to pick up some water or snacks. Also, if you want to go to Murano, the hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the dock. Ask the hotel for directions (quite easy since their are vaporetto signs) and take #42. The hotel is about a 20-30 minute walk to Piazzo San Marco, depending on how fast you are! Oh and one last piece of advice, if you are taking any overnight train from Venice to Rome, or any other destination that's quite long...make sure to get a reserved seat! Our cabin filled up quickly, and some people had to stand or sit outside. The other thing is that if you have the extra money, upgrade yourself to a bed or something more comfortable than a regular seat! In 2nd class at least, there are 6 seats per cabin - it's set up so that you are facing and sharing leg room with someone directly in front of you, so it gets really uncomfy on long rides!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was elegant! The staff, especially Front Desk clerk, Roberto, were VERY helpful, courteous and professional. The breakfast was complete with fresh fruits, yogurts, cereals, sweets, meats and cheese. The breakfast staff was also remarkable. Although we saw little of the behind the scenes staff, the rooms and public areas were impeccably clean! It was an enjoyable experience. Felt like a Queen!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: Jamesh764
Reviews.Content: We had the first two nights of our honeymoon in Venice, and we stayed at Ai Mori d'Oriente. This hotel is off the beaten track, towards the edge of the city, meaning that it is more tranquil, quieter and much more romantic that the bustling hotels in the centre. Having said that, it was only a 10 minute walk to the centre, so we never felt we were missing out on any of the excitement of being in Venice. Our room was opulently decorated, but on the cosy side. Bar service was excellent. Breakfasts were fine, though nothing special by Italian standards. There is no restaurant for evening dining, but this was not a problem due to the vast amount of choice in the surrounding area. We were in Venice in May when it was just warm enough to wear a light jacket, but not hot enough for the canals to stink.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: LMGriffiths
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ai Mori D'Oriente from 2nd March to 5th March inclusive to celebrate my 50th Birthday. We booked this Hotel on the basis of the very positive Trip Advisor reviews, liking what we had read about the Ai Mori, its staff and location. Its a beautiful Hotel in a quiet area and with helpful staff. Its also a bit quirky. As the hotel has expanded into the two adjoining buildings, it can be a bit of a trek to get to the rooms. Labrynthine is the word that springs to mind The Hotel was pretty full when we stayed and we were only able to book standard rooms. They were nice, but not as nice as the rooms pictured on Trip Advisor. Our particular room (513) was very warm - unbearably so on occasion and we had to switch off the central heating. The air conditioning is not available at this time of the year, so that was not a solution. We had to open the velux window all day and all night to keep the temperature down. One solution would be to switch off the fridge - but it does prove handy to store your own drinks and provisions. The cost of the mini bar items was high, as were the bar prices. There was some room noise, but it was not unbearable. It did not prevent sleep. I think it just depends who happens to be occupying next door at any particular time. The bathroom was beautiful. Really attractive marble tiles. The breakfast was adequate. I have certainly had better, but there should be something for evryone on offer and if not eggs, bacon etc are available at a 3 to 6 Euro supplement. We found that if we got down to breakfast by 8:30 am we got a table easily, after that, be prepared to queue/wait. Couple of other points worth making. One website indicated that the Hotel provided bathrobes and slippers. They may do, but not for us or any of our other 4 travellers. Also, the pillows are high and hard. As I have arthritis problems I asked at Reception for a slim and soft pillow and one appeared as if by magic - and they put it on my side of the bed!(How did they know?) People with disabilities certainly need to point out that they need to be either on the ground floor or have access to the (small) lift. Not all rooms do. All the Reception staff were very helpful. They even lined up to say goodbye to us at the end of our stay. As there were 6 of us we travelled to and from the Hotel by water taxi. It cost 90 Euros each way, so worked out well for our party. We also hired a Gondola at Rialto which cost 60 Euros. My advice is to haggle. You will find that you do get reductions. Its then a question of whether you feel that you have managed to achieve value for money. If pushed we could probably have down better. The hotel is within 20 mins of St Marks Square and its an easy find. We walked most of the time and did not get lost once. Besides, almost every building has a sign signalling the direction to the major sights. The Vaparetto is good value too. However, we used it only a few times over two days. In the main we were disappointed with the restaurants we chose. Watch out for those which demand a cover charge 2 -3 Euros per person, plus a 12% service charge on top. We had some nice meals, but not consistently so. The welcome at Diana (see earlier reviews) was warm and genuine. 5 of us had excellent meals, but the sixth member of the party had a fillet steak that was off. The owner was very apologetic. However, I would not let that put you off. It was by far the best Restaurant we visited. In others we were served sole, which tasted more like a shoe than a fish! Again in another Trattitoria dei Peochi, we had "fillet" steak which was not a fillet at all. (Welsh Black Beef it most certainly was not. Our conclusion overall was that the Venetians do pasta and pizza well, but that for meat the standard was a bit hit or miss. We may just have chosen badly, but none of the restaurants we chose were cheap. Most of the recommeded Restuarants in the travel guides were booked up so if you want to get into some like "Le Bistrot de Venice", book before you go. There are a number of good snack bars, wine shops and mini markets very near the hotel. Use them, they were all good quality and good value. We throughly enjoyed our trip to Venice and would go back to the Ai Mori. However, we would insist on a superior room, probably in the main part of the Hotel. It would be worth you checking the details of the room you could expect in advance, as they are not all of a uniform size. Some are very small. Others very acceptable indeed. Go to Venice and the Ai Mori D'Oriente. Although not everything was perfect for our trip, we loved it and did not stop laughing for the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - and not too hard to find”
Reviews.Author: Imaje
Reviews.Content: a Late review , my parnter and I stayed here last year and I never got around to typing this up. I would highly recommend this hotel it was excellent.Staff helpful and friendly, the room that we were given must have been the best in the hotel ! for a romanic weekend you could not have asked or dreamed for better.We booked at Laterooms and got a suite for over half price ( room overlooking the canels). THIS HOTEL IS A MUST ! next time we visit venice we will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “On a Quiet Side Street er.. Canal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you don't have a map of Venice when you arrive, it should be your first purchase because you can't find this hotel (or make your way around Venice) without one. The hotel is off the beaten path on a quiet canal but only a 2-3 minute walk from the Grand Canal. The room was a great value, clean, large, quiet with an oriental theme. There wasn't much of a view out the window but I wasn't looking for a view. The staff spoke english well. The breakfast was decent but nothing to write home about. I had to call to confirm my water taxi to the airport and, upon checkout, the staff even wrote off the small phone charge (few euros). I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: moween
Reviews.Content: W stayed for 4 nights in a standard room. Our room on the second floor was small but perfectly formed. A view of rooftops from the window but velux windows in the ceiling gave us a view of the starry night sky from our double bed. Gorgeous bathroom, lashings of hot water from the powerful shower, and spotlessly clean. Breakfasts excellent, staff friendly and efficient, decor sumptuous. I'd recommend those on a budget to take a travel kettle etc if you want to enjoy a cuppa with your locally bought goodies whilst resting your weary feet. Cannaregio now feels like 'our' neighbourhood, and it was a joy to wander along it's picturesque waterways discovering it's hidden treasures. Tried a couple of the local restaurants mentioned by other reviewers, but nothing to get excited about. Food in Venice is expensive and you may struggle if you don't care for fish or seafood. We discovered a great little shop a couple of minutes from the hotel, on the left as you enter the campo which takes you along the route to the Rialto. You can buy delicious pre-cooked food for a couple of euros per dish, which you heat up in their microwave and take it back to the hotel to eat! It was the best food we'd had during our stay. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: maizy2004
Reviews.Content: Returned from the Ai Mori d' Oriente Feb. Hotel is exactly as described on the Trip Advisor. It's a little off the tourist area but just a 5 minute walk will get you to the main route from Plaza Roma to Rialto Bridge. We booked an upgrade room and it was well worth it. The bathroom was spotless and so was the bedroom. Breakfast in the morning was continental and was a good standard. Fresh coffee served was also delicious. Just some advice make sure you wear comfortable shoes; you walk for miles. The hotel is actually easier to get to if you walk from the Plaza Roma takes approx 15 minutes. If you do get the Vaporatta nos 51 or 52 it normally stops at the Lido as the end of the journey. If it does don't pay again like we did get on the next boat to continue the journey. Loved the hotel and our trip to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4* Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandrasWorld
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel during the first week of January 2006. Our room was not apart of the main hotel (#413), but we did not find this to be a problem. We were in a building next to it that was joined by a plastic hallway (sounds bad, but it isnâ€™t) Although, we did not have a view from our room we loved it, as it was big, clean and quiet. There were no surprises and it was exactly what we expected (we had read reviews and looked at the website). The bathroom was amazing as it is brand new and spotless. We walked from Piazzle Roma in less than 15 mins. There is no need to get the vaporetto (waterbus), unless you have a lot of luggage. The only problems I can think of (which are minor) was that there was no conditioner included in the toiletries and when we first arrived our beds were pushed together, but made as two separate twins, but the staff quickly rectified this. The breakfast is between 7:00 am â€“ 10:30 am. They are delicious freshly baked croissants, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, the regular assortment of meats and cheese and even pÃ¢tÃ©! I was delighted to discover the fruit salad, which was made of fresh fruit and not that cheap fruit cocktail. The location is perfect and I loved that it was tucked away from the busy crowds. Even though it was low season, the streets still seemed to be packed. Nothing was too far away and we walked everywhere. There is a little grocery store around the corner, where we bought bottled water (â‚¬0.35 or 6 for â‚¬2.00), juice (â‚¬1.18 pack of three) and cookies/snacks (a lot cheaper than the mini bar). When you leave the hotel lobby, turn right and go over the first bridge on the your left. This leads onto Calle del Forno. The store is on the left hand side. We also discovered the perfect little restaurant about 3 mins walk away, which made our stay all the better. Since the food, service and location were perfect, we ended up going there every night once we discovered it. (There are so many things to try on the menu, which is in English too! I was weary at first because the lonely planet guidebook deters restaurants with menus that have English, but this was not a problem.) After a long day of sight seeing we would head back to the hotel to relax for an hour or two then head out for dinner. The restaurant is called the Ristorante Diana (Address: Fondamenta della Misericordia 2519, Cannaregio (turn left outside of the hotel, take first bridge on the right and turn left once you have crossed. It's a few buildings down). It just opened and was only a week old when we dined there. The food is to die for and they do not charge a service or cover charge (we left a huge tip as the food and service was flawless) like all the other restaurants do. The service is friendly and the atmosphere is quaint. My boyfriend loved the complementary shots with the waiter at the end of our meals. Must try the gnocchi with cheese and a pasta dish with seafood and brandy (Canâ€™t remember the name, but itâ€™s the best Italian dish I have ever tasted!) Beware of sandwich shops by the train station. They look packed with meat, but when we went to eat them all the meat was pushed to one side so more then half of the sandwich didnâ€™t have anything in it! I was horrified as it was â‚¬3.70 for a lot of hard ciabatta bread, two small slices of purshuto and a bit of green. This hotel is wonderful and I would definitely stay there again. It is in a quiet part of Venice with everything you need is close by. I recommend Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Joinaman
Reviews.Content: Always wanted to go to venice with the wife. Found special offers with Ryanair for 1p plus taxes and this hotel for 74 euros a night, What a bargain Read all the reviews for this hotel and have to say it lives up to its reputation. We had room 502, on the ground floor near the back, out of the way and no views out of the window, but the room did'nt need them, Comfortable beds, good bathroom, excellent room service, only needs tea and coffe making in the room to finish it off. The staff were always polite and helpfull and the breakfast was more than adequate. The only fault was the prices in the bar, 5.5 euros for a glass of beer, so did not stay long, nice as it was. The position of this hotel, away from the main areas is great, because we walked into areas we would never have seen, and ate and drank with the locals, which was much more fun and cheaper than in the main tourist areas Was suprised to find how easy it was to get around on foot,even if we did get lost a few times, but with a map, you soon find your way again.We only used the water bus to reach the hotel the first day, we walked everywhere after that, even back to the bus station with the bags, only took 15 minutes of easy walking. Would I go back to this hotel - YES Would I recommend it - YES

Reviews.Title: “Flawless stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and booked the Mori through Expedia (better deal than directly through the hotel.) We'd never been to Italy, nevermind Venice, so I was anxious to find the right place. Thanks to Trip Advisor, I certainly did! The hotel is a 5-10 minute walk from the San Marcuola vaparetto stop, which was challenging after a long day travelling, but the map the hotel had sent was perfect, and boy was it worth it just to be a couple of streets away from the main tourist 'artery' through the city towards the Rialto bridge etc. I guess you could always splash out and get a water taxi if walking with luggage were a problem. We paid Â£69 per night bed and breakfast for a superior double room. I had enquired before arrival if a room with a canal view was available and was advised that it was, but at an additional E50 per night, so I had declined it. Upon arrival, Armando at the front desk said he had a surprise for us, and showed us up to our room with a fantastic canal view. WOW, we were thrilled. The hotel is clean, beautifully appointed, the staff are both friendly and helpful, and speak great English. The breakfast is varied, plentiful and fresh, though there were a few unspecifieds in the fruit salad and the capacccino tasted bitter compared to those we had in the little cafes during the day. We always found a table for breakfast without waiting, though it was busy and I don't know what it would be like in high season. The room was spacious and decorated to a high standard. There is a TV with CNN and BBC News, and an English film channel which plays one film all day.(Lost in Translation, Sin City, Meet the Fockers, all fine for a late afternoon rest before supper!) The shower had constant plentiful powerful hot water. We ate in the nearby Antica Mola every night bar one, and it should have been all. It is a family run place and everything we had, apart from the lasagne was fantastic (stick to fish!). We walked everywhere and only used the vaparetto when we went to the islands. Although it looks remote on the map, the location is great, and it literally takes 5 minutes to get onto the busy streets and from there onto wherever you have planned for the day. I would return to this hotel in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ai Mori D'Oriente - Bravissimo!”
Reviews.Author: VegasBling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this four-star hotel December 20 - 21, 2005, through Gate 1 Travel and absolutely LOVED it. Before our trip, I read reviews about this hotel. Overall there were great reviews, but the negative ones concerned me. After my personal experience, I will have to say that this hotel made my romantic Venice trip something I will remember for the rest of my life. The decor was beautiful and the staff was helpful, professional, and accommodating. We can't say nothing but wonderful things about this hotel, its staff and Venice itself. Our room had a review of a small drainage alley (Room #112) but this did not bother us. The room and bathroom are immaculate, and is completely quiet with no noise from the streets or surrounding rooms. My very most favorite part of the room was the bathroom. Gorgeous! The bathroom has 110v outlet, standard Italian outlet, and outlets for other countries. There is a bidet, standard toilet, towel warmer, tub/shower with hand sprayer. There is also a small vanity chair. There is also an emergency pull cord located in the tub area in case assistance is needed. Toiletries included soap, cotton swabs, cotton balls, shampoo, conditioner, and a shower cap. The hotel has a 12 inch color TV with at least 25 stations (3 or 4 in English) and a small free safe. There is a small refrigerator stocked with beverages for sale by the hotel. However, there is enough room for you to place a few things, or you can temporarily remove their items to place your drinks and food items. Some European hotels usually have separate twin beds. Our room had one queen bed - even if it were two beds pushed together, no one fell through any crack. The sheets and towels had the hotel logo on it, and the bed linens were of high thread count - which made the cotton comfortable and restful to sleep on. The breakfast served in the morning is fantastic. There is fresh fruit, several types of bread, two types of cheese, salami, ham, and bologne, cold cereal with milk, various pasteries, various juices and milk. Cappucino, coffee, and tea is included. One review I read complained that there were no eggs for breakfast. Please note that the breakfast I described above is part of the free meal included with the room. There is a menu on all tables in which supplementary items can be ordered for an extra cost. We felt the breakfast was quite appealing, ample, and satisfying. The dining room was cozy, clean, with friendly and accommodating staff. The hotel does offer laudry services, though there is a self laundry about 10 minutes from the hotel (sorry, I can't describe where it is). The hotel is in the Cannaregio District near the Jewish Ghetto. A canal in in front of and behind the hotel. We arrived at the Marco Polo Airport and took a water taxi to our hotel. However, to get to the island of Venice, one can drive, take the train (Trenalia), fly in, or by boat. There are no cars on Venice other than at the portion in the beginning part of the island. Be sure to have luggage with wheels and pack only what is necessary. It is approxiately 15 - 20 minutes walk to St. Mark's Square (San Marcos Square). If you don't mind being in a quieter area away from the hustle and bustle, this is the place to be. With regard to meals, the majority of restaurants close from about 2 p.m. and re-open at approximately 6:30 p.m. Some bars or pizza places may be open. If you want to buy stamps, there are only a few places to buy them (actual Italian post offices). I had read that Tobacco shops (Tabacchi) shops sold stamps but every time I went into one, they told me they didn't sell them. The cost of sending a post card or letter to the United States is 0.80 Euros (at this time of this writing). I have seen post cards as low as 0.20 Euros each to 0.50 Euros each for the same postcards. As someone said in a previous post, is there is a little grocery store in front of the hotel across the bridge. As last words of wisdom, be sure to get Euros from the ATM instead of a foreign exchange company, as you will get a better exchange rate and you will not be charged a high fee to ge the Euro. There will not be anyone to help you with your bags if you are going to the train station or have to move around so have luggage with wheels and bring minimal luggage. Unfortunately, some parts of Europe is not as friendly for those physically challenged, and Venice is one of them. Be prepared to do a lot of walking. I suggest you get books from the Library to research the places you would like to go. Venice is absolutely awesome. You will enjoy it immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Further points”
Reviews.Author: OverTheMoon
Reviews.Content: Nov 2005. Just returned from a 3 day trip to Venice staying at the Mori d'Oriente. Read most of the reviews here before travel. Have the folowing points to add. As advised, we bought the 3 day ACTV passes (72 hours from the moment you start using the pass)at 22 euros, and found them to be of good value if you like to hop on and off the Vaporetto often. We didn't use them that much on the first day because we arrived late and we did a lot of walking, but we more than made up for their uses in the next 2 days. The Tourist Information booth from which we bought our passes did not accept credit card. We had to pay by cash. We also followed the advice from here and bought 2 Alilaguna tickets from Marco Polo airport to arrive at Venice by water. It was certainly a different experience, and I would recommend doing it once. However, the service was infrequent with only 1 sailing per hour, so prepare to wait. You should take the BLU line which takes 38 minutes to get you to Fondamente Nove. Get alight there and walk a few yards to the next pier (look for the ACTV sign, and validate your ticket). Take a number 41 Vaporetto and (Maddona del) Orto is the next stop. For the return trip to the airport, we use the bus. We took a Vaporetto from Orto to Piazzale Roma and took a D5 (orange)bus to the airport. Since the orange bus was run by ACTV, the 3-day pass was valid on it. The trip took about 15 minutes and terminated just outside the airport. Apart from saving 10 Euros, we found the bus trip pleasant and fast, provided you do not have a lot of luggage. The hotel was almost as good as was described here. Staff were helpful, spoke perfect English. Room was clean and well equipped apart from lack of tea/coffee making facility. A well-stocked minibar if you're so inclined. However, a snack size pringle will set you back by 2.5 Euros. So you will be better off to get your snacks from a small supermarket just across the canal in Calle del Forno (1 minute's walk). The hotel is served by two vaporetto stops - Orto (3-4 minute's walk) in the north and S. Marcuola (6-7 minute's walk) in the south. In between the two stops and along the length of the island lies the main street. We spent many happy hours walking up and down this main street route from the hotel to Rialto, then onward to Piazza San Marco. The route is lined with numerous shops and eateries, a few churches and a few squares. The closer you get to San Marco, the grander are the shops. There are a lot of road signs around the area, so if you get yourself familiar with a few names such as Rialto, S. Marco, P. Roma, and their relative locations. You should be able to find your way round. Before the trip, I read about how expensive it was to eat in Venice. I am glad to report differently. You can eat quite well and quite cheaply. The key is "menu turistico" (tourist menu). You can find a menu turistico in the S Marco area for 16-18 Euros. We found one nearer to the hotel for 11 Euros. For that, you can have a seafood pasta starter, a grill sole main course, and a side salad or french fries. I think this is fantastic value, as I can remember recently spending twice that amount in a similiar setting restuarant in the suburb of Paris. The eatery is Trattoria da Mimo,located on Rio terra San Leonardo, about 5 minute's walk from the hotel. I believe if you pick a tourist menu at any restaurant, the coperato (bread and cover charge) is waived. The hotel offers a complementary boat service to the Island of Murano- famous for its glass-blowing industry. We had a water-taxi specially came and picked us up at the hotel, so we had the enjoyment of riding a water-taxi without the cost, right? But there is no free lunch in this world. At the factory, we were assigned a sale-rep to help us with our purchase. Although he kept saying there was no obligations to buy, the pressure was on. The design and quality of the exhibits were amazingly good with price to match. We ended up buying a glass-mosaic display bowl for 150 euros. Venice is a fascinating place, and November, in my opinion, is a good time to visit it when the place is not so packed with visitors and good hotels such as Mori d'oriente are running special offers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop in Italy. The only problem was that our flight was delayed by hours and we didn't arrive into Venice until near past midnight. Finding the Ai Mori d'Oreinte wasn't an easy task (especially with the streets set up the way they are). We ended up going into another hotel to help us find out where the Ai Mori was located. We took a water taxi $40 euros (what a rip off) to the location. If you stay in Venice long enough you'll figure out the streets and location, but being that we travelled for well over 24 hours it wasn't that great to get lost. My best advice is to call and ask for clear directions to the hotel because dragging luggage through the streets of Venice isn't fun. The breakfast was the best breakfast in Italy out of all the hotels we stayed at. The staff was very cordial and friendly. Venice is a beautiful city and it was definitely worth the 4 days we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Returning to the Ai Mori”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ai Mori during Carnival 2005 and just loved it. I loved the location. It was such a pleasant walk back to the hotel every evening and remember in February it was pretty cold! The breakfast was great - it easily carried us to lunch if not beyond. I am tired of leaving hotels hungry and having to buy food a short time later. The hotel was spotless and well cared for, the decoration sumptious the staff polite and non-intrusive. My only disappointment was that we were given a standard room when we had paid for a deluxe room through Expedia(-). When we pointed this out we were told that sometimes rooms were sold as deluxe on websites even though the price was for a standard room. (I am afraid I did not believe that one!) We paid approx â‚¬1500 for 7 nights. We were told they had no deluxe rooms that night but that they would investigate the matter and hopefully move us to a deluxe the following day which they did. I must say that the standard room was lovely but we had paid for the bigger room. They sent us a bottle of prosecco to compensate, though I must say we got no refund on the price difference. That being said we did not ask for one but I feel they should they have offered themselves. This review is a tad late but the comments are still valid. We are going on a cruise from Venice next year and the Ai Mori is one of the pre-cruise hotels to choose from and without hesitation we have chosen it for a couple of nights before our journey. I don't think Venice would be the same without a stay at the Ai Mori. Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in an Out-of-the-Way Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked my stay at the Ai Mori D'Oriente based on Trip Advisor reviews and further internet research, and I was not disappointed. The location is lovely, not smack dab in the middle of the tourist zones, but instead within a living, breathing neighborhood. Hotel was very easy to get to, a pleasant short walk from 2 vaporetto stops. Property was attractive, room was very clean, comfortable and beautifully decorated, with a spacious marble tiled bathroom, front desk and bar service was friendly and courteous, breakfast buffet was varied and delicious. There are some very nice local restaurants in the area if you don't care to go back into the center of town for dinner. Although I traveled with a business coleague, the Ai Mori d'Oriente would be an ideal hotel for a couple and perfect for honeymooners. However, if you are the kind of person who wants to be in the center of all the noise and activity, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly and spoke great English. The rooms were sort of small, but not too bad for European standards. The decor was nice--beautiful woodwork throughout the room. The only complaint with the room is that we could hear everything from the hallway and had very noisy middle-aged, drunk neighbors who woke us up when they got in at 2am. Not really the hotel's fault, and my husband asked them to quiet down, and they were polite and did so. The breakfast buffet in the morning was great. The area of Venice is away from the main tourist attractions which was something we liked. The quiet streets of Venice at night are amazing. This hotel was definitely worth the stay. Look for deals on Orbitz.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the loveliest find on our Honeymoon. We did a 4 centre tour of Italy and this hotel was perfect. It is in an easy to find location not too far from the railway station, the maps from the tourist office make it easy to find. The hotel is well decorated with a lovely bar and nice little touches such as a daily weather card put in your room when the beds are turned down. Well away from the tack and bustle of more centrally located hotels I can recommend this as a great base for exploring Venice.

Reviews.Title: “lovely but inconvenient hotel [continued]”
Reviews.Author: paulfromnaples
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights from 9/13-16. We had a large room in the new wing and found it to be very comfortable and well equipped with a large bathroom and nice amenities. The hotel is in the Canareggio sector, a short walk to the Jewish Ghetto where we took a very interesting tour. It is about a 15 minute walk to the train station, 20 minutes to the Rialto, 30 minutes to the Accademia, and about 40 minutes to San Marco. Because it was very hot and humid when we were there, we did not use the vaporetto after one ride as it took about an hour to go to San Marco and then we would begin our walks. Also, on a hot humid day the vaporetto ride felt all too much like a subway ride in NYC in rush hour in the summer--not too pleasant and SRO. There are a few reasonably good restaurantsa close by, but for the most part you need to walk at least 15-20 minutes to get to most places to eat. The staff of the hotel was very nice and helpful. The breakfasts were fine. I'm not sure what the writers who dissed the breakfasts were expecting; we found the selection reasonably good, considering the room rates and the high costs in Venice. We attended a performance at a scuola grande of "Cosi fan tutti" which was very reasonably priced for Venice and enjoyed the Tiepello museum tour which preceded the performance. The opera is a shortened version with costumed singers but no sets. It is done in a very small room in a 17th century baroque setting that was quite stunning. And while otyhers were dressed as if they were attending a performance at La Scala, I wore shorts knowing that it would be very hot in the room. It was! The singers were very good. Highly reccommended! Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would return except for the long distances to most of the places that we wanted to visit. If the hotel had its own taxi/shuttle to San Marco or Accademia, we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amicus1945
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Mori d'Oriente for three wonderful days. It's perfectly located in a more residential area which provides one with a reprive from the tourist crush around the Grand Canal. The water bus is just a short walk away that takes you past a lovely church and charming neighborhood. The staff is excellent -- cheerful, helpful and accomodating. Our triple room was most comfortable (no cots here...a lovely third bed). The walls were silk covered and tastefully decorated to reflect the Moorish theme of the hotel (I don't recall any curtains on the hall walls!). The bathroom was immaculate and stocked with Etro products! The breakfast was very good and in keeping with the usual European fare. A few days we opted for breakfast in our large room to enjoy the quiet of the morning hour. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely return on my next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: TheSmurfster
Reviews.Content: This is an above average hotel even for 4 * accomadation. The staff on arrival and throughout our stay for my wife and I were extremely helpful and friendly. The only bad point was that when we got to our room the bed (even though we are married) was two singles put together but the beds were also made seperately and pushed together. However the hotel policy is that you ring and ask to have it made as a double. Seems weird for the most romantic city in the world (in our opinion). The room however was of an excellent standard and very luxurious with all the mod cons. The location of the hotel is excellent on the outskirts of the main inner city by one canal lane (so more secluded and quiet) but still an easy walk (about 15 minutes) to the main San Marcos square (or a boat ride). The only other slightly bad thing was that the breakfast was fairly good (continental but not too much choice for the rating). However the staff who served breakfast seemed very grumpy especially the head waiter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glenkinchie
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I thought this hotel was excellent. It is in a quiet part of Venice away from the bustle of St Mark's Square and it was a relief to get back to it after a trip to the centre. We chose the hotel after reading the many reviews posted on Trip Advisor, all of which we found very useful. The review posted on Mar 22, 2005 by a TripAdvisor Member, Bristol, Uk was particularly useful. This review provided directions on getting from the Airport etc. Another review recommended eating at the Osteria Bea Vita which we found to be excellent and would have no hesitation in recommending. We stayed in a deluxe double room (No.103) which was great although the Bathroom was on the small size. The Hotel staff were excellent. We booked throught Venere and the price of 250E per night reflected the fact we were visiting in September.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great service”
Reviews.Author: climbingkershaw
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at the Al Moroi d,Oriente for our 30th wedding anniversary. Our room overlooking the canal (102) was everything I expected from this class of hotel and the service was outstanding

Reviews.Title: “This was our own little corner of paradise in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ohkidohki
Reviews.Content: Venice can be a crowded, dirty, overpriced, disappointing place to visit - or you can stay at a the Mori D'Oriente and get away from the crowds - but enjoy the beauty of Venice. There are a number of wonderful little restaurants right around the corner from the Mori. Our room was AMAZING - one of the few rooms overlooking the Canal. It was 3x the size of other rooms we've stayed at in Europe. The bar was a nice retreat from an impromptu thunderstorm. The breakfast was acceptable - typical European fare - meat, cheese, bread and fruit. The staff was overwhelmingly accomodating and friendly. They really took care of us - and remembered our room number every time we came to the desk for our key - without us having to ask. I would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends. WARNING: It is quite a walk to St. Marks square (20-30 minutes unless you get lost and then its 1-2 hours) - but who spends all their time in Venice at St. Mark's square anyway? Ahhhh . . . . Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for start of our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ai Mori D'Oriente purely from its ranking and reviews on tripadvisor and of course its own lovely website. Wow, it exceeded expectations. I had already upgraded us to a "junior suite" as it was our honeymoon and couldnt have chosen a more perfect location. On a lovely quiet Fondamenta canal, the hotel is everything it says - very nice plush decor and very clean. Our suite was called a junior because it didnt actually have a seperate lounge room, just a large bedroom with tabel, chairs and chaise longue. But best of all, the shutters opended directly onto the canal - perfect! Waking up in the morning, opening the shutters and dozing to the sounds of the canal waking up was wonderfu. The staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful. Best of all were the breakfasts - huge range of filled croissants and bread, juices, yoghurts, hams, cheese, cereals, fruit etc along with your own pot of gorgeous coffee or hot chocolate. Location of the hotel was perfect for us, we liked the quiet canal and the very pleasant walk to the rialto/san marco areas - no more than 15 mins. I would FAR prefer to stay in Canareggio to the busy touristy areas which are very busy and crowded. There are also some very good canal front restaurants within 5 mins of the hotel. Nearest stop (orto) is only 5 minutes walk so handy to catch the waterbus or get to hotel from airport. We cannot wait to return to the hotel and hopefully to the same room if we can afford. Our experience was "made" by that canal view room and I'm so glad I did it. Can't really comment on the standard rooms as we didnt see any but they are probably quite small though beautifully decorated. Its probably the best hotel either of us have ever stayed in and we wouldn't hesitate in recommending it - especially Room 102 to honeymooners! It was a very special stay and we loved the slippers and hotel robes and little extras that easily make this a 4 star+ hotel. A Bellini from the bar downstairs sat out in the sun by the canal before a walk into the centre and a gondola on the grand canal was about as good as it gets. Just wish you could have a honeymoon more often!!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Gazzer1501
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a birthday treat for my partner's 50th birthday after reviewing many of the glowing tributes that previous guests had left on this website. I am delighted to say that we weren't disappointed when we stayed between 14-20 August 05. The hotel is located in a quiet part of Venice to the NW of the city in a mainly residential district. It was great to be able to come back from the crowds around the usual tourist haunts of San Marco Piazza, Rialto Bridge etc. and have predominantly peace and tranquility to enjoy. A great location for easily accessing the vaporretta. The Madonna D'Orte stop is approx 5 - 10 min walk from the hotel and you can then catch numerous water buses in either direction around the island. A good tip for those travelling to the island from the airport is to catch the Alilaguna water bus to the Fondamente Nove stop and then get the 41/51 (could be 42/52 -check the direction) to the Madonna D'Orte stop. Its about 30 mins from the airport and one of the cheapest modes of transport to get to the hotel. The journey back to the airport is the reverse of above. Our room (no.3) in the hotel was a deluxe double on the ground floor. The room was designated as a disabled persons room with a shower room type arrangement for the bathroom. Be careful, you need to ensure the shower curtain is completely shut around you otherwise you 'flood' the bathroom floor! The finishes and furniture were were sumptuous and of ancient Turkish style. The bed was comfortable although we could have done with a little more storage space than that on offer. One slight disadvantage of this room is it is located next to the automatic opening door leading to the hotel room blocks to the rear of the property. So you do hear the door opening when you are in the room, which can be a little disturbing at night - but you get used to it. Breakfast is a limited cold continental buffet, with extra hot dishes available at an extra cost from the inclusive breakfast rate. The dining room is pleasant and the staff are attentative and friendly and most of them speak good english and engage with the guests - a nice personal touch that goes a long way for me when assessing quality of service. All in all a very good choice for those that like the finer things in life and are not put off by the relative remote location to the main areas. We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone and stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Gives you a chance to see another side of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: da_fly
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, tastefully decorated in moorish style, very helpful and friendly staff, luxurious facilities, good-sized room and excellent breakfasts. It's in a part of Venice that you probably wouldn't venture to on a short break, unless you were staying there, but it's great because you feel like it's undiscovered and all the more special for it. Only 15 mins walk from the main sights, or 5 mins to the nearest vaporetto stop. Cannaregio is an atmospheric, haunting part of town at night (we were the only ones walking around at about 11pm but it was FREEZING in January) and enchanting by day. You really won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alaskaitaly
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely, comfortable stay at the Ai Mori d'Oriente. I find the Cannaregio area to be best for me. It is quiet, away from the vast crowds of the San Marco areas but only a 15 minute walk to be right in the middle of all of the "action". It is only a 5 minute walk to get to the vaporetto that will take you to the train station or San Marco, Rialto Bridge, or anywhere else for that matter. There is a small grocery just across the little bridge from the front of the hotel. You can miss it-so ask or keep a sharp eye. There are a couple of good restaurants right down the street, with tables next to the canal. One serves wonderful fresh fish and seafood and is much better priced than other restaurants closer to the center. The staff at the hotel speak excellent English and were helpful. When I had difficulty with my internet card, there was no argument, just an immediate assurance that they would take the charge off my bill. The breakfast is good. Not great or exciting-but good. The service at the breakfast buffet is excellent-with smiling, helpful servers-a welcome aspect to early morning. My bed was a double size bed-and was only one bed-not two pushed together. I found the bedding and the bed to be quite comfortable. I also was thrilled to find that they have a free movie channel where they play two English speaking movies which titles change daily, as well as CNN and BBC. The room was a bit on the small side but well decorated. There was a feeling/atmosphere that it was a small, boutique hotel. The air conditioning was great-and as Venice was experiencing record high temps-a big plus! The marble bathroom was lovely and had excellent water pressure for a strong shower. I did find that the hotel gave me a better room rate than any of the major hotel sales companies: i.e. Hotels, Expedia, etc. My only disappointment is the internet accessibility. The hotel has one computer in a small room off the lobby where you can connect to the internet AFTER buying a prepaid card. In this day and age, more should be done to provide WIFI/free access. Because I live in Italy, I am well aware that unlimited ADSL can be provided for less than 60 euro a month here...Just seems like a 4/5 star hotel could easily provide the service. But, with that said, I will certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms and helpful staff, quiet location on a canal and excellent breakfasts. The pavements were clean and local restaurants all served good food and were value for money. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & atmospheric”
Reviews.Author: natster74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon in June & loved this hotel. It was on a tranquil, atmospheric canal with a couple of fantastic trattorias within 5 minutes walk. The room was on the small side but the decor was immaculate. Everything looked newly refurbished (but in a classic style). It felt really luxurious & the staff were very friendly & helpful. Quite expensive, but this is to be expected in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the cosiness of this place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights here in Jun 05. We were looking for something quiet, relaxed and a little away from the noise of the centre but with some style and comfort and this place fitted the bill very well. Sumptuous wood panelling and brass make the foyer, bar and rooms warm and welcoming. Our room was new, spacious and cool in the heat of the day. Breakfast was also good for a continental hotel with more than just the usual ham, cheese and croissants. The location suited us fine, about 15 minutes stroll from the centre but next to two of the best restaurants in Venice (don't confuse best and posh: we sat on rickety tables on the pavement beside the canal but that's the way they do it and the food was superb) The staff were friendly and very accommodating for non-Italian speakers, booking taxis and restaurants. All in all the place has a relaxed sense of class and we realy didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!! Except for the bed, that is...”
Reviews.Author: ckp
Reviews.Content: Like others before us, our main complaint about the hotel was the bed. Or, shoud I say beds. My husband especially hated them. As mentioned in previous reviews, the "king" bed was actually two separately made twin beds pushed together, making it very difficult to snuggle and very easy to end up stuck in the crack!! In all other aspects, however, the hotel was excellent. Great service. Quiet. Excellent breakfast -- even for my ever-hungry husband! Great coffee, too! The decor was beautiful and the location was perfect for us. It is a little bit of a walk in order to get to the more touristy spots of town, but no more than 15 minutes. We felt that the location gave us a perfect excuse to explore a different part of town. As for Venice itself, I can't believe I missed seeing this place on my last visit to Italy!!! What an incredible place. Pictures don't do it justice. It's just a place you simply have to go and see for yourself! The vaparetto system is simple and a perfect way to sightsee for a low price! We bought the 3-day Venice card and definitely got our money's worth. What a wonderful form of public transportation -- it sure beats the metro or bus in any other town!!! The city was even beautiful in the rain. I can't wait to go back someday!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the Ai Mori d'Oriente”
Reviews.Author: profruth
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 4-day stay at this hotel. I recommend this hotel highly. The room was a decent size and was nicely decorated. I found the beds to be quite comfortable and the air conditioned worked great. Breakfast was good with an excellent selection to choose from. The staff was always helpful and readily available. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Love Ai Mori d'Oriente, if you've got good legs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The rooms are smaller than we are used to in the States, but this is Europe. The decor and furnishings are top shelf. The staff are very curtious and attentive, plus, they spoke excellent English, which made things lots easier for me as my Italian is way poor. The breakfast offerings were excellent. We tended to get back to the hotel late and enjoyed a nightcap at the small hotel bar. The bar tender in his tuxedo reminded us of the Captain on the Loveboat, more in bearing than appearance or behavior. They are located in quiet area of Cannaregio, which has good and bad points. The good: quiet, relaxed neighborhood, several nice, quaint restaraunts in the area set tables out on the Fondementa where you can enjoy a nice meal away from the tourist mayhem of the Rialto and Piazza San Marco. The bad: its far away from the main attractions you'll want to see in Venice. If you are a strong walker, this is not so bad. You can walk to Rialto in about 15 minutes. About the same to Fondamenta Nove and Ferrovia (train station), and it is some of the most scenic walking you'll ever do. If you don't like to walk you either need to hike to the Vaporetto (scenic but slow, you kill an hour) or call for a water taxi (quicker, but expensive). This was the third Italian hotel we stayed at, and all the double beds were truly doubles--two beds pushed together--but this was the only hotel where the beds are made up like two singles. The sheets were tucked into the crack in the middle, and the beds separated easily. At the other hotels the beds were sheeted like doubles and didn't separate. Here, a person could fall in the crack and get hurt. It almost happened to me! Still, I loved our three-night stay here. For myself, I'd go back there tomorrow. My wife doesn't walk so well, and if she is with me, I'd look for someplace more centrally located, maybe between Rialto and San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel. The room decor is atmospheric without being oppressive. The neighborhood was quiet but had several restaurants within walking distance that were reasonably priced and good. Vaporetto stops were about 10 minutes away in both directions. There was a market closeby and a busy throughfare with shops and restaurants about ten minutes away. The breakfast room was lovely and the staff most accomodating. The air conditioning worked great! I admit the shower door was a little tricky--hard to not splash water. The handheld shower seemed to work better with this arrangement. We booked directly through the hotel and got a reasonable rate for prime season in Venice. Took a water taxi to the airport from the front door of the hotel--what a treat. Expensive but what a way to leave Venice. It is a glorious city with many things to occupy you for days! Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my wife here as a 3 night treat at the end of May and was not dissapointed. Just after I booked, I read the bad review that was posted on here ( the only one I found anywhere!!) and it made me worry. I had no reason to worry though. This Hotel was as good as all the other reviews said and well worth the 5 circles rating on here. The street was clean and really peaceful. The bar at the hotel (inside or on the street by the pretty canal) is brilliant and the service there ( as in the whole of the hotel ) was top quality. The bed was 2 single mattresses but they was inside a double frame (very typical of European hotels) They were the same height, comfy, attached together and in no way could come apart or felt different than a double bed really. We can be quite fussy in terms of hotels but this hotel was clean and the staff were great - helpful, polite and professional. The standard double was a good size with really high ceilings. The aircon worked well and was a great relief from the 30c heat outside! The TV has Eurosport, CNBC, BBC News, CNN, and an exclusively English speaking film channel in addition to another film channel (sometimes dubbed) and many other foreign channels The location also did not dissapoint. It is not in the centre of the tourist trap and this is a good thing. It is only a few minutes walk to the nearest Vaporetto stop (which is the best way to get around anyway) and that can take you anywhere you need to be. There are some great restaurants nearby (our favourite was sitting outside in the courtyard at Al Bacco, Fondamenta Capuzine) From the directions on here, and the website, we had no problems finding the hotel although is worth taking a map though just in case (one of the bridges was closed when we arrived and we had to take a slight detour). One final top tip is that there is a small supermarket very near for things like water etc. - Go out the front doors, turn right, over the first bridge (on the left) and straight on down the alley ahead of you, and it is on the left hand side. ( you will only see it when it is open as it draws the shutters when it is not) Sorry for the length of this post but we had such a great time here, I wanted to encourage others to do the same! In case it is helpful, we are in our late 20s.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharW
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Hotel Ai Mori d'Oriente. Everyone was very friendly and the hotel was beautiful. A great hotel for it's price. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. We will definitely be back here.

Reviews.Title: “It could be better if near the terminal station”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in this hotel in mid April. It is located at a quite corner. I encountered some difficulties to locate the hotel when I reached there late night. But not too bad after a helpful waiter gave me some directions. About the price - 165Euro/night. I think is average in Venice. Venice hotel prices are always on the high side. About the room - If you are given room 401, REJECT and CHANGE the room! My first night is in this room. This is a room which is "detached" from the main hotel building. I got drenched in the rain while walking to my room from the lobby. (It was raining on my first day there). The room door is just next to the a door leading to a alley. It is still very cold in mid April, with the raining, it is worst. This room is SO cold that I could not sleep. I have to turn on the shower, and filled the tub with hot water in order to warm the room. The floor is not even carpeted, no slippers provided. I logged a complaint on the second day and wish to get the room change. The front desk's said that hotel is full, but later the hotel manager called and I got a room change into the "main hotel building". However, I had to say the rooms(both rooms I have been to), are very clean and nice, almost flawless. I think this is a very new hotel. About the breakfast - Spread is OK, waiters are nice. The freshly baked crossiant smells and tastes good too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: krispycruiser
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Italy for spring break with my 14 yr old daughter, my co-worker and her 16 yr old daughter. Venice was the first stop on our Venice, Florence, Rome vacation. I booked all of my hotels on the internet so I was a little apprehensive about how the room would look compared to the photos. We arrived at this hotel on March 12th for a 2 night stay. The lobby was very nice and tastefully decorated so I had a good feeling, when we entered our room it was beautiful (I got hugs from everyone on this one). The decor was warm and appealing with an "Oriental" flair (but not too much). There was an armoire with a room safe, small fridge with honors bar/snacks, desk and small TV. The marble bathroom was spacious and along with the room, spotlessly clean. We had complimentary breakfast every morning in the dining area with a cold breakfast which included fresh meats/cheese, breads, cereal, yogurt, fresh squeezed orange juice and other items. Everything was fresh and delicious. We walked to all of our sightseeing expeditions completely captivated by our surroundings. The staff was friendly and helpful and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “...book today and enjoy your holidays!”
Reviews.Author: Federica
Reviews.Content: I am from Venice and yes, I can assure you that this is one of those places where you really want to stay to enjoy La Serenissima at its best. Cannareggio is a very charming Sestriere, quiet but still not too far away from all main tourist attraction. You will simply benefit from being in a quiet area at night. The location is excellent: it takes no more than a 15 minutes walk to get to the hotel (with a slow pace) from the railway station: there is no need to take any transportation mean, really, unless you have a lot of very bulky , heavy luggage or feel extremely tired. We booked our room via Expedia and got a very convenient rate, breakfast included. Breakfast itself was nothing to scream about but it was certainly much better than what you would normally get in most 4 star hotels in Italy. Our room was very clean, spacious and with all the amenities you might wish for in a sophisticated Byzantine silk style. Every detail was just perfect. ....donâ€™t' look any further, just book today and enjoy your holidays! Federica

Reviews.Title: “a taste of luxury at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: tourist05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ai Mori D'oriente in Venice in the second week of March 2005. We chose it based on Tripadvisor review comments, and were not disappointed. The front desk staff we dealt with spoke very fluent English, were always courteous, offered maps of the city and information on tours at check-in, and wake up calls and vaporetto transportation information as requested. The location of the hotel proved to be very fortunate for us; it is not only a short walk from the Madonna del Orto vaporetto stop (vaporetto numbers 51/52) but Canareggio as a district was both quiet and full of the kind of retail establishments that made our walks pleasant and interesting. We saw the side canals near the hotel being used in a way that we had not thought of.. specially equipped boats to transport garbage and laundry from the homes and the hotels in the district. Walking was no problem no matter where we went. It had snowed in Venice two days before we arrived and there was plenty of it on the ground; it was somewhat strange to see a big part of Piazza San Marco (in the shade) under a sheet of ice while we walked in bright sunshine. Our room (Room 1) was equipped for service for the disabled, was quite spacious and overlooked a private courtyard. We found the bedcovers always turned down when we returned to our room each evening... a nice touch. The room could best be described as sumptuous, decorated in a Middle Eastern style in warm red and orange colours. According to the history of the hotel, at one time the building housed Turkish traders who were part of the important maritime activity in Venice. The complimentary breakfast was served in a spacious room off the main lobby and was extremely generous: meat, cheese, fruit, crossoint, cereal. fruit juice, and our favourite hot drink, Earl Grey tea. Food in Venice is a bit more expensive than in other big cities in Italy, and the hotel breakfast gave us a good start to our day. With light snacks during the day, we could easily manage till dinner time. We considered the hotel extremely good value for the Euro 85 price we prepaid in US dollars. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ai Mori d'Oriente”
Reviews.Author: Italy05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend further to tripadvisor reviews. Would recommend. Friendly, efficient staff. Nice, comfortable, clean rooms with nice extras like robes, slippers etc. In a residental area (Cannaregio) so feels a bit more real that more central areas. Best way to arrive is to get bus to Pizzale Roma and waterbus to Madonna del Orto. Restaurant few doors down - Anice Stellato- is very nice and reasonable, but should reserve a table.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: JohnandSandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in Feb.05 and found it definitely of four start quality with attractive rooms, quiet location and easy walk to the sights of Venice. Their breakfast was ample with good quality and selection in a pleasant setting. Location was in a normal family neighborhood near a main vaporetto station and within an easy 10-15 min. walk to the train station. Would really recommend this clean, attractive little hotel. The staff was very friendly and quick to help with any questions or requests.

HotelInfo.Name: Ai Mori d'Oriente Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Fondamenta Della Sensa Cannaregio 3319, 30121 Venice, Italy
